loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is married with four grown children: a son, three daughters and six grandkids. Her whole family lives in Nadvirna, Western Ukraine. She offers various goods for sale. Ganna owns two vending kiosks at two different local markets – central marketplace and farming supply market. Moreover, she has just bought a small store in a village to offer fresh produce to residents of that neighborhood. Ganna started small about 20 years ago. She worked hard to keep her business running. Lending services have helped her grow and expand her small venture. Currently, Ganna has about 30,000 Grivnyas in the vending business. Her net monthly profit is about 6,000 Grivnyas.  

Ganna is requesting a loan of 16,000 Grivnyas to purchase mineral fertilizer wholesale for further retail sale at one of her vending locations. She has much experience working in the sphere of trade and commerce for over 37 years. After Ganna retired, she ventured to launch her small vending business and hasn’t been sorry about it. Today her business is the main source of income for her family and kids. 

On the photo, Ganna is pictured at one of her vending locations where she offers clothing items for retail sale.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mahkam

texts.en:
S. Mahkam is 25 years old and he lives in the Istaravshan region of Tajikistan. He is married and has two children. He is engaged, as are many in Istaravshan, in the livestock business and milk processing. In addition, he trades in house wares in the local bazaar. In summer time, he trades in melons. He has been a repeat client of MicroInvest since 2007. He is happy to continue his co-operation with “Arvand”. Mahkam is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 1200 STJ for two months for the seasonal melon business, importing and selling big melons. He thanks KIVA for small business development and entrepreneur support. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”.

“Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest”, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: To buy seasonal melons

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells eggs. Esther is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more eggs to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with two grown sons. She is a small entrepreneur from Berdyansk, where she works in the local marketplace called Privoz selling women’s outerwear clothing. Valentina usually purchases her exclusive merchandise wholesale in Russia, which helps her stay competitive among all the other clothes vendors. She always tries to balance quality and pricing and it attracts many potential customers to her kiosk.  

Valentina has been in the market for 12 years. Presently, she has about 20,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas a month. This time Valentina is requesting a 12,100 Grivnya loan as additional funding for further development of her trade. She loves working with this type of inventory and is seeing herself working in this niche of trade in the future.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells cosmetics and hair extensions. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cosmetics and hair extensions to sell. Fumilayo is 30 years old and married to K., who is a taxi driver. They have two children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Atsu

texts.fr: Atsu M. est cultivateur du riz à Avetonou. Agé de 49 ans, il est marié et père de 5 enfants. il souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des engrais pour accroître son rendement et aussi engager des métayers pour élargir son espace cultivable. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Atsu M. is a rice grower in Avetonou. He is 49 years old, married, and the father of five. He would like to use this loan to buy fertilizers to increase his yields and also to hire sharecroppers, in order to expand his arable land. He is counting in this opportunity to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Marufat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Маруфат  Махкамова  1965 года рождения, разведенная,   имеет 2 детей. Маруфат проживает в Зафарабадском районе. Около двух лет Маруфат торгует на рынке детской одеждой, которую привозит из Кыргызстана. Маруфат кредитуется у нас не в первый раз, прежде получив кредиты, она наладила свою торговую деятельность и стала получать хорошую прибыль. Маруфат одна из примерных клиентов нашей организации. Снова подав заявку на получение кредита, она   планирует расширить свой товарооборот. Запрашиваемая  сумма - 3500 сомони.
texts.en:
Marufat M. was born in 1965. She is divorced and has two children. Marufat lives in the Zafarabad district of Sogd region. For about two years, Marufat has been selling children's clothes, which she obtains in Kyrgyzstan, at the local market. This will not be Marufat's first loan from MLF "MicroInvest." She received loans in the past which helped her get started in business and earn a good profit. Marufat is one of MLF's model clients. She has applied for a new loan of 3500 somoni in order to expand her sales volume.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand sales volume

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells smoked fish and ice fish. She has been in this business for a long time. Florence hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more cartons of fish to sell. Florence is a 55 years old widow with three children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of fish

loans.name: Utkur

texts.en:
U. Utkur is 18 years old and lives in Istaravshan region of Tajikistan. Utkur has been engaged in commercial service and trade for the last four years. He started helping with his mother's business of selling underwear when he was studying in school. Today he trades separately from his mother and has his own business turnover. It is not enough so Utkur is applying to Kiva for the business-development loan of 1200 STJ for six months. 

Utkur wants to import underwear from a Chinese underwear-making factory together with his friend. He wants to apply as the partner. It permits him to increase the business turnover and to take the next business-development step. Day to day he may increase business turnover and to enlarge the existing business. He thanks Kiva for supporting small entrepreneurs and small-business development.   

MLF MicroInvest is one of the leading microfinance organizations rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. MLF MicroInvest sees the next step in its development as a transformation into a micro-loan deposit-taking organization. Therefore in October 2008, MLF MicroInvest together with Frontiers LLC founded the micro-loan deposit-taking organization Arvand LLC.

Arvand, being an assignee of MLF MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission: to improve the standard of living of the population by creating new opportunities for social and economic development. It does this by providing qualitative financial and technical services to the entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: To import underwear

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Phe Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank, located in Sdau Kanlaeng in Kandal, plans to use the loan they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Koem P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the bank's 12 members. She is a housewife who is a good cook for her family. Her husband, Mr. Chey Mun, is a construction worker. Mrs. Koem P. is requesting a loan to have a ceremony when her child enters a monastery. She is 51 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while two others are construction workers. The remaining one attends the local school.

loans.use: To have a ceremony when her child enters a monastery.

loans.name: Ankatoallama 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix femmes du groupe Ankatoallama 1 sont toutes mariées et  résident à Soromana, un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba, dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali.  Elles ont  une moyenne d’age de 32 ans,  4 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Elles  ont fait plusieurs cycles en prêt solidaire ( prêt de groupe) et tous ces prêts ont été bien remboursés. Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne (prêt agricole),qui correspond avec leur activité primaire, étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne et les trois précédents ont été biens remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semence, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles exploitent 18  hectares d’arachide avec  une production moyenne estimée à 3 tonnes l’hectare soit 54 tonnes.
Toute la récolte sera vendue, après qu’elle est eu de la valeur, à une clientèle riche et variée, au comptant surtout.
Le bénéfice généré de  la vente sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du  prêt, la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales (les frais scolaire, de santé) et acheter les trousseaux de mariages des filles.
texts.en:
The ten women in the Anakatoallama 1 loan group are all married and reside in Saromana, a village in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondieba, in the third region (Sikasso), Republic of Mali. They are, on average, 32 years of age, with 4 children and live within polygamist families. They know each other through family and neighborhood ties. They have made numerous group loans and all of these loans have been repaid. Their primary activity of these country women is farming and they have seized the opportunity by borrowing and now repaying their fourth farm loan. Their three previous loans were all successfully repaid. They plan to use this new loan to pay for labour costs, weeding, seed, fertilizer and herbicide. They manage 18 hectare of peanut plants, with a harvest averaging 3 tonnes (metric tons) per hectare, totaling 54 tonnes. The entire crop will be sold, after its value is established, to a varied and wealthy clientele for cash. The profit generated from the sale will be used to meet the loan payments, manage certain household expenses (school and health costs) and buy wedding trousseau(s) for their daughters.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for labour costs, seed, fertilizer, herbicide and weeding costs

loans.name: Davy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Davy S. is the group leader of six members who all live in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is a 30-year-old housewife who takes care her four children. Two of her kids are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Mrs. Davy S.'s husband, Mr. Suon Sokha, is a car repairman who needs more materials to work effectively. Thus, Mrs. Davy S. decided to ask for a loan for her husband’s purpose. They hope to increase income and improve his work with this loan.  

One member in this loan group has an end-of-term loan while the rest have monthly payment loans. No members are required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more car materials for her husband's work.

loans.name: Ankatoallama 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix femmes du groupe Ankatoallama  2 sont toutes mariées et  résident à Soromana un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles ont  une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans,  3 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Elles ont effectué plusieurs cycles en prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) et tous ces prêts ont été bien remboursés. Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne de Soro Yiriwaso, qui correspond avec leur activité, étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne. Les trois précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Elles veulent utiliser ce prêt  actuel, pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semence, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles exploitent 11hectares d’arachides et espèrent réaliser une production  moyenne de 3 tonnes par hectare soit  33 tonnes.
Toute la récolte sera vendue, au comptant, à une clientèle essentiellement composée de revendeurs.
Le bénéfice  généré  sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, prendre en charge les frais scolaire, de santé des enfants et acheter les trousseaux  de mariage des filles.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Ankatoallama 2 are all married and reside in Soromana, a village of the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.  The women average 35 years of age and three children, and they live in polygamous families.  They know one another through ties of kinship and community.  They've gone through several cycles of solidarity loans (group loans), and these loans have all been repaid.  With the introduction of Soro Yiriwaso farm loans that match their business, they being peasants, these women seized the opportunity and are on now on their fourth farm loan.  The three preceding ones were repaid.  The group members want to use this current loan for labor costs, weeding, and buying seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides.  They have 11 hectares of peanuts and hope to realize an average production of three tonnes per hectare, thus 33 tonnes.  The entire harvest will be sold in cash transactions to customers essentially composed of retailers.  The profit generated will be used to make loan interest payments, to cover the costs of schooling and healthcare for the children, and to buy wedding items and accessories for the daughters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and weeding

loans.name: Lei

texts.en: Lei S. is 43 years old and married. She has 8 children, 6 of whom are with her. She works by making a very popular kind of food in Battambong Province. Selling the food, which is usually made of hashed meat (usually pork) wrapped and cooked in banana leaves, generates a a typical income of $2 US per day. S.'s husband is a skillful fisherman who works at Tonle Sap Lake and makes about $8 per day. Until recently, S.’s husband operated a small boat without a motor to enable his business. Thus, she has requested a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorized fishing boat because she thinks that fishing has been central to making a living for her family.

loans.use: Buying a motorized fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Harch

texts.en:
Harch H., 33, is engaged in the business of sewing clothes from her house in Battambong Province, and typically earns around US$ 5 per day. She is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband operates a motorbike, providing transportation services for his customers in the village and at the nearby local markets.

To generate more income for the family, she really wants to take out a loan of US$500 to buy a new sewing machine for her daughter. By doing this, H. hopes that she will be able to have enough money to put into savings, and for the family’s expenses. Also, one of her daughters will be able to use her skill for the family’s benefit.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ankatoallama 3 Group

texts.fr:
Ankatoallama 3 est un regroupement de neuf femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 34 ans, 2 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames  à Soromana, un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région administrative (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Après des années de prêts solidaires tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne (prêt agricole) et les trois précédents ont été bien  remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt  actuel pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles veulent cultiver 15 hectares de mil, de fonio et d’arachide et espèrent avoir une production moyenne  de 2 tonnes par hectare soit 30 tonnes.
Une partie de la récolte sera vendue dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires et le reste  sera destiné  pour la nourriture.
Le bénéfice généré de  la vente sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, prendre en charge les frais scolaire, de santé des enfants et acheter  les trousseaux de mariage  des filles.
texts.en:
Ankatoallama 3 is an association of nine women who are all married and who average 34 years of age and two children.  They all live in polygamous families in Soromana, a village of the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba in the third administrative region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.  They know one another through ties of kinship and community.  Following years of solidarity loans, all correctly repaid, they are now on their fourth farm loan (agricultural loan).  The three preceding ones were repaid.  They intend to use this current loan for the costs of labor and weeding and for buying seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides.  They want to cultivate 15 hectares of millet, fonio, and peanuts and hope to have an average production of 2 tonnes per hectare, thus 30 tonnes.  Part of the harvest will be sold at the different weekly fairs, and the rest will be for food.  The profit from the sale will be used to make loan interest payments, to cover the costs of schooling and healthcare for the children, and to buy wedding items and accessories for the daughters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and weeding

loans.name: Phol

texts.en:
Phol S., 35, is a hairdresser with a typical income of US$ 3.50 per day. She is married and has two school-aged children. Until recently she was involved in a business of hairdressing at the market, and her husband and S. decided to buy the business, however, the market is closed now.

She really wants to take out a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase another shop at a market where she thinks there will be many customers who will come to her shop for make-up and hairdressing. She really hopes that her skills and experience in her current business will help her to earn more income not only to support her children’s studies but also to repair her house. (S. in the red shirt is shown in the picture)

loans.use: To buy a hairdressing shop.

loans.name: Mrs. Soty Cheam Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank consists of ten members and is located in Tareap Doun village, in the Kandal province. The group plans to use the loan that they have obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Soty C. has been selected by the Village Bank members to be the bank president.  She is a 33 year old mother, with a small child who is too young to either work or study.  She operates a small business as a fish seller. Her husband, Mr. Chhay Phana, is a motorbike taxi driver. He is also a fisherman and is in need of a boat to support his fishing business. Mrs. Soty C. has decided to request a loan to buy a boat for her husband.

loans.use: To buy a buy boat for her husband's fishing business

loans.name: Benkelema 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix femmes du groupe Benkelema 1 sont toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 30 ans, 3 enfants et  résident à Flacoda, un hameau de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région administrative (Sikasso) de la république du Mali, dans des familles traditionnelles élargies.Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne (prêt agricole)qui  cadre avec leur activité primaire, étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne après avoir remboursé  le premier sans aucune difficulté.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt, pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles envisagent exploiter 18 hectares en arachide, riz et mil et espèrent  sur  une production moyenne de 3 tonnes par hectare soit 54 tonnes.
Une partie de  la récolte sera consommée et le reste  stocké, puis vendu au comptant aux revendeurs et à quelques consommateurs.
Le bénéfice  sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, prendre en charge les frais scolaire, de santé des enfants et acheter les trousseaux de mariages des filles.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Benkelema 1 are all married and average 30 years of age and three children.  They reside in traditional extended families in Flacoda, a hamlet in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba in the third administrative region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.  They know one another through ties of kinship and community. With the introduction of farm loans (agricultural loans), which fit with their primary work, they being peasants, these women seized the opportunity and are now on their second farm loan after having repaid the first one without any difficulties at all.  The group members intend to use this loan for the costs of labor and weeding and for buying seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides.  They envision working 18 hectares of peanuts, rice, and millet and are hoping for an average production of 3 tonnes per hectare, thus 54 tonnes.  Part of the harvest will be consumed, and the rest will be stored and then sold in cash transaction to retailers and to some consumers.  The profit will be used to make loan interest payments, to cover the costs of schooling and healthcare for the children, and to buy wedding items and accessories for the daughters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and weeding

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy K. is 53 years old and lives in Battambong Province. K. and her husband work hard to ensure a comfortable life for their two school-aged children and other two children who dropped out of school and are employed in a garment factory.

She has an orchard where she harvests fruit and other vegetables, typically earning US $3 per day. Her husband, presented in the picture, is a motor-taxi driver who always travels around his village and local markets, seeking customers, and is able to earn approximately US $3 per day. K. really wants to take out a loan of US $1000 to purchase various sorts of vegetables and grain to resell. It is very obvious that when she succeeds with her business plan by using her expected loan for investment, she will be able to obtain a good standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase various sorts of vegetables and grain.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhom Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people living in Tareap Doun village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan. They will use the loan for various purposes. 

Mrs. Sokhom C. is the 41-year-old village bank president. She is a fish seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Orn davy, is a fisherman. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Sokhom C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish from other people to resell and earn more profits. She has three children who are attending the local school.

Mrs. Chanroen S. did not come in perS. to take a loan but her husband was there, so he is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy more fish from other people to resell and earn more profits

loans.name: Benkelema 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix femmes du groupe Benkelema 2 sont toutes mariées et  résident à Flacoda un hameau de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles ont  une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, de 5 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne (prêt agricole) de Soro Yiriwaso,qui correspond avec leur activité étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne après avoir correctement  le premier.
Elles veulent utiliser ce prêt  actuel pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles veulent cultiver 20 hectares d’arachide et de riz et  envisagent obtenir une production moyenne de 3 tonnes à l’hectare soit 60 tonnes de céréales à la fin des récoltes.
Une partie de  la récolte sera consommée, l’autre sera stockée d’abord  puis vendue à un moment où les céréales ont de la valeur.
Le bénéfice réalisé sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, prendre en charge certaines dépenses de la famille et acheter les trousseaux de mariages des filles.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Benkelema 2 are all married and reside in Flacoda, a hamlet in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba in the third administrative region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.  The women average 37 years of age and five children, and they live in polygamous families.  They know one another through ties of kinship and community. With the introduction of Soro Yiriwaso farm loans (agricultural loans), which match their work, they being peasants, these women seized the opportunity and are now on their second farm loan after having correctly repaid the first one.  The group members want to use the current loan for the costs of labor and weeding and for buying seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides.  They want to cultivate 20 hectares of peanuts and rice and envision obtaining an average production of 3 tonnes per hectare, thus 60 tonnes of grain when the harvesting is over. Part of the harvest will be consumed, and the rest will first be stored and then sold when the grains have some value.  The realized profit will be used for repaying the loan, for covering certain family expenses, and for buying wedding items and accessories for the daughters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and weeding

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Баходур - молодой мужчина 35 лет. Женат и имеет 2-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей мелко-рогатого и крупно-рогатого скота. Жена - домохозяйка. Помогает мужу, а также занимается переработкой шерсти, готовится к зимнему сезону. У Баходура есть стадо из 20 овец и 2 быка. Он кредитуется у нас с 2008 года. За это время он хоть и не на много, увеличил количество своего скота. Баходур просит займ для пополнения своего стада.
texts.en:
Bahodur is a young 35-year-old man. He is married and has 2 children. He is involved in feeding and selling small and large livestock. His wife is a homemaker. She helps her husband and is also involved in processing yarn in preparation for the winter season. Bahodur has a herd of 20 sheep and 2 bulls. He has been our client since 2008. Since that time, he increased, although not by very much, his livestock quantity. Bahodur is requesting a loan in order to grow his herd.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Mour

texts.en: Mour S. is 40 years old and lives in Battambong Province. S. and her husband are working hard to ensure a comfortable life for their two school-aged children. Most recently, she has been involved in planting bean sprouts and sells them at a local market for a gross income of US $10 per day to cover her family's expenses. Her husband is an ice cream vendor who always has to travel long distances to provide his goods to his repeat customers, earning US $18 per day. Since the primary income of the family is generated from selling ice cream, they both want to take out a loan of US $700 to purchase a good ice box that can keep ice cream cold. If she succeeds with her business plan, she will send her children to study at a good school for their higher education. (In the picture, S. is shown with baskets of bean sprouts.)

loans.use: To buy an ice box.

loans.name: Sanavar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Санавар Кипчакова родилась в   1961 году, замужем, любящая мать  2 детей. Санавар торгует на рынке «Бадахшан» Зафарабадского района. Её товар – это различного вида ткани. Это не плохой бизнес в нашей стране, так как спрос на ткани у нашего народа есть. Купив ткань, они заказывают пошив национальных платьев.Каждая девушка выходя замуж имеет минимум 15 видов национальных платьев в своем приданном, которые сшиты на заказ из разных тканей. Муж Санавар  Исломиддин, помогает своей жене в бизнесе.
   Санавар планирует получить кредит, и поэтому обращается с заявкой в Кива. Кредит хочет потратить на расширение своего товара.
texts.en:
Born 1961, Sanavar K. is married and is a loving mother of 2 children. Sanavar sells at the Badahshan market in the Zafarabad district. Her merchandise is various types of fabrics. This is not a bad business in our country because fabrics are in demand among our people. Having purchased fabrics, they have traditional dresses made to-order. Every young woman has a minimum of 15 types of traditional dresses in her dowry when she gets married. Theses dresses are custom-made from various fabrics. Sanavar’s husband, Islomiddin, helps his wife with the business. Sanavar is planning to obtain a loan and went to Kiva with her request. She wants to use the loan to expand her merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Benkelema  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  neuf femmes du groupe Benkelema  3 sont toutes mariées et  résident à Flacoda un hameau  de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région administrative (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles ont  en moyenne  36 ans,   4 enfants  et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne (prêt agricole) de Soro Yiriwaso, qui correspond avec leur activité étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne, le premier a été bien remboursé.
Elles veulent utiliser ce prêt  actuel pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. 
Elles veulent cultiver 23 hectares avec comme spéculations  l’arachide, le riz et le mil. Ces femmes espèrent sur  une production moyenne de 3 tonnes par hectare soit 69 tonnes.
Une partie de  la récolte sera consommée, l’autre partie stockée d’abord puis vendue au comptant.
Le bénéfice généré sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, prendre en charge certaines dépenses de la famille et acheter les trousseaux de mariage des filles.
texts.en:
The nine women of the Benkelema 3 group are all married and live in Flacoda, a hamlet in Fakola in the prefecture of Kolondièba in the third administrative region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. Their average age is 36, they have an average of 4 children each and they live in polygamous families. They got to know each other through family and neighborhood connections. When Soro Yiriwaso started offering farming loans (agricultural loans) that apply to their business activity of farming, these women seized the opportunity. They are on their second farming loan, the first one having been fully repaid. They intend to use this current loan to cover the cost of plowing, weeding, and purchasing seeds, fertilizer and weed-killer. They want to cultivate 23 hectares as areas for growing groundnut, rice and millet. These women hope to produce an average of three metric tons per hectare, making 69 metric tons in total. Part of harvest will be consumed and the rest will be stored and then sold for cash. The generated profit will be used to reimburse the loan, to take care of certain family expenses and to buy trousseaus for their daughters.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover the cost of plowing, weeding, buying seeds, fertilizer and  weed-killer.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun C., aged 39, is a builder who often travels long distances to find work at a building site. He typically earns an income of US $3.50 per day to cover his family’s expenses. He has to work hard for many hours to ensure a good quality of life for his family. His wife is unemployed, but she is responsible for any household tasks.

They are blessed with four children, two of whom are students, and the rest are employed with reasonable wages. C. plans to purchase a motorbike to operate an additional business of providing transportation services to generate more income, so he really wants to take out a loan of US $1000 to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Mrs. Naov Shem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of eighteen members, is located in Tareap DoU. village in Kandal province. The members plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Naov S. is the village bank president, and was selected by the members. She sells fish at the local market. Her husband, Mr. Sab Van H., is a fisherman. He is facing a challenge with his fishing, because he does not have enough materials to support his work. Thus, Mrs. Naov S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fishnets for her husband’s work.

She is a 48 year old mother of eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other two are fishermen, one stays at home to do housework, and the others are enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Sokhneang L. was not present for the picture, so her husband is presented in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase fishnets for her husband’s fishing.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S., 52, operates his own motorbike transportation service. He transports his customers to the local markets, typically making an income of US $4 per day, in Battambong Province. He is married, but he has no children.

S.’s current business is the primary income for the family and covers all the expenses. However, he and his wife plan to create an additional business to provide more income. S. wants to take out a loan of US $800 for his wife to operate a grocery business at home.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Фотима - молодая женщина 26 лет. Замужем но пока детей не имеет. Фотима готовится стать матерью. Она вместе со своим мужем занимаются откормом и продажей скота. Её муж пасет овец, а она откармливает коров дома. У Фотимы есть дойная корова. Она употребляет молоко, а излишек продает соседям. Фотима и её муж просят займ для закупки мелко-рогатого скота, чтобы откормить его, и когда наступит праздник Курбан, продать подороже на рынке.
texts.en:
Fotima is a young 26-year-old woman. She is married, but does not yet have children. Fotima is preparing to become a mother. Fotima and her husband are involved in feeding and selling livestock. Her husband grazes sheep, and she feeds cows at home. Fotima has a dairy cow. She uses the milk and sells any excess to her neighbors. Fotima and her husband requested a loan in order to purchase small livestock to feed and sell at the market at a higher price during the Kurban holiday.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Замира Садирова  вот уже около 2 лет торгует на вещевом рынке Зафарабадского района. У Замиры 4 детей, в бизнесе ей помогает муж Алиер. Он ездит за товаром в город Бишкек,  а Замира продает его. Ассортимент товара Замиры состоит из женской одежды (ночные рубашки, пижамы, пеньюары), а так же детская одежда.
   Замира хочет увеличить свой товарооборот, поэтому подала заявку на получение кредита в размере 3000 сомони.
texts.en:
Zamira S. has been selling at the clothing market in the Zafarabad district for almost 2 years. Zamira has 4 children, and her husband, Alier, helps her with the business. He travels for the merchandise to the city of Bishkek, and Zamira sells the goods. Zamira’s goods assortment consists out of women’s clothing (night gowns, pajamas, peignoirs) and also children’s clothing. Zamira wants to increase her goods turnover; this is why she put in a request for a loan in the sum of 3000 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Mrs. Samnang Hong Village Bank Group

texts.en: Sixteen people living I. Tareap Doun village I. Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Samnang H. is the 40 year old village bank president. She sells fish which her husband, Mr. Ho Saroeun, fishes from the lake. Although they try to work hard, they don't earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Samnang H. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets to help her husband’s fishing. This couple has five children, four of whom are enrolled I. the local school while the youngest oN. is too young to work or study. Mrs. Sun C. could not be present for the picture, so her husband is shown I. the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets to help her husband’s fishing.

loans.name: Saman

texts.en: Mrs. Saman P. is a villager in the Khsom village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a piece of land she owns. Her husband, Mr. Teth Vorn, is a construction worker. In the plantation, Mrs. Saman P. has a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the field to make her crop more productive. Additionally, she would use the rest of money to buy equipment supplies to support her husband’s work. She hopes to increase their income and make her family's better than before. Mrs. Saman P. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the field to make her crop more productive and she would use the rest of money to buy equipment supplies to support her husband’s work.

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Машхура Файзиева родилась в 1961 году. Проживает в Зафарабадском районе по улице Джами. Машхура замужем за Зарифом Файзиевым и имеет 3 детей. 
 Сфера ее деятельности торговля, на рынке «Бадахшан» она торгует детской и подростковой обувью. 
Машхура хочет разнообразить ассортимент своего товара и продавать не только обувь, но и женскую и мужскую одежду. Для достижения этой цели ей нужны 3000 сомони. Она знает, что данная сумма поможет ей в разнообразии ассортимента товара и получении желаемой прибыли, после ее реализации, так как она кредитуется у нас не в первый раз.
texts.en:
Mashkhura F. was born in 1961. She lives in the Zafarabad district on the Djami Street. Mashkhura is married to Zarif Faiziev and has 3 children. Her business sphere is sales at the Badahshan market; she sells children’s and teenage shoes. Mashkhura wants to vary the assortment of her merchandise and sell not only shoes, but women’s and men’s clothing. To achieve this goal, she needs 3000 somoni. She knows that this sum will help her vary her goods assortment and obtain desired profit because this is not her first time being financed by us.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To vary goods assortment and purchase of women's and men's clothing

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 26 years old. He distributes water in Nyalenda, a neighborhood outside Kisumu, Kenya. John operates a tap from Kisumu Water and Sanitation Company, where he buys the water and fills large jerry cans that he sells to customers. He has been doing this business for one and a half years.

John is married, and he has a nine-month-old child. He will use this loan to open more taps to have more water distribution points. He does have competition, but hopes that his growing business can help him cater to the needs of his family.

loans.use: To pay for access to water taps.

loans.name: Bunsrun

texts.en: Mr. Bunsrun P. lives in Khsom village in Kandal province. He owns a small business in the local market selling telephones. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more telephones to resell to earn more profits. His wife, Mrs. Ung Mao, is a housewife. Mr. Bunsrun P. is 53 years old and the father of five children who are telephone sellers.  His wife is shown with him in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase telephones to resell.

loans.name: Hameda Group

texts.en: Hameda is the leader of this four-member group.  Each of them wants to take out a loan for improving and expanding their businesses, so they are requesting a group loan of 56000 Afghani. Hameda wants a loan for her embroidery business. Nagia wants a loan for a leather-working business. Nadei wants a loan for her husband who has a general store. Waseel wants a loan for a painting business. They are very thankful to Kiva lenders who can support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Рохат - женщина 1968 года рождения. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она работает в Государственном учреждении. Рохат недавно выдала замуж свою дочь, и теперь хочет купить для нее спальный гарнитур, чтобы дочери не было холодно на полу в осенне-зимний сезон. Постепенно из своей зар.платы она будет погашать займ. Рохат будут помогать ее муж и сын.
texts.en:
Rohat was born in 1968. She is married and has 3 children. She works in a government office. Rohat recently married off her daughter and now wants to buy her a bedroom furniture set, so that her daughter won’t be cold on the floor during the autumn-winter season. She will use her salary to gradually repay the loan. Rohat’s husband and son will help her too.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture

loans.name: Namig

texts.en:
Namig is a 23-year-old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He settled in the village of Boyuk Bahmanli in Fuzuli region.
This young man has 6 years of experience in his business. He sells juices and foodstuffs wholesale.

This young man is married. Now he needs a loan of 1500 AZN to buy foodstuffs and juices to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy juice and foodstuff

loans.name: Durmo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Дурмо Ходжиева воспитывает своих четырех детей самостоятельно. Несколько лет назад муж Дурмо оставил семью, но благодаря ее 10 летнему опыту работы в сфере торговли, она смогла поднять своих 4 детей на ноги. Но дети подрастают, им надо учиться, поэтому Дурмо решила увеличить свой товарооборот, для получения хорошей прибыли. 
Дурмо торгует на рынке продуктами питания и хозяйственными товарами. Она подала заявку на Кива, для того чтобы ее поддержали в поставленной цели.
texts.en:
Durmo H. is raising her four children by herself. Several years ago, Durmo’s husband left the family, but thanks to her 10-year experience in sales, Durmo was able to get her 4 children on their feet. However, the children are getting older and have to go to school. This is why Durmo decided to increase her goods turnover in order to obtain good profit. Durmo sells food products and household products at the market. She put in a request to Kiva to get support in achieving her set goal.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Матлюба, клиентка в организации уже третий год.Каждый свой кредит она использует целенаправлено и не нарушая условий.Первый займ она потратила на провидение свадьбы своей дочери, второй она потратила на проведение свадьбы сына.И теперь досрочно погасив хочет купить одну корову и большого быка вместе с кормом.Она благодарит "Арванд" за поддержку и финансирование.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Matluba has been a client of our organization for three years. She uses every single loan purposefully without breaking any terms. She used her first loan to organize a wedding for her daughter, she used her second loan to get her son married. And now that she has paid off the loan early she wants to buy one more cow and a large bull with fodder. She is thanking Arvand for the help and financial support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull and a cow

loans.name: Latofatkhon

texts.en:
N. Latofatkhon is 42 years old. She and her husband have raised five children. For five years, Latofatkhon has been working in the largest local market of the city. She is selling rice of different sorts. Her market is situated in the central local market where there are always a lot of people. The business is very stable and generates the main income for the family since her husband, because of a difficult situation, had to leave for Russia to earn money. Latofatkhon has been working with IMON for a year, and had proved herself as an accurate client. Today she requests 3800 Somoni. The loan will be spent for purchasing rice to sell. Latofatkhon thanks all for support and promises to pay the loan on time.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more rice

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
R. Nazokat is 42 years old. She is married to an engineer and they have four school-aged children. Nazokat is a kindergarten teacher by profession, however for several years she has sold children's clothing. Nazokat and her husband dream that their children will enter higher education, so the income from Nazokat's business will be spent on educating their children. Nazokat has received an IMON loan once before and proved to be an accurate and reliable client. Now she is requesting 5000 TJS for purchasing new goods to sell. Nazokat and her children thank you sincerely for your generous heart.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new goods for resale to increase the range

loans.name: Moussa Innocent

texts.en:
Greetings from N. Moussa Innocent, a 38-year-old married man with four children aged nine, seven, four and two years old, and one dependent orphan, who is sixteen years old. His family live in the Kicukiro district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda.

Moussa Innocent owns a plot in Nyarugenge market where he sells clothes, particularly for women and girls. Innocent started this business sixteen years ago. He is seeking his first loan worth 500,000 RWF from Kiva partner, Vision Finance Company, in order to buy more clothes to expand his store. Before he received this loan, he was earning a monthly salary of 150,000 RWF, and from increased profit he will have more savings and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Gulharam

texts.en:
Z. Gulharam is married and has five children. She has been running her own business for five years, selling children's clothes in a store that is located in a densely inhabited part of the city. She is very nice and polite and has many customers. Her business is quite stable and serves as a significant source of income for the family. Gulharam has been a client with IMON for a year. She managed to pay her first loan accurately and precisely. Now she is requesting a loan of 3200 TJS for purchasing children's clothes to sell for the summer season. She deeply appreciates your support and sincerely thanks all of you.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new children's clothing for the summer season

loans.name: Chude

texts.en: Chude S., a married Tanzanian entrepreneur, runs a video show business at Buguruni Kisiwani at Dar es Salaam.  He also has a super sports channel which shows different competitions including UEFA championships. He generates a lot of income from the entrance fees, especially during the Barclays premier league.  He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to extend his business.

loans.use: To extend the business.

loans.name: Mukkaram

texts.en:
Z. Mukkaram is 42 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. She is a hard-working woman struggling to feed her children by selling the traditional fabrics for making traditional dresses.

Mukkaram has a trading place in the central local market of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She is trying to have wide range of goods so as to able to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of the customers with different levels of income.

Mukkaram, being a devoted mother, is doing her very best in order for her children to be well-educated and happy. Today Mukkaram feels that with more working capital, her business could generate more income, so she is asking for a loan of 6000 Somoni to jump-start the business and raise the family's standard of living. Let's help this incredible mother give her children a brighter future.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics for resale

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N. est une dame de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle s’active dans la restauration et aimerait renforcer son capital. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa N. is a 46-year-old woman, married, and the mother of eight. She is active in the restaurant business and would like to boost her capital. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food catering

loans.name: Mandir

texts.en:
Mandir L. is currently in the business of selling various items in a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell in her shop. Mandir is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a carpenter. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a little restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more goods  to sell in her shop

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
I. Muhabbat is 33 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 3 children. With the purpose of supporting her family, Muhabbat is selling underwear for women and traditional dresses. She has been in this business for 14 years already.

Over the years she gained experience in choosing goods of good quality and meeting the requirements of the customers with various levels of income. The business is very stable so allows Muhabbat to improve the living standard of the family. Today she requests 3000 Somoni in order to expand her inventory. Muhabbat would like to thank everyone supporting her and to assure them that she’ll pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for resale

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en: Zaituni J. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and a married woman. She runs a business selling varieties of food products at Yombo Vituka Ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells varieties of food products in her shop including cereal products such as wheat flour, maize flour, cashew nuts, cooking oil, and sugar. She purchases the business goods direct from the producers and others from the city market. Her business plan is to run a wholesale food shop one day.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 to meet her business demand.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
For the past 4 years, Mavzuna has sold women’s underclothes. She is the married mother of three children. She is determined to provide a better living for their entire family. Mavzuna is hard-working and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service.

Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Mavzuna has a strong business base. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 3000 Somoni to purchase a new vending facility and expand her business. With the increased income, Mavzuna plans to continue growing her business and to improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: Increasing the working capital of her business

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages have never defeated Saodat, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. Saodat is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is 38 years old, married and the loving mother of three children.

Saodat started her own business because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family expenses. For more than 3 years, she has operated a store where she sells kid’s clothing. Her store is well-known, and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful.

Saodat hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family, especially for her children. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. With this purpose Saodat requests 2200 Somoni. She promises to repay the loan on time and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. There, he has settled in the Fizuli region, in a Finnish house. This village was built for IDPs.

He was born in 1983. This man has 2 years of experience in the sheep-breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 1600 AZN to buy 15 sheep to expand his sheep-breeding business.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu V. is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more food in the restaurant to sell. Dudu is 32 years old and is married to a husband who is a secretary to the Sudanese People's Liberation Army Party. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

loans.use: stock more foods to sell in her restaurant

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
M. Firuza is 25 years old. She is married and has a small child. Firuza sells dried fruit in the central local market, “Panjshanbe”. She has been in this business for 3 years already. Dried fruit is very popular in Tajikistan. Any hostess has dried fruit on hand in case there are guests in the house. Moreover, dried fruit is as a rule served at all important family occasions such as wedding parties, birthday parties and others.

Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, the business of Firuza is quite successful and brings in stable income for her family. Now she requests 800 US Dollars for purchasing dried fruit such as raisins and apricots and nuts such as almonds, pistachios with the purpose in expanding the range of goods she sells. Firuza and her family appreciate your support in helping her improve her business.

loans.use: Purchasing dried fruit such as raisins, apricots, almonds and pistachios for resale

loans.name: Suraiyo

texts.en:
U. Suraiyo is 28 years old. She is married with two small children. Suraiyo sells dried fruit in the central local market. She has been in this business for 3 years already. In Tajikistan people are extremely hospitable. When there are visitors, any hostess sets the table with the national bread “lepeshka”, tea, candies, and dried fruit.

Suraiyo tries to have a wide range of goods and serves the customers with smile. The business is stable and generates the considerable income for the family. Today Suraiyo is requesting a loan in the amount of 800 US Dollars. The loan will be spent purchasing dried fruit such as raisins, apricots, and almonds, pistachios, and peanuts to expand her range of goods for sale. Suraiyo promises to repay the loan on time and thanks all lenders who support her.

loans.use: Purchasing dried fruit such as raisins, apricots, almonds, pistachios, peanuts for resale

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
Y. Ulugbek is 33 years old, and married with three children. He is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the cultivation and sale of livestock at the local market. Every year, Ulugbek buys young heifers from farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. Now Ulugbek is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest in a loan of 4000 TJS for his business. In order to receive this amount, Ulugbek has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

   Назокат Турсунова добрая и милая женщина 47 лет, проживает вместе со своим мужем и 4 детьми в Зафарабадском районе. Назокат имеет 9 летний стаж работы в предпринимательской деятельности. На данный момент она реализует мужскую обувь и мужскую одежду. В бизнесе ей помогают ее старшие сыновья. 
   Назокат хочет дополнительно к своему товару купить женскую обувь и женскую верхнюю одежду, с этой целью она запрашивает кредит в размере 3000 сомони. Место ее деятельности рынок «Дусти».
texts.en:
Nazokat T. is a kind and sweet 47-year-old woman, who lives with her husband and 4 children in the Zafarabad district. Nazokat has 9 years of experience in the entrepreneurial field. Currently, she sells men’s shoes and men’s clothing. Her older sons help her with the business. Her place of business is the Dusti market. Nazokat wants to add women’s shoes and women’s outerwear to her merchandise. She is requesting a loan in the sum of 3000 somoni to achieve this goal.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand merchandise assortment

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.en:
Z. Hikmatullo has been selling cattle, together with his father (pictured), for more than four years. This has helped him move on in his business. Hikmatullo is married and lives with his parents. He has no children yet but is already working hard in order to improve his family's standard of living and be ready to fulfill a father's responsibilities. One of his main needs is to purchase cattle in order to improve his business. For this reason, Hikmatullo requested a loan of $600 USD from Kiva partner, IMON International. Not only will his business benefit from it, but so will his family. Your support will really help him.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.en:
Shuhratjon is a farmer, not only devoted to his work, but also to being the father of his family. He works hard in raising his sheep, taking them out to graze in the early mornings. Without a doubt it is not an easy task, but his love for his family gives his work reason and meaning. His wife is also involved in his business. Shuhratjon wants to improve his situation by increasing the number of his animals. In the long run, this will provide him with a better financial income. If you support him, he will be forever grateful.

loans.use: To purchase sheep in order to expand his business

loans.name: Karmella

texts.en:
Karmella P. is 28 years old and married to a policeman. She has three school-aged children. Karmella is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to build up her charcoal stocks. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

About BRAC

loans.use: To build up her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Samad

texts.en:
Samad A. is forty-four years old and married with four children. He has been involved in the sale of spare parts for cars since 1999. Since then, his business has gradually expanded. Being hard-working and polite by nature, Samad has managed to develop a clientele that is happy with the goods and the service. The income he receives allows him to provide for his family's needs; he is the only bread-winner in the family.

Samad is requesting $2000 to purchase more spare parts for cars to increase his range of goods. He is counting on your help and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him. He promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for cars

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
This young man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fuzuli region, settled in the Fuzuli region at the Ahmadbayli village.

Ramin was born in 1986 and is single. Two years ago he started a welding business. Now he needs a loan of 1,200 AZN to buy the necessary things for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for improving his welding business

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. Keji is 30 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Keji hopes to be able to build a charcoal store and buy a motorbike About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en: Latifa S. is forty-eight years old and married with two children. Ever since she was married, she has worked at a business of buying and selling sheep. In order to increase her profits, Latifa walks through farms and several settlements to buy sheep at the lowest price. She currently has eight sheep. Latifa wants to expand her business and, since her children are grown up, she thinks that with their help she will be able to look after more sheep. She is asking for a loan of $2000 to purchase twenty sheep. Latifa expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir S. has been dedicated to the business of cattle breeding for the last five years. This business requires a lot of dedication because it demands a lot of effort. It also requires strict control of every one of the animals in addition to feeding and caring for those that are older. It is necessary to emphasize that through this business Tahir is able to maintain his spouse and four children. The loan will allow him to buy more animals, which he will raise and sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Shamama

texts.en:
Shamama is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan of the Fuzuli region, settled in the Kurdmahmudlu village. She is married and has three children. 

Shamama was born in 1959. Ten years ago she started a sheep-breeding business. She has goats also. Now she needs a loan of 1,200 AZN to buy ten sheep and goats for improving her sheep-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy ten sheep and goats

loans.name: Tehran

texts.en:
Tehran M. is married with three children. He has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.

Tehran has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. He began this enterprise eight years ago with a starting capital of $200. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he has expanded his business over time.  It has become a family affair now, as they help him with the business. 

Today, Tehran needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of $2000. He is ready to work even harder, to make sacrifices, and to make extra effort to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Neno

texts.en: Neno V. is currently in the business of selling beans at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of beans to sell. Neno is 35 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a lorry (truck) for transporting goods from place to place. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.
