BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Miraga

texts.en:
Miraga A. is married. His wife is a homemaker and they have two children. 

He has always been a hard worker. He started working at an early age, helping his uncle with his clothing business, and contributing his earnings to them from the time that he was 35 years old. When Miraga married, his expenses increased and he had to strike out on his own to build a business that would support his own family. With the help of his savings, he started his own clothing business, and his wife helped him in her spare time. His business has grown little by little, but he wants to continue to grow in order to achieve a better quality of life. 

Miraga is asking for a $2000 loan to buy merchandise for his business so that he can continue to expand. He and his family are very grateful for the support you are providing to help them get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase women's clothes for the rest of the season

loans.name: Qurban

texts.en:
Qurban Q. is a lively entrepreneur with a small business selling clothing for men at the central market in the village of Imishli. He is a very experienced entrepreneur, having been self-employed for more that twenty years. Business has been good for Qurban. He is married and has two sons who are the meaning of his life.

Qurban has requested a loan of 2,000 USD to increase his available working capital. He dreams of having his own small store. This loan will help him purchase new inventory and continue to invest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal men's clothes

loans.name: İlqar

texts.en:
İlqar A. is a successful entrepreneur, father, and dedicated husband. He has one adorable son who gives him the strength to work hard.

İlqar opened a small grocery store eight years ago with a small amount of savings for capital. He was assisted by his wife who helps him to serve his clients. Today his clientele has grown larger and his grocery store has become more popular. He is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD so that he can expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store.

İlqar is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for his store

loans.name: Busena

texts.en: Busena A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Busena is 40 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike for carrying charcoal to the market. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila A. is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her five children. More than twenty years ago she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available on their land for this business.

Jamila is engaged in this business together with her adult children. Slowly the number of cows has increased and at the same time, her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Be an important part of the growth of Jamila’s business.

loans.use: To purchase four more cattle

loans.name: Yaqub

texts.en: Yaqub N. is a 56-year-old married father of three children. He provides for his family with the revenue generated by the grocery store he owns. He is requesting a loan of $2000 US to increase the stock of food goods available at his store. Yaqub is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur and supporting his children's efforts to get good educations. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will ensure the success of his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more food products for inventory

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa, as the business owner, knows that the success of her clothing business will in large part depend on the selection of her merchandise. She is also aware that it is best to keep an open mind and to be receptive to customer suggestions. Her maternity clothing store may initially focus on casual wear, but she may find that she has a lot of working women clamoring for suits tailored for pregnant women. Raisa has been in this business for many years, and she has succeeded in attracting customers who trust her. 

She requested a loan to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: To increase her stock of goods.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Sahib (his son is pictured) was born in 1956. He is married and has two children. Sahib is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, settled in this Fuzuli region in the Finnish houses.

Sahib has been in his sheep-breeding business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 1,200 AZN to buy twelve sheep for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy twelve sheep

loans.name: Dương Thị

texts.en:
C. Dương Thị (524010591) is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has two adult children.

C. owns and operates a service-based business, primarily providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.

C. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 10th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Phạm Thị

texts.en:
C. Phạm Thị (524030589) is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has three adult children.

C. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month.

In 2003, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

C. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby chicks to raise and sell. The loan will be her 6th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
T. Vũ Thị (525980647) is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has three adult children.

T. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 5,100,000 VND a month.

In 1998, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 11th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Evgheni

texts.en:
Evgheni likes to raise rabbits, and he has done this for many years because these animals bring him pleasure. It has become a business that he does well. At the moment he doesn't have a large number of rabbits, and he would like to increase their numbers. He wants to buy one more buck and a doe, and he also needs to build more rabbit cages. 

He is applying to Microinvest for a loan in order to increase the number of rabbits and to buy building materials.

loans.use: To buy more rabbits

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
G. Hoàng Thị (525980650) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has three school-aged children.

G. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 4,900,000 VND a month.

In 1998, G. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

G. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 11th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Serhed

texts.en: "Hi, dear my friends. As you know, I got success in my business with your help. I will never forget about it! Thank you very much!" Serhed is applying to Kiva for a second loan. The first time he applied for the loan amount of $800 and he repaid this loan successfully. Now he needs a loan of 1300 AZN to buy the things necessary for improving his business. You can see in the picture he has not changed his business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for improving his business

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como radio taxi, y para mejorar sus condiciones de vida en ingresos requiere el crédito para el pago de la afiliación al sindicato de la Terminal de buses.
Vive en la Zona de Alto Las Delicias de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa en anticrético
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de trabajas le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Faustino owns a vehicle that he uses to provide taxi services. To improve his quality of life and income he requires a loan to pay for his affiliation fees to the Bus Terminal Union. He lives in the Alto Las Delicias Zone, in the city of La Paz, in a house on anticredito (a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over). This is the first time that he is requesting a loan through Impro; his drive to work has given him the opportunity to be qualified for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for his affiliation fees to the Bus Terminal Union of La Paz.

loans.name: Matlab

texts.en:
Matlab is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fizuli region. He settled in the Shukurbayli village of the Fizuli region. 

This kind person has been in the cafe business for 10 years. He was born in 1957 and is married with four children. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary things for improving his cafe business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for this cafe

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene un puesto donde vende Salchipapas y hamburguesas , es la única que genera ingresos para la subsistencia de su familia.
Vive en la Zona de Irpavi II de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa alquilada.
Requiere el crédito para la compra de insumos (papa, salchicha, pan, mayonesa Ketchup y aceite).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago se de sus cuotas.
Las ganas de trabajar le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Teresa has a stand where she sells Salchipapas (a dish that usually consists of hot dogs or sausages served with French fries) and hamburgers; she is the only member of her family that earns income for their subsistence. She lives in the Irpavi II Zone in the City of La Paz in a rented home. She needs a loan to purchase supplies (potatoes, sausages, bread, mayonnaise, ketchup, and oil). This is the third time that she has requested a loan through Impro; her financial history proves that she is a good client that always makes her quota payments. Her drive to work has given her the opportunity to obtain this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, sausages, bread, mayonnaise, ketchup, and oil for her business in the sale of Salchipapas (a dish that usually consists of hot dogs or sausages served with French fries) and hamburgers.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy dinámica y conversadora, está casada con el padre D. sus 3 hijos y viven en su casa propia. Se dedica a la crianza D. animales y al cultivo D. la tierra, pero su labor fundamental es el cuidado D. 6 vacas y 3 becerras, por las que siembra varias chacras D. avena para su alimentación y D. donD. obtiene D. 4 a 6 litros D. leche diarios. Los días miércoles y sábados elabora quesos que venD. los jueves y domingos en el mercado D. la ciudad D. Tarma; negocio por el cual se siente muy satisfecha porque le es muy rentable. Por otro lado, su esposo se dedica a la siembra papas y arvejas y Albina lo apoya durante las cosecha y la comercialización D. los productos, los cuales cuando son bien cotizados en el mercado, les permiten obtener muy buenas ganancias con las que pueden compran más terrenos cultivables que planean alquilar para sostenerse en su vejez. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y durante los ciclos pasados demostró puntualidad en sus pagos; asimismo la función como tesorera D. su banco comunal la viene cumpliendo con mucha responsabilidad, ganándose el respeto D. sus compañeros. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará en la limpieza y arado D. sus terrenos, donD. sembrará avena para que sus vacunos no pasen hambre en los tiempos D. sequías.
texts.en:
Albina, 45, is a very dynamic and chatty woman. She is married to the father of her three children, and they live in their own house. She raises animals and grows crops. Her primary work is taking care of six cows and three calves. She grows fields of oats to feed them. She gets four to six liters of milk a day from her cows. On Wednesdays and Saturdays she makes cheese. She sells the cheese on Thursdays and Sundays in the Tarma city market. She is very content with the business because it is very profitable. On the other siD., her husband grows potatoes and peas. Albina helps him during the harvesting and the selling of those products. When these products are sought-after in the market, Albina and her husband get good earnings. They can use the earnings to buy more fertile land, which they plan to rent to support themselves in their old age. This is her ninth loan with MFP. During past cycles she has shown herself to be punctual in her payments. She is the treasurer of her community bank, a job she does very responsibly. This wins her the respect of her colleagues. The money she is asking for will be used to clean and plow her oat fields so that her cows will not be hungry during the dry times.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant oats to feed her cows

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 61 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y con mucha vitalidad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 de ellos viven con ella en su casa propia. Desde que enviudó comenzó a trabajar con mayor ahínco en sus cultivos, también vendía comida en el parque de su pueblo para obtener dinero para la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Pero desde que enfermó y crecieron sus hijos dejó de vender comida y tampoco trabaja mucho en las chacras, pues sus hijos realizan ahora los trabajos pesados. Lo que hace Elena es preparar los alimentos y en horas de la tarde los apoya en la recolección de las arvejas. A ella le gusta estar dedicada a los trabajos agrícolas porque lo hizo desde su infancia. Para obtener mayor cantidad de dinero ella viajaba a la ciudad de Lima donde comercializaba sus productos, pero ahora el viaje se le hace muy pesado y cansado, por lo que empezó a vender a los comerciantes de la ciudad de Tarma a un menor precio.  Pero ahora que sus hijos ya son adultos pueden volver a enviar sus productos directamente a los mercados de Lima y que los ingresos económicos les den la oportunidad de mejorar su nivel de vida. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, a pesar de sus carencias económicas pagó todas sus cuotas anteriores y aunque tiene dificultades de audición no deja de asistir a las reuniones de su banco comunal para mantenerse enterada de los acuerdos tomados. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos y una bolsa de semilla de arvejas para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Elena, 61, is a very hardworking woman with lots of vitality. She is a widow, and she has three children. Two of the children live with her in her own house. Since she became a widow, she started to work her fields more eagerly. She also sold food in her town’s park in order to get the money to feed and educate her children. But, since she became ill and her children grew up, she stopped selling food. She does not work much in the fields, either. Her children now do the heavy work. What Elena does is prepare the food, and in the afternoon she helps collect the peas. She likes doing farm work because she has been doing this since she was a child. To obtain more money, she traveled to the city of Lima to sell her products. But, now the trip is very difficult and tiring for her. So, she started to sell at a lower price to the business people in Tarma. Now that her children are adults, they can return to sending their products directly to the Lima markets so that their income gives them the opportunity to improve their quality of life. This is her eighth loan with MFP. In spite of her lack of savings, she made all of her previous payments. Even though she has difficulty hearing, she goes to her community bank meetings to keep herself informed of the agreed upon decisions. The money she is asking for is to buy chemical fertilizers and a bag of pea seeds for the next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 20 additional sheep for breeding

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 44 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 5 hijos en la casa de su madre. La siembra y crianza de animales es su labor cotidiana, ya que desde muy niña estuvo ligada a estas actividades; pero lo que más le gusta es la agricultura, siembra papas, ocas, habas y en menos cantidad hortalizas. También cría vacas, ya que en ciertas temporadas le brindan su leche y ella aprovecha en venderla por litro a 1.50 soles y de ese modo no pasa necesidades económicas. Pero una vez iniciada la cosecha se dedica de sol a sol a ella, cuyos frutos los comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, generándoles muy buenos ingresos a su economía. A Gloria le gustaría dedicarse mucho más a sus cultivos y prosperar con esta actividad, pero como sus necesidades son mayores, junto a su esposo tienen que trabajar en chacras ajenas para poder cubrir los gastos y la educación de sus hijos. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, durante los periodos pasados pagó puntualmente sus cuotas y para este crédito seguirá trabajando del mismo modo, ya que no quiere fallarle a sus compañeros de banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará semilla y fertilizantes químicos para la tierra donde sembrará papas.
texts.en:
Gloria is 44. She lives with the father of her five children in her mother’s house. Her daily work is raising animals and farming. Since she was a small girl she has been connected to this work. What she likes the most is farming and planting potatoes, “oca” (root vegetable), beans, and, in smaller quantities, green vegetables. She also raises cows. At certain times they give milk, and she takes advantage of that buy selling it for 1.50 PEN per liter. That way she is not in economic need. Once the harvest has started, she works from sun up until sun down. She sells the harvested products in the market in the city of Tarma. This generates good income. Gloria would really like to spend much more time on her fields and be able to prosper from this activity. But, her needs are greater than what she gets from this activity. She and her husband have to work in other peoples’ fields to cover their expenses and their children’s education. This is her ninth loan with MFP. In the past, she has made her payments on time. With this loan, she will continue to work the same way. She does not want to fail her colleagues in her community bank. She will use the money to buy seeds and chemical fertilizer for her potato fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús tiene 40 años, es un hombre serio y responsable, felizmente casado con la madre de sus 2 hijos de 18 y de 13 años con quienes viven en su casa propia hecha a base de adobes. Sus padres eran agricultores, por ende él aprendió todas las técnicas de esta actividad y desde que se casó trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja en la siembra de papas, arvejas y habas. De todos los cultivos que realiza se sienten más identificado con las arvejas, porque le generan mayores ganancias y son de poca inversión, pues aprovechan de sembrar en las chacras donde hayan crecido las papas y de ese modo usa la fertilidad de esas tierras. En cierta temporada, Jesús se dedica netamente a la papa y se siente muy a gusto labrando la tierra, por ello que trata de sembrar alternadamente diversos productos para que de ese modo no deje de generarse ganancias, pues gracias a ellos mantiene a su familia y cubre la educación de sus hijos. Actualmente Jesús tiene pensado adquirir más terrenos cultivables para que de ese modo pueda cubrir la educación superior de sus hijos. Durante los 8 préstamos consecutivos que tuvo con MFP ha pagado puntualmente todas sus cuotas y para este crédito hace el mismo compromiso de seguir siendo responsable. Jesús tiene la característica de dar opiniones muy acertadas durante las reuniones de su banco comunal, las cuales son escuchadas con mucha atención por sus demás compañeros. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos que acompañarán a la semilla y de ese modo su siembra esté garantizada.
texts.en:
Jesús is 40. He is a serious and responsible man who is happily married to the mother of his two children. Their children are 18 and 13, and they live together in their own house made of adobe. His parents were farmers, and he learned all about the work. Since he got married he has worked together with his wife planting potatoes, peas, and beans. Of all of his crops, he favors the peas because they generate the most income with little investment. He plants them in the fields where potatoes grew, and he takes advantage of these fertile grounds. In certain times Jesús works only with the potatoes, and he really likes working the land. He tries to alternately plant diverse products so that he is always generating income. Thanks to the crops, he can support his family and cover his children’s educational costs. Jesús is currently thinking of acquiring more fertile land so that he can cover his children’s high school expenses. During the eight consecutive loans that he had with MFP, he made all of his payments on time. With this loan he makes the same promise to keep being responsible. Jesús characteristically gives wise opinions during his community bank meetings. Because of this, his colleagues pay a lot of attention to his opinions. The money he is asking for is to buy chemical fertilizers to go with the seeds. This way his plants are guaranteed.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Ovi

texts.es: Ovi tiene 27 años, es una madre muy alegre y comprensiva, vive con el padre de sus 3 hijos en una casa alquilada. Desde que se unió con su pareja, un hombre dedicado a las labores agrícolas, empezaron a sembrar papas, arvejas y maíz en chacras alquiladas, donde pagan al año entre 200 a 700 soles, dependiendo la accesibilidad de transporte a la chacra. Estos precios se cotizan en chacras  temporales (regadas por la lluvia), de ser en chacras de regadío el precio es mucho mayor. Ovi se levanta muy temprano para cocinar los alimentos, atender a su bebe y después darle el alcance a su esposo que trabaja en sus cultivos. Ovi ama su actividad, no siente cansancio ni pesadez al cultivar sus tierras, ya que de ello dependerá su buena cosecha que comercializará en el mercado de  la cuidad de Tarma. Esta dinámica de trabajo le resulta muy rentable y piensa continuar de esa manera para lograr comprar sus propias chacras y su casa propia en aras de brindarles mayores comodidades a sus hijos. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos, también le gusta asistir a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal programadas por su asesor de crédito e intervenir con opiniones acertadas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará 10 sacos de fertilizantes químicos y una bolsa de semilla de arvejas para seguir renovando sus siembras.
texts.en:
Ovi is 27 years old, is a very happy and attentive mother, and lives with the father of her 3 children in a rented house. Since she married her husband, a man who does agricultural work, they began to sow potatoes, peas, and corn on rented farms, for which they pay between 200 and 700 soles per year, depending on how accessible the farms by transportation. These prices are also determined by how the farms are irrigated; if the farms have irrigated land, then the price is higher than if the farms are irrigated by rain. Ovi wakes up very early in the morning to cook food, to take care of her baby, and then to give the rest to her husband, who works with the crops. Ovi loves her work. She doesn’t feel tired or bored in cultivating her land, since a good harvest depends on this activity. She will sell her harvest in the market in the city of Tarma. This work is very profitable, and she plans to continue this so that she will be able to buy her own farms and her own house so she can offer her children a more comfortable life. This is her eighth loan with MFP, which demonstrates her honesty and responsibility in her repayments. She also likes to attend all of the community bank meetings, which are planned by her loan counselor, and to participate with good opinions. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy 10 sacks of chemical fertilizers and a bag of pea seeds to continue planting.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto Antonio C. C., tiene la edad de 47 años habita en la borgoña , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tiene dos hijas las cuales trabajan y le apoyan con los gastos de la familia , los planes hacia su hogar es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Roberto desde hace 21 años se dedica a la agricultura , el mayor problema que se le presenta son las plagas , él inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes futuro es mejorar las condiciones del cultivo , ya que con las indicaciones de nuestro técnico agrónomo espera tener mejores resultados .Con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y aplicar al cultivo con esto espera obtener una buena cosecha y vender a buen precio al mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Antonio C. C. is 47 years old and lives in the Burgundy area, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife, who supports him with household activities. They have two daughters, who work and help with the household expenses. They plan to improve the conditions of their lives. For 21 years, Mr. Roberto has worked in agriculture. The biggest problems that he has in this sector are the plagues. He began this activity with the support of his parents. His plans for the future are to improve the conditions of his crop, and with the instructions of an agricultural technician he hopes to have better results. With this loan, he is going to buy fertilizers and supplies and apply them to his crops. With this, he hopes to have a better harvest and sell his products at a good price at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: Raúl tiene 27 años, es un hombre sereno y responsable, vive con la madre de su único hijo en la casa de su tía. Desde niño se dedica a la siembra y cuidado de sus plantas y ahora con su pareja se han propuesto trabajar en mutuo acuerdo porque tienen anhelos de progresar mediante sus cultivos. Por ello, han alquilado chacras donde sembrarán papas y arvejas y por las cuales pagarán entre 280 a 340 soles por cada siembra. Asimismo, se han inscrito en los terrenos de la comunidad para que en años posteriores puedan pasar a ser copropietarios. Raúl está muy contento con sus trabajos agrícolas, por ello que se levanta muy temprano para que a las 8 de la mañana ya deba estar iniciando sus labores, mientras que su esposa le da el alcance después con el almuerzo. De realizar muy buenas cosechas esta temporada, espera tener la oportunidad de comprar terrenos de fácil acceso para los carros y así evitar mucho trabajo con el transporte durante los meses de cosecha. Sus compañeros de banco comunal ingresan al noveno crédito con MFP, mientras que él se incorporó después y para este 5to préstamo hace el compromiso de seguir pagando con puntualidad sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Raúl is 27 years old, is a calm and responsible man, and lives with the mother of his only son in his aunt’s house. Since he was a child, he has worked in agriculture and has taken care of his plants. Now, he and his partner have decided to work together because they want to go forward by means of their crops. For this, they have rented farms, where they will sow potatoes and peas. They will pay between 280 and 340 soles for each planting. At the same time, they have joined the community lands so that in later years they will be able to become co-proprietors. Raúl is very happy with his agricultural work. For this, he wakes up very early so that at 8 in the morning he can begin his work, and he catches up with his wife at lunch. To achieve very good harvests this season, he hopes to have the opportunity to buy land that is easily accessible by cars, so that he can avoid transportation work during the harvest months. Though he joined later, his peers at the community bank got their ninth loan from MFP. For this, his fifth loan, he will continue paying his installments punctually. The money he is requesting will be invested to buy chemical fertilizers for his potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 2 cows

loans.name: Angel José

texts.es:
Angel José R. M. es un señor de 40 años de edad, vecino de  una comunidad  rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. Don Angel vive con su esposa Xinia y su hija Angie. Él tiene una finca en donde trabaja en el cultivo de hortalizas y con ganado en la producción de leche.

Don Angel es artesano pero se está iniciando como microempresario, con el establecimiento de un negocio dedicado a la hidroponía y a la  agricultura orgánica, el que poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo ha ido creando. Para ello cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa, su primo Pablo y la esposa de este, dicen que  ha logrado salir adelante con el proyecto.

 En estos momentos lo que desea don Angel es solicitar un préstamo  por ¢685,000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar plástico, madera, nutrientes, regaderas, y diferentes insumos que necesita para poder desarrollar óptimamente la actividad productiva además materiales para mejorar el establecimiento donde desempeñan la actividad. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida. 

Don Angel es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Ha recibido 2 microcréditos y los ha cancelado responsablemente. Comenta que Gracias a esto ha podido desarrollarse mejor y crecer como persona.
texts.en:
Angel José R. M. is a 40-year-old member of the rural Costa Rican community San Cristóbal Norte, which is located about 45 kilometers south of San Jose. San Cristobal is a somewhat mountainous area where people work in commercial endeavors like growing vegetables, coffee, making crafts, and raising cattle among other things. Mr. Angel lives with his wife, Xinia, and his daughter, Angie. He has a farm where he cultivates vegetables. He also has cows for milk production. Mr. Angel is an artisan, but is becoming a small business owner by beginning an organic farm using hydroponic methods – a business he has been working very hard to establish. His wife, his cousin, Pablo and his wife, all help him with his business and this is how he has been able to get ahead. What Mr. Angel would like to do right now, is request a loan of 685,000 colones to buy plastic, wood, nutrients, watering cans, and various supplies he needs to develop in the most optimal way. He would also like to buy materials to improve his work area. He hopes that in this way his micro-business will grow and generate income that will improve his living conditions. Mr. Angel is a member of San Cristobal Norte’s communal bank “SACRIN.” SACRIN is one of the hundreds of EDESA’s communal banks in Costa Rica. He has received two micro-loans and has paid both back responsibly. He says that thanks to these loans he has been able to develop and grow as a person.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de insumos

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: La señora Gloria Maria, tiene la edad de 55 años, reside en el barrio Casimiro Sotelo en la capital de Managua,  su esposo se desempeña como guarda de seguridad, sus hijos son mayores de edad, doña Gloria trabaja como cocinera en un centro de estudio, lleva elaborando dos años elaborando los ricos platillo. Su meta es poder tener su propia cominería, con este préstamo es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprar materiales de construcción para  terminar de construir el porche para poder estar en mejores condiciones y respirar aire fresco. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios alcanzado para su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria Maria is 55 years old and resides in the Casimiro Sotelo neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. Her husband works as a security guard and her children are adults. Doña Gloria is a chef at a student center, where she has worked for the past 2 years making hearty dishes. Her goal is to open her own eatery.

This is her fourth loan cycle with AFODENIC. She will buy materials to finish construction of a porch to improve the condition of her house and allow her family to breathe fresh air. Doña Gloria thanks the institution for the benefits that help her family succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 2 hijos que son su adoración y vive en su casa propia hecha a base de adobes. De joven apoyaba en los trabajos agrícolas a sus padres y desde que tuvo sus hijos trabaja doblemente sembrando arvejas y papas. También tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 6 años, por lo que organiza su tiempo para que en horas de la mañana atienda su bodega y a partir de las 2 de la tarde trabaja en sus cultivos para que sus plantas se desarrollen de forma uniforme. Sonia se encuentra muy feliz con sus cultivos, ya siente que su trabajo no ha sido en vano, por ello se siente muy satisfecha y más aún contando con los clientes de su bodega. Estas actividades le permiten cubrir la educación de sus hijos; uno cursa el colegio y el segundo la escuela primaria, por quienes trabaja muy duro para brindarles las mejores comodidades. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y durante los 7 ciclos pasados demostró ser una cliente muy puntual y aunque algunas veces no puede asistir a las reuniones de su banco comunal, envía el monto de su cuota con una compañera. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos y para el incremento de productos de su bodega.
texts.en:
Sonia is 38 years old, and is a very hard-working woman. She has 2 sons whom she adores, and she lives in her own home, built from adobe. Beginning in her youth, she helped her parents in their agricultural jobs, and since having her children, she has worked even harder, planting potatoes and peas. Since six years ago, she has also had her own grocery store. Her daily schedule is organized such that she spends her mornings attending to her store, and after 2 in the afternoon, she works with her crops, making sure that they grow uniformly and healthily. Sonia is very happy with her crops, as she can already tell that her work to grow them has not been carried out in vain. Her satisfaction is added to even more by the regular customers who she can count on at her grocery store. Her two lines of work enable her to cover the costs of her children's education; one attends high school, and the other is in primary school, and for them Sonia works very hard in order to provide them with the best comforts and opportunities possible. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and during her 7 previous cycles she demonstrated herself to be very punctual. Although she sometimes is not able to attend her communal bank's meetings, she always makes sure in such instances to send the amount she owes with one of her partners at the bank. The money that she asks for now is for the purchase of chemical fertilizer and various supplies for her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y mercadería para su bodega

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Doña Felipa O. tiene la edad de 47 años, desde muy joven ayudaba a su mama a palmear tortillas pues era su fuente de subsistir, reside en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, casada y con un hijo de 20 años de edad que estudia, su esposo trabaja en servicio de seguridad, su negocio es la venta de tortilla lleva once años ofreciendo sus ricas tortilla que es el alimento principal de los Nicaragüenses, con este crédito quiere compra materiales de construcción para mejorar el techo de su cocina que esta en mal estado. Sus planes es poder captar clientes nuevos y poder obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Since she was very young, Felipa O., 47, helped her mother pat tortillas into shape. It was their source of survival. She lives in the 380 neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has a 20 year old son who goes to school. Her husband works in a security service. Her business is selling tortillas. She has been offering her delicious tortillas, which is a primary food source to Nicaraguans, for 11 years. With this loan she wants to buy construction materials to improve her kitchen roof, which is in a bad state. Her plan is to be able to capture new customers and be able to get improved income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to repair the kitchen roof

loans.name: Svetlana Lisseth

texts.es: La joven Svetlana Rodríguez tiene la edad de 33 años, tiene una niña de 10 años de edad que estudia, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapato y golosinas tiene nueve años de trabajar en las ventas. Inicio solo vendiendo ropa por encargo con ahorro que su esposo dio. Con este crédito es su séptimo ciclo el cual lo quiere para comprar ropa, zapatos y poder ofertar la variedad de sus productos. Ella viaja a Guatemala a comprar la ropa  ya que es mas barata y la puede dar buen precio. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con los préstamos, plazos y los beneficios alcanzados.
texts.en:
Svetlana Rodríguez, 33, has a ten year old daughter who goes to school. She lives in the Hialeah neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She sells clothes, shoes, and sweets. She has been doing this for nine years. With savings that her husband gave her, she started out only selling clothes by order . This loan is her seventh loan cycle. She wants to buy clothes and shoes to be able to offer a variety of products. She travels to Guatemala to buy the clothes because it is cheaper, and she can then give a good price. She is grateful to Afodenic for the support of the loans, installments, and the gained benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Ayush

texts.en: Ayush B. is 57 years old and lives with his wife and 18-year-old daughter in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His daughter is a senior student in a local high school. Ayush started a small shoe-making business with his wife in the early 1990s. He decided to pursue a small private business after the Mongolian economy translated into a free market economy in the 1990s. Ayush makes warm traditional boots. Their customers are mostly herders who need warm and well-built shoes for harsh winters. Since they have been in the business almost twenty years, they receive shoe-orders from many herders from different parts of the country. Ayush says that he would like expand his business by purchasing a specialized sewing machine that has the capacity to sew hard materials. The sewing machine will let him produce shoes more efficiently and less costly. Ayush's and his wife's ultimate hope is to make sure that his daughter receives a good education and pursues her dream. He requests a loan to purchase a sewing machine for his shoe-making business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for his shoe-making business

loans.name: Abit

texts.es: Abit tiene 39 años, es natural de Chanchamayo (selva del departamento de Huancayo), pero desde hace varios años que vive en la ciudad de Lima con su esposa Gloria de 30 años y sus hijos de 16 y 5 años de edad. Decidió incursionar en el rubro del transporte debido a que su hermano ejercía este oficio, es así que hoy en día brinda el servicio de taxi con su motocarro como la principal actividad económica para el sustento de su hogar, puesto que su esposa se dedica netamente a su hogar y a cuidar de su hijo pequeño. Este trabajo le resulta muy rentable, ya que es socio de una empresa de mototaxis y como posee dos vehículos, obtiene ganancias por ambos. Abit se siente muy bien con esta labor, ya que tiene la independencia y tranquilidad de trabajar para sí mismo y para su familia. Es por eso que quiere adquirir otro motocarro para conformar una flota y poder tener su propia empresa de transportes. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, anteriormente trabajó en bancos comunales, pero ahora solicitó un préstamo individual porque le resulta más cómodo, ya que no tiene tiempo de ir a las reuniones de grupo. Con el dinero que solicita tramitará los documentos de uno de los motocarros para que trabaje legalmente, además de hacerle algunas reparaciones mecánicas.
texts.en:
39-year old Abit was born in Chanchamayo (in the jungle, in the department of Huancayo), but for several years now he has lived in Lima with his wife Gloria, aged 30, and their children aged 16 and 5. He decided to go into the transportation business because his brother was in this line of work. Today his motorcycle taxi-driving service is their principal means of earning a living as his wife just looks after the house and their young son. This work is very profitable as Abit is a member of a motor-taxi business, and as he owns two vehicles, he gets the profits from both. He likes his work as he has the independence and peace of mind that comes with working for himself and his family. Now he would like to buy another vehicle to add to the ones he already owns so he can have his own transportation business. This is his fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP. In the past he worked with community banks, but now he is asking for an individual loan because it is easier for him—he doesn’t have the time to attend group meetings. With the money he will get the necessary documents for one of his vehicles so that he can work legally, and he also plans to have some repairs done on the car

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair his motocycle and obtain a vehicle licence

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alakonon

texts.fr:
A. Alakonon est née vers 1950 à AGBODJEDO, un quartier populaire de COTONOU, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Alakonon est originaire de Hlacomey, un quartier situé à quelques mètres du premier. Alakonon est veuve et mère de quatre enfants dont deux filles et deux garçons tous majeurs. 

Alakonon vend de crevettes fumées et  de crabes frais.  Alakonon obtient ses produits de deux pêcheurs par troc. C’est-à-dire que échange les crevettes et crabes frais avec des filets de pêche. En effet, Alakonon connaît exceptionnellement deux pêcheurs qu’elle aide à acheter les filets servant à pêcher. Ceci permet à ces pêcheurs de se doter de matériel de travail efficace. De retour de la pêche, ces pêcheurs livrent le fruit de leur travail à Alakonon qui trouve de quoi ravitailler ses nombreux clients. 

Pendant la saison des pluies actuelle au Bénin, la crue fait monter le niveau d’eau sérieusement.  La pêche est pertubée et  les crustacées se font de plus en plus rares. Par conséquent, les produits de pêche coûtent très chers actuellement. Afin de faire face à cette inflation, Alakonon sollicite pour son sixième crédit de ALIDé. Alakonon est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien et régulière ses crédits.
texts.en:
A. Alakonon was born around 1950 in AGBODJEDO, a working-class district of COTONOU, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She traces her roots to Hlacomey, a district located a few meters away. She is a widow and the mother of four children, of whom two are girls and two are boys, all of age. Alakonon sells smoked shrimp and fresh crabs. She obtains her products from two fishermen through bartering, that is, the exchange of shrimp and fresh crabs for fishing nets. Basically she knows two fishermen exceptionally well who she helps by buying nets. This allows the fishermen to be supplied with effective work equipment. Upon returning from fishing, these fishermen deliver the fruits of their labor to Alakonon, who finds something there to supply her numerous customers. During the current rainy season in Benin, the flood waters are rising to serious levels. Fishing is disrupted, and shellfish are more and more scarce. As a result, seafood is very expensive right now. To address this inflation, Alakonon is requesting her sixth loan from Alidé. She is a former Alidé client who indeed repays her loans and regularly.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh shrimp

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja Celia de 28 años y sus dos hijos Mariela de 11 y Adrián de 9 meses de nacido. Desde muy joven, en su natal Chanchamayo (selva del departamento de Huancayo) empezó a brindar el servicio de transporte en motocarro, posteriormente migró a la ciudad de Lima donde obtiene mejores ganancias debido a que se asoció con un grupo de transportistas de motocarros donde trabaja con mayor seguridad y estabilidad. A él le gusta mucho su  trabajo y lo realiza con alegría aunque sus planes a futuro son mayores, ya que también aprendió el oficio de mecánico y siempre le ha gustado esta actividad, por ello quiere implementar su propio taller, mientras alquila el motocarro que actualmente conduce. “Todo trabajo es sacrificado” dice Roberto, pero sabe que tras mucho esfuerzo y dedicación vendrá el progreso que espera alcanzar para el bienestar de su familia. Este es su segundo préstamo individual con MFP, siempre fue muy puntual en todos sus pagos, además está muy contento de seguir trabajando con esta institución. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un motor y refaccionará su motocarro, además también invertirá en la tramitación de los documentos que necesita para la libre circulación de su vehículo.
texts.en:
32-year old Roberto lives with his wife Celia, aged 28, and their two children Mariela aged 11 and Adrián who was born 9 months ago. As a young man in his native Chanchamayo (in the jungle, in the department of Huancayo), he began a motorcycle taxi service. He then moved to Lima where he earned more money as he joined a group of motorcycle taxi drivers, allowing him to get more regular work. He really likes his work and he does it with pleasure even though he has very big plans for the future. He also trained to be a mechanic, work which he has always enjoyed. He wants to open his own workshop while renting out the motorcycle taxi which he currently drives. “All work requires sacrifice,” says Roberto, but he knows that after much effort and hard work he will achieve a better future for his family. This is his second individual loan with Kiva partner MFP. He has always been very punctual with his repayments, and he is very happy to continue working with this institution. With the money he plans to buy an engine and repair his motorcycle. He will also buy the documentation necessary to allow his taxi to travel around the city without problems.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his motorcyle and obtain documentation

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Máxima

texts.en:
Máxima is a native of Tambo Real, a rural community located in the Zurite district of Anta, approximately an hour and a half from the city of Cusco. She is thirty-nine years old and married with five children. Máxima makes dairy products at home from the milk that her cows produce. These include cheeses, yogurt, and manjar (a caramel-like spread).

Máxima is planning to use the loan to improve her production operations at home by purchasing supplies, including new molds to make cheeses. Each week she travels to Cusco to sell her products at a market. Yogurt sells for $2 per liter, while manjar and cheeses range in price from $1 to $3. Máxima is a member of the Real Solidarity Bank, made up of fourteen members who are in their second loan cycle with Arariwa. They are collectively committed to repaying the loan on time, and are also collaborating in a group savings account that serves as emergency funds for their members should anyone default.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for cheese-making business

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Don Humberto tiene 47 años de edad, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 10, 11 y 13  y están estudiando,  su esposa vende tortillas para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, su trabaja es de fontanero y tiene veinticinco años de estar laborando, ha tenido poca oportunidad para cambia r de puesto. Su anhelo es poder trabajar por cuenta propia y tener todas las herramientas necesaria para hacer su trabajo, con esta solicitud quiere compra materiales de construcción, para construir un cuarto y tener privacidad. sus planes es  poder seguir mejorando su vivienda para ofrecer a su familia un techo digno. Da las gracias Afodenic por los beneficios alcanzados.
texts.en:
47-year old Don Humberto lives in the neighbourhood of Hialeah in the capital city Managua with his wife and their three children aged 10, 11, and 13. The children attend school, and his wife sells tortillas to help her husband with expenses. Humberto is a plumber, a job he has been doing for 25 years. He has had few opportunities to pursue a different line of work. His biggest wish is to have his own business with all the tools necessary to carry out his trade. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials to build a room onto his house to give the family added privacy. He is hoping in the future to continue improving the house so that his family will have a nice home. Humberto is grateful to Kiva partner Afodenic for the improvements that he has already made.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material to add a room to his house

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren B. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two small children in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her two children both go to a local kindergarten. Dolgorsuren runs a small fast food store. In 2007, she bought a big train wagon and obtained permission to locate the wagon at the center of the town. She opened a small fast food store in the wagon and serves various Mongolian dishes for locals. Since the fast food wagon is located very close to the local black market, they usually have many customers during open hours. She has been in the food business for the last two years and hopes to expand her food business as she retains her profit in her business. She requests a loan to repair and fix the wagon and make it more comfortable for her customers. She believes that doing so will attract even more customers in the town.

loans.use: To repair and fix the wagon/cafe

loans.name: Ahètèmon

texts.fr:
O. Ahètèmon est née vers 1950 à Agbodjedo, un quartier de Cotonou, Bénin.  Ahètèmon est veuve et mère de quatre enfants dont trois sont majeurs.  À Cotonou, Ahètèmon est vendeuse de crevettes fumées.  Pour exercer son petit commerce, elle se rend chaque jour au grand marché international, DANTOKPA, où elle achète et revend ensuite sa marchandise. 

Vendeuse ambulante, Ahètèmon a dans ce marché des clientes fidèles à qui elle livre quotidiennement des  crevettes fumées. Pendant la saison des pluies au Bénin, la crue rendent la pêche difficile.  Les crustacées se faisant rares et deviennent chères. Ahètèmon veut néanmoins garder ses clientes.  Ahètèmon sollicite un crédit d’Alidé pour qu'elle peut acheter plus de crevettes.
texts.en:
O. Ahètèmon was born around 1950 in Agbodjedo, a district of Cotonou, Benin. She is a widow and the mother of four children, three of whom are of age. In Cotonou, Ahètèmon is a seller of smoked shrimp. To operate her small business, she goes each day to the grand international marketplace DANTOKPA, where she buys and then resells her merchandise. An itinerant seller, she has loyal customers at this marketplace to whom she delivers smoked shrimp on a daily basis. During the rainy season in Benin, the floods make fishing difficult. Shellfish are scarce and become pricey. Ahètèmon nevertheless wants to keep her customers. She is requesting a loan from Alidé, so that she can buy more shrimp.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked shrimp

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa, seventy years old, is widowed with seven grown up children. Currently five are working and the rest are schooling. She lives at Sefwi Bekwai in the Western Region of Ghana.

Adwoa is a petty trader and sells items like salt, ginger, spices, shear butter, etc. for thirty years now in taking care of the home (shear butter, or shea butter, is a popular natural face and hair cream and is also used as a cooking oil in West Africa). Her husband died through a prolonged sickness. She has to depend on her business to support her kids who are in school. She sells at the community market where she lives.

Adwoa complains that business is doing well but that she needs the loan to upgrade her inventory. With the loan she would buy salt, shear butter, ginger, etc. in bulk to retail to her customers. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy salt, ginger, spices, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Andrés Vinicio

texts.es:
Andrés R. R. es un señor de 32 años de edad, vecino de  una comunidad  rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. Don Andrés vive con su esposa y su hija. 

Desde hace 10 años aproximadamente que don Andrés se dedica a la animación de eventos brindando servicios de discomóvil, karaoke, serenatas rancheras, entre otros en actividades como matrimonios o fiestas. Dice que se siente muy orgulloso de su proyecto ya que desde que inició en su comunidad y en lugares vecinos lo han apoyado mucho. Con la ayuda de su hermano, don Andrés mantiene a flote su negocio.

En estos momentos lo que desea don Andrés es solicitar un préstamo  por ¢685,000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar un equipo para la amplificación del sonido. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida. 
Don Andrés es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Ha recibido 2 microcréditos y los ha cancelado responsablemente. Comenta que Gracias a esto ha podido desarrollarse mejor y crecer como persona.
texts.en:
Andrés R. R. is a 32 year old man. He lives in the Costa Rican rural community of San Cristóbal Norte, located 45 kilometers south of San José. San Cristóbal is a slightly mountainous area where you will find different types of businesses such as vegetable farms, coffee plantations, arts & crafts, livestock farms and more. Don Andrés lives with his wife and daughter.

For approximately 10 years, Don Andrés has provided mobile disc jockey services, karaoke and traditional Mexican serenades for special events, such as weddings and parties. He is very proud of his business since it has had the support of the community and the neighboring areas from the beginning. With the help of his brother, Don Andrés is able to keep his business afloat.

At the moment, Don Andrés is requesting a loan of 685,000 colones ($1200 USD) to buy sound amplification equipment. He hopes this will help his microenterprise grow and generate more income to improve his living conditions. Don Andrés is a member of the Community Credit Corporation of San Cristobal Norte (SACRIN), one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. He has received 2 previous microloans, which he has repaid responsibly. He says “thank you” for the chance to develop and grow as a person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sound equipment for special events

loans.name: Carlos Adolfo

texts.es: El señor Carlos Hernández tiene la edad de 58 años, reside en el barrio reparto Shick, su esposa le tiene dos hijos mayores que trabajan, su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos el cual vende desde hace  seis años, inicio este negocio  con dinero de la liquidación de su trabajo anterior, con este préstamo quiere invertir en ropa, zapatos para niños y adultos para captar clientes nuevos, a si como sastifacer a sus clientes con los pedidos. Da la gracia a la institución por el apoyo para reforzar su inventario y crecer en ventas. Sus planes es poder siempre apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos H. is 58 years old and lives in the Shick neighborhood division. His wife has two grown children who work. He has been selling clothes and shoes for 6 years. He started operations using the money from the liquidation of his previous business. The initial capital was invested in clothing and shoes for children and adults in order to attract new clients and satisfy their orders. He thanks the institution for helping him strengthen his inventory assortment and increase his sales. He hopes that he will always be able to support his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and men's/women's shoes

loans.name: Qorimakis Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal se denomina “QORIMAKIS”, Nombre quechua que significa, manos de oro, Este banco comunal está conformado por 11 miembros, los que viven en el distrito de Huanchaq, ellos se reúnen una vez al mes en el local principal en Cusco de Arariwa, en el mismo centro del distrito de Huanchaq.

Nuestros miembros son socios que están en su tercera fase, todos ellos realizan diferentes actividades, entre las que resaltan el comercio minorista, nuestros socios invierten sus dineros en cuatro socios están relacionados con la artesanía, ellos mismos elaboran manualmente la arcilla, la cuál la convierten en bellísimos productos decorativos, utensilios y mucho más, otro pequeño grupo invierte el dinero en la compra y venta de papa, verduras, restaurante, licores y venta de ropa, y una de las socias la Sra. Roxana tiene una agencia de turismo y tiene transporte turístico y de este modo ellos desean seguir mejorando su calidad de vida del de ellos y de toda sus familia, por lo que solicitan el préstamo, para continuar en sus negocios.

Nuestros socios valoran y agradecen el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This group is called "QUORIMAKIS," a Quechua name which means "hands of gold." The group has 11 members who live in the Huanchaq district. They meet once a month at a central site in Cusco de Arariwa, in the district of Huanchaq. Our members are in their third loan phase. They pursue a variety of activities, among which the business of retailing is prevalent. Our members invest their money in four members who work at handicrafts. They transform potter's clay into beautiful decorative products, utensils, and much more. Another small group invests money in the purchase and sale of potatoes and vegetables, restaurant liqueurs, and clothes. One of the members, la Sra. Roxana, has a travel agency and transports tourists. All the members wish to continue to improve the quality of their lives and the lives of their families. They apply for this loan to continue with their businesses and improve the quality of their lives. Our members value and are grateful for the help given through these loans, and they promise to make loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Bowoho Ban Group

texts.en:
Philemon is thirty five years old. He is married and the father of one son. Philemon is a sales person and his business is buying and selling herbal medicine. Philemon is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Bowoho ban’ which literally means protect yourself. He is the young man in a yellow T-shirt standing behind the women in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly sales people, food vendors or farmers. 

They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from Kumasi and other nearby communities and then sell their goods at the market square in their community. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The group  members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses.
 
In this group, the members provide guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan. They are requesting this loan to procure more goods to be able to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to be able to expand their business.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 37 years old. She is married and has four children. Adwoa is so happy that all of her children are in school.
She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk biscuits, etc. in her neighborhood. 

Adwoa has been taking care of her family and selling grocery items for four years. She has no regrets in what she does but her challenge is to find funds to buy more raw materials. She buys and takes delivery of stock from central Kumasi and then retails these to her customers. She is therefore requesting a loan to support her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase additional crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to expand her business and improve her savings to support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water, boxes of biscuit, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a native of Tambo Real, a rural community located in the Zurite district of Anta, approximately an hour and a half from the city of Cusco. She is thirty-three years old and married with two children.  Martha raises livestock and sells milk in her town and local markets. She also raises guinea pigs, which are a common dish in Perú.

Martha plans to use the loan for two purposes. First, she will use the loan to pay for her husband to receive medical treatment for a problem he has with his eyesight. She hopes to be able to buy new glasses for him as well. She will also continue to invest in her livestock, as milk sales provide a reliable source of income. 

Martha is a member of the Real Solidarity Bank, made up of fourteen members who are in their second loan cycle with Arariwa.  They are collectively committed to repaying the loan on time, and are also collaborating in a group savings account that serves as emergency funds for their members should anyone default.

loans.use: For medical treatment and as capital for milk business

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary C. Núñez es una señora de 50 años de edad, vecina de  una comunidad  rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. Doña Mary vive con su esposo y con sus dos hijos. 

Desde hace 15 años que doña Mary inició un negocio de confección de ropa, mayormente confeccionando prendas de lana. Ella elabora diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir que luego vende en negocios de la comunidad y sus alrededores o incluso la llegan a buscarla a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. Dice que el poder brindar un buen servicio a las personas y cumplir con sus exigencias, son la base del éxito del negocio.

Actualmente doña Mary requiere un préstamo de ¢200.000 (doscientos mil colones) para comprar una máquina especial para coser y materiales como telas, hilos, etc. Con esta inversión espera poder incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de los  productos. Afirma que gracias a este préstamo podrá atraer a más clientes, ofrecer mejores alternativas y mejorar considerablemente la calidad de sus productos.

Doña Mary es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Ha recibido 20 microcréditos y los ha cancelado responsablemente.
texts.en:
Mary C. Núñez is a 50 year old woman. She is a resident of the Costa Rican rural community of San Cristóbal Norte, located 45 kilometers south of San José. San Cristóbal is a slightly mountainous area where you will find different types of businesses such as vegetable farms, coffee plantations, arts & crafts, livestock farms and more. Doña Mary lives with her husband and their two children.

For 15 years, Doña Mary has been in the tailoring business, making primarily woolen garments. She sews different types of clothing and then sells them to businesses in the community and the surrounding areas. Some pieces are even sold from her home. Her microbusiness has helped improve her family’s living conditions considerably. She says her business is successful because of her ability to provide good service to everyone and meet their demands.

Doña Mary now requires a loan of 200,000 colones ($350 USD) to buy a special sewing machine and materials such as fabrics, threads, etc. With this investment, she expects to increase production and improve output quality. She claims that through this loan she will attract more customers, offering better choices and high-quality products.

Doña Mary is a member of the Community Credit Corporation of San Cristobal Norte (SACRIN), one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. She has received 20 microloans and paid them all responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine & materials

loans.name: Oumy Kaltome

texts.fr: oumy kaltome W. est une parente beneficiaire domiciliee dans la zone de camberene.elle s'active dans la vente de poissons et a une experience de plusieurs annees dans cet activite.elle sollicite un pret de cinquante mille(50 000)FRS AFIN D'AMELIORER SES conditions de travail et de repondre a la demande croissante de sa clientele.
texts.en:
Oumy Kaltome W. is a client parent living in the Camberene area. She is active in selling fish and has several years of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 francs in order to improve her working conditions and to respond to the growing demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Aku

texts.en:
Aku is 30 years old, is married, and is the mother of three children. Two are in school and one is breastfeeding.

Aku is a resourceful mother who, together with her husband, works very hard to provide food and school fees for the children. She is a petty trader and sells at the community market square; she enjoys selling as the business through which she makes a living. She sells items like cooking oil, pepper, spices, etc. on a table in the market.

Aku buys her stock of goods from the central market in Kumasi, which is a nearby city. She is requesting the loan to upgrade her inventory. It is her desire to support her husband in providing food and fees for the children. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, spices, pepper, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr:
O. Fatima est née le 17 juin 1934 à ADJOHOUN, une ville du département de l’OUEME.  Depuis plus de 30 ans, elle habite à Cotonou dans le quartier de Gankpodo. Elle a à sa charge cinq enfants, trois filles et deux garçons, qui sont tous scolarisés.

Fatima exerce l’activité de la vente des produits divers (savons, sucre et tomate en boîtes, détergentes, des cartes de recharge téléphonique) dans son domicile.  Elle s’approvisionne régulièrement à Dantokpa, le marché le plus grande du Bénin.  Actuellement, Fatima sollicite un crédit d’Alidé pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Fatima O. was born on the 17th of June, 1934 in Adjohoun, a city in the district of l'Oueme. For over 30 years she has lived in the Gankpodo quarter of Cotonou. She has five children in her care, three girls and two boys. They all attend school. Fatima is in the business of selling assorted products ( soaps, boxes of sugar and tomatoes, detergent, phone cards ) from her home. She buys her supplies in Dantokpa, the largest market in Benin. Fatima is now requesting a loan from d’Alidé to support her business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies assorted goods and phone cards to resell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 40 years old and is married and has four children. Currently all her children are in school in the community where they live.

Felicia owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits (cookies), etc. in her neighborhood at Sefwi Bekwai, a suburb of Sefwi. She buys her stock of goods from the Kumasi central market. She is requesting the loan to upgrade her inventory.

With the loan, Felicia wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. She believes that with her two years experience, she will be able to make good use of the loan for that purpose.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo, quien es cocinero y trabaja en un restaurante; juntos tienen 4 hijos en edad escolar y todos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa, pero también cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes y bebidas que instaló en su casa y actualmente se encuentra en reparación. Sus productos cosméticos los lleva a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona, dejándolos al crédito o al contado a sus clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto con las personas, con quienes comparte ideas y hace muchos amigos por su buena atención. Además le es muy rentable porque trabaja para una marca cosmética muy reconocida y sus clientes no dudan en solicitar estos productos. Para más adelante, Maria quiere llegar a tener un minimarket muy bien surtido. Ya tiene 4 créditos con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque ya se a acostumbrado a trabajar en unión con sus compañeros y les tienen mucho cariño. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos de belleza y ropa, así como también materiales de construcción para seguir mejorando el local de su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old and lives with her husband. He works as a cook in a restaurant. Together they have 4 children who live with them and attend school. For the last year Maria has been selling beauty products and clothing, but she also counts on income from a small general store she set up in their house. They are currently fixing up this store. She sells her cosmetics in distinct areas of her neighborhood, selling both on credit and on customer request. What she enjoys about her work is that she interacts with people, sharing ideas and making friends through her good customer service. In addition, the business generates good income as she carries a well known brand which her customers don't hesitate to buy. In the future, Maria would like to set up a mini market which she can keep well stocked. She has had 4 loans with MFP. She likes working with the communal bank because she is accustomed to working together with the other members and they all care about each other. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase more beauty products and clothing to sell, as well as construction supplies to complete the work on her small general store.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and clothing to sell, as well as construction supplies to complete the work on the small general store she runs from her home.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sarith

texts.es: Sarith tiene 19 años, es madre soltera de un pequeño de 3 años, actualmente vive en su casa propia con su hermana. Se dedica a la venta de ropa para adultos y niños, estas prendas las lleva a vender por las distintas calles de su localidad y semanalmente viaja a los caseríos o comunidades alejadas de la ciudad. En esta actividad lleva 8 meses y le está yendo muy bien, ya que no tiene mucha carga familiar y solo vela por sus gastos personales y de su hijo. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y mantiene amenas conversaciones con sus clientes. Además le es rentable porque sus prendas las vende a diario y trabaja sólo a pedido. Posteriormente, Sarith quiere comprarse un bote a motor donde pueda transportar su mercadería hacia los caseríos que se encuentran en las riveras del río y están más alejados de la ciudad. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y lo que le ha gustado es que se ha integrado a un banco comunal donde existe compañerismo entre todos los integrantes y son muy responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más ropa para aumentar sus ventas, además construirá un pequeño kiosco para implementar un negocio de venta de comida por las noches.
texts.en:
Sarith is 19 years old and a single mother of a three year old son. She and her son live in her own home, along with Sarith's brother. Sarith works selling clothing for adults and children. She takes the clothing to distinct areas of her neighborhood, and each week she travels to communities farther away. She has been doing this work for 8 months and it is going well. She is able to cover the costs of supporting herself and her son. What she likes about her work is that she gets to know different places, and she is able to have pleasant conversations with her clients. It's also a good business since she sells clothing every day, and only by request. Sarith would like to purchase a motor boat to be able to transport her clothing to the towns along the river outside of the city. This is the first loan she is requesting with MFP. She likes that she has joined a communal bank where there is companionship between all the members and that everybody acts responsibly with the payments. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase more clothing to expand her sales. In addition, she will construct a small kiosk to sell food in the evenings, as a way to supplement her income.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to expand her sales, and to construct a small kiosk so that she can supplement her income by selling meals in the evenings.
