payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 41 year old. She is married and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children. Currently all her children are attending school in junior and primary level. She has been a local manufacturer of soaps five years. Georgina combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil in the making of her soaps. She is not able to produce soap in larger quantities due to lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up her production. She hopes to improved her income to support her children's education. It is her desire to provide quality education to the children and would be grateful for that support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil etc.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is a native of Tambo Real, a rural community located in the Zurite district of Anta, approximately an hour and a half from the city of Cusco. She is forty-eight years old and married with two children.  

Lorenza makes cheeses with a laboratory system that she has at her home. During the high tourist season in the Sacred Valley, she travels to Aguas Calientes to sell her cheese to local restaurants that cater to people visiting Machu Picchu. She makes pizza cheese (which costs approx. $4 per unit), and also cheese that is used to make sandwiches.  During a typical week she sells between 70-80 units. With this loan Lorenza is planning to buy milk from outside sources so that she can produce more cheese during the high season.  

Lorenza is a member of the Real Solidarity Bank, made up of fourteen members who are in their second loan cycle with Arariwa.  They are collectively committed to repaying the loan on time, and are also collaborating in a group savings account that serves as emergency funds for their members should anyone default.

loans.use: To purchase milk to make cheese

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.es: Sylvia tiene 40 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus 3 hijos que cursan estudios secundarios. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a vender bebidas (gaseosas y cervezas) en su casa y a la vez alquila una parte de su vivienda donde implementaron un negocio de cabinas públicas de Internet. Lo que le gusta de su labor es que la mantienen entretenida, además que le es muy rentable porque las bebidas heladas son productos que se consumen a diario debido al intenso calor de la región donde vive; por otro lado, el alquiler de su local es un dinero que le ingresa de forma segura. Sylvia es una mujer muy activa, ya que ahora también quiere incursionar en el negocio de la venta de madera. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque desde que se inició con los que son sus compañeros, siempre han demostraron responsabilidad y mucha organización. Con el dinero que solicita comprará 300 soles en bebidas y con lo que resta adquirirá una moto para movilizarse en cuanto empiece con el negocio de la venta de madera.
texts.en:
Sylvia is a 40 year old single mother. She lives with her 3 children, who are all high school students. She has been selling beverages (soft drinks and beer) from home for 3 years. Part of her house is sectioned off with public Internet booths for rent. She finds her work entertaining. Her business has been quite profitable because she sells frozen drinks that are consumed daily because of the intense heat present in the region. The Internet booth rentals have also provided a steady source of income.

Sylvia is a very active woman who now wants to start another business selling wood. She is currently on her 7th loan with MFP; she will use 300 soles to purchase drinks and, with the remainder, acquire a motorbike to be used for her wood sales business. She enjoys working with her communal bank, which was started by a group of her friends. They have demonstrated great responsibility and organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise and buy a motorbike

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nuage Plus Group

texts.fr: Albert M. est vice-président dans un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Nuage Plus » qui signifie Cloud Plus en anglais. Il vend des vetements au grand marché de Kinshasa. L’expérience,  le respect des principes de gestion ainsi que la rigueur dans le travail ont fait prospérer son affaire qui lui génère un bénéfice de $10 par jour. Son rêve d’ouvrir un jour une grande maison commerciale d’habillement l’a poussé à intégrer un des groupes de Hope RDC dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier permanent en vue de réaliser ses ambitions. Il remercie Hope pour l’avoir formé en gestion. Albert est âgé de 40 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants, dont 2 d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Albert M. is the vice-president of a Hope RDC group named "Nuage Plus" which means "Cloud Plus" in English. He sells clothing at the grand marketplace of Kinshasa. Experience, respect for the principles of managing, as well as rigor in his work have made his business prosper, generating a profit of $10 per day. Albert's dream of opening a large clothing firm one day compelled him to join a Hope RDC group with the goal of realizing his ambitions. He thanks Hope for having trained him in management. Albert is 40 years old, married, and the father of five children. Two of them go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing to bolster his inventory with the goal of increasing his revenues

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr:
T. Yvette est née en 1964 à Porto-Novo, la capitale du Benin dans le département de l'Ouémé.  Yvette est arrivée à Cotonou il y a 13 ans.  Le couple vit dans le quartier de Kowégbo.  Elle s’est mariée  à FAGBOHOUN Mathias un tailleur exerçant.  Ils ont 5 enfants, trois garçons et deux filles qui sont tous scolarisés.  
 
 La plupart des charges familiales sont supportées par le mari d’Yvette. Mais, elle exerce depuis 20 ans l'activité de la vente des condiments, comme huile d’arachide et de palme, de maïs, des pommes.  Presque tout le quartier vient s’approvisionner chez-elle. Pour accroître son capital en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit d’Alidé.
texts.en:
T. Yvette was born in 1964 in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin, in Ouémé county. She arrived in Cotonou 13 years ago. She is married to FAGBOHOUN Mathias, a practicing tailor. The couple lives in the Kowégbo district. They have five children (three boys and two girls) who are all in school. The bulk of family expenses are covered by Yvette's husband. And for 20 years, Yvette has been in the business of selling condiments, such as peanut, palm, and corn oils and apples. Nearly the entire district comes to her to stock up on supplies. To increase her capital in order to satisfy her customers better, she's requesting a loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments and various goods

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is 35 years old,  married and mother of four children who are currently in school. Akua is a very hard working woman and the family depends on her so much for the family income. She is currently residing at Sefwi Bekwai in the western part of Ghana. She sells pastries like doughnuts in bulk. She prepares them and then sells them by herself through hawking. 

Akua has been doing this for nine years. She requests a loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine etc. used to prepare her pastry. She believes this can improve her profit margin within a very short time and repay the loan. She would be grateful for that support.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, margarine and firewood etc.

loans.name: Tumi Wura Group

texts.en:
Francisca is forty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to a son. Francisca is a trader and trades in ladies’ wear – footwear, dress bags and other fashion accessories.

Francisca is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Tumi Wura’ which literally means one in authority. She is behind the group in the photograph. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from Kumasi and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the market square in their community. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses.

In this group, the members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan. They are requesting the loan to procure more goods so as to be able to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: seynabou D. est une vendeuse de poissons qui habite dans la zone de camberene et est parente beneficiaire depuis 1998.elle capitalise une experience de plus de dix ans dans ce domaine.elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs dans le but d'augmenter le niveau de son commerce  ceci etant du a son ouverture vers d'autres marches.
texts.en:
Seynabou D. is a fishmonger who lives in the Camberene area. She has been a recipient parent since 1998. She is capitalizing on over ten years of experience in this domain. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs with the goal of increasing her level of business, since she is opening into other markets.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 40 years old and is a married mother with five children. All her children are currently in the primary school in the community where they live.

Leticia is very humble and committed to her work. She sells smoked cow meat in bulk at the community market where she lives. She buys her stock of cow meat from the northern region of Ghana.

Sometimes Leticia spends weeks at the northern region so that she can buy more to supply to her customers. This, she said, prevents her from frequent traveling. She requests the loan to buy more smoked meat to upgrade her inventory.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of smoked meat.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower makes dairy products with the milk that her 15 cows produce. Right now, she is making cheeses and manjar (a caramel-like spread) to sell in local markets.  A small container of manjar sells for $1 US, and a small mold of cheese sells for approximately 75 cents. 

She is a native of Tambo Real, a rural community that is located in the Zurite district of Anta, approximately an hour and a half from the city of Cusco. She is 41 years old, married and has three children. 

This borrower plans to use this loan to help finish building the house where she and her family reside. She will purchase cement, stones and blocks needed for construction.

She is a member of the Real Solidarity Bank, made up of 14 members who are in their second loan cycle with Arariwa. They are collectively committed to repaying the loan on time, and are also collaborating in a group savings account that serves as emergency funds for their members.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for home

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 37 years old. She is married and has four children. All her kids are still in school.

Georgina owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, biscuits (cookies), etc. in her neighborhood at Sefwi Bekwai. In her village most of the community members there are peasant farmers who are into crop farming and cocoa farming. 

With the loan, Georgina wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. She believes that with her five years experience, she will be able to make good use of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es: La señora Xiomara Ríos M. , tiene la edad de 42 años , habita en el barrio Sandino , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos , dos de ellos ya son independientes y la de 17 años , estudia actualmente , los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Xiomara desde hace 3 años labora como ama de llaves en una casa privada , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su salario y el de sus esposo no le para poder invertir de una vez y comprar materiales de construcción ; pero lo que mas le afecta es la parte del Zinc que esta muy deteriorado y se  le pasa por toda la casa . Con el préstamo va a comprar Zinc, perlines y materiales de construcción para hacer las mejoras y pode gozar de una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Señora Xiomara Ríos M. is 42 years old. She lives in the nieghborhood called Sandino, which is located in the municipality of Ticuantepe, along with her husband. He works and helps with the expenses of the household. They have three children. Two of them are independent, and the third, who is 17 years old, is currently studying. Their plans for the future are to be able to improve their living conditions. For the past three years, Doña Xiomara has worked as a housekeeper in a private home. The biggest difficulty this presents is that her salary and her husband’s is not enough for them to invest in the purchase of construction materials. The part that most affects her is the roof, which is very deteriorated and covers the entire home. With this loan, she would buy a roof, supporting beams, and construction materials in order to improve the home and so that she can live in a dignified home.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To materials to repair Xiomara's roof

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is a 35-year-old woman. She is married and has two kids. Currently three of them are in school. Through hard work, Gifty is supporting them in school.

Gifty is a food vendor who has sold kenkey in her neighborhood for the past eight years. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper, gravy stew or any kinds of soup and fried fish or meat. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Gifty wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. It is her dream to save more for taking care of the family.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Biako Ye Group

texts.en:
Margaret is thirty nine years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. Margaret is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers and beverage sellers. 

Margaret is also the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Biako Ye’ which literally means "oneness". The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors or farmers. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from Kumasi and sometimes from other nearby communities. They then sell them at the market square in the community they live in. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. 

Group members provide a guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan. They are requesting this loan to procure more goods and raw materials to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more supplies to expand their business

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr:
A. Salamatou est âgée de 28 ans et est née à COTONOU.  Sa famille est originaire de SAKETE, un petit village du département du PLATEAU où la principale activité est l'agriculture. Salamatou est mariée à un mécanicien et elle a trois enfants tous scolarisés.

Salamatou exerce depuis trois ans l'activité de la vente des chaussures et des habits pour enfants dans le marché Dantokpa, le plus grand du Bénin. Salamatou achète ses chaussures et ses habits en gros à Dantokpa et les revend en détail dans le même marché de façon ambulante. Son travail aide à faire les dépenses de sa famille.  Elle envisage actuellement aller elle-même à Lomé, Togo d’effectuer ses achats afin de réaliser plus de profit. Pour accroître son capital en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Salamatou sollicite un crédit d’Alidé.
texts.en:
Salamatou A. is 28 years old and she was born in Cotonou. Her family is originally from Sakete, a small village in the Plateau department where the main activity is farming. Salamatou is married to a mechanic and she has three children, all of whom attend school. For three years she has been selling shoes and children's clothes in Dantokpa, the biggest market in Benin. Salamatou buys the shoes and clothes wholesale in Dantokpa and sells them retail walking around the same market. The income from her work helps out with the family expenses. She is currently thinking of going to Lomé in Togo to buy her goods more cheaply and thus make more profit. To increase her stock in order to better satisfy her clientele, Salamatou is asking for a loan from Kiva Field Partner, Alidé.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and cothing

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 67 years old. She is widowed and is the mother of three children. Currently two of her children are working and her last born is schooling.

Agnes sells smoked fish and started her fish sales eight years ago at Sefwi Bekwai community market. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and, because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She has a high customer base that travel from other parts of the surrounding communities to buy her fish.

Agnes buys stocks of salt fish and other fish from the fishmongers. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She dreams of giving her last-born a better education through the profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is 49 years old. She is married and is the mother of three children. Currently all her children are schooling.

Akua sells smoked fish and started her fish sales twenty years ago at Sefwi Bekwai community market. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and, because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She has a high customer base that travels from other parts of the surrounding communities to buy her fish.

Akua buys her stock of fish from the fishmongers. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La señora Maria Teresa Leytón, tiene la edad de 54 años, habita en el barrio Juan Ramón Padilla en la comunidad de Ticuantepe,  ella tiene tres hijos, ya todos casados, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace seis años tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación,  inicio este negocio con esfuerzos propios. Con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, carnes, productos lácteos para incrementar su inventario y poder sastifacer a sus clientes con la variedad de sus productos. Sus planes es poder convertirla en una miselania.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Teresa Leytón is 54 years old. She lives in the neighbourhood Juan Ramón Padilla in the community called Ticuantepe. She has three children, all of whom are married. The plans she has for her family is to improve their standard of living. For the past 6 years, she has had a grocery store in her home. She began this business with her own efforts. With this loan, she wants to invest in the purchase of basic grains, sweets, meat, and milk products in order to increase her inventory and to be able to satisfy her clients with a variety of products. Her plan is to convert her grocery business into a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains, sweets, and milk products

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is 40 years old. She is a married woman with three children. Currently all of her children are in school. She lives with her family at Sefwi Wiawso, in the western region of Ghana. She has been a baker, using flour for her production, for ten years now.  In spite of the challenges she faces, she bakes bread, cake, meat pie, chips, etc. and retails them to her customers. She sells the products herself, in the market center, to her customers. Some customers also take bulk delivery bread from her. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw ingredients, as prices are going up. She requests loan support so that she can remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and, most especially, her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy baking ingredients like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is 32 years old and single. She is mother to one child who is currently in school. She lives with her family at Sefwi Wiawso, in the western region of Ghana. She has been a baker for three years now, using flour for her production. She bakes bread, cake, meat pie, chips etc. and retails them to her customers. She supplies bulk delivery bread to her customers and also sells her products herself in the market center. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw ingredients as prices are going up. She requests loan support to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and, most especially, her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Somu Yie Group

texts.en:
Monica is twenty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to a girl.
She is a trader. She trades in cereals: rice. Monica is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Somu Yie’ which literally means hold it firmly. They work very hard to support their spouses to provide for their respective families. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and or farmers. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from Kumasi, and sometimes from nearby communities, and sell at the market square in their community. Some of the members trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. It is their desire to develop their businesses to be able to improve upon their standard of living. The members have been in business for some years and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. 

In this group, the members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan. They are requesting the loan to procure more goods to be able to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy inventory.

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
K. Françoise est née le 24 Janvier 1972 à Porto-Novo et réside depuis 20 ans au quartier Kowegbo à Cotonou, Bénin.  Françoise est mariée à GOUSSANOU A. Jacob qui est fonctionnaire de la mairie de Cotonou.  Elle est mère de six enfants qui sont tous scolarisés.  

Françoise vend à domicile du maïs, de la farine d'igname en gros et en détail, des condiments, des cartons de sucre, du savon.  Elle s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, le marché le plus grande du Cotonou, et à d’autres marchés situés de l'intérieur du pays.  Pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s'agrandir, Françoise n'a d'autre issue que de recourir au prêt. C'est dans ce contexte qu'elle sollicite un crédit d’Alidé.
texts.en:
Françoise K. was born on 24 January, 1972 in Porto-Novo, and has been living in the Kowegbo area of Cotonou, Benon, for 20 years. Françoise is married to Jacob A. Goussanou, who is a municipal civil servant in Cotonou. She is the mother of six children, all of whom are in school. At her home, Françoise sells maize, yam flour in bulk and at retail, condiments, boxes of sugar, and soap. She supplies herself in Dantokpa, Cotonou's largest market, and at other markets situated in the interior of the country. To satisfy the demands of her constantly growing clientele, Françoise has no choice but to resort to a loan. It is in this context that she is seeking a loan through Alidé, one of Kiva's field partners.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments and various other products

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is 61years old. She is a divorced and mother to four children, all of whom are working. Akua is a resourceful mother who works very hard to provide food and support for her business. She is a petty trader and sells her goods at the community market square. She enjoys selling, the business through which she makes a living. She sells items like cooking oil, pepper, spices etc. on a tabletop in the market. Recently she has added the sale of rice with stew to her inventory. She purchases her stock of goods from the central market in Kumasi, a nearby city. She is requesting for the loan to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, spices, pepper, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells smoked fish. She started her fish sales two years ago in the community market where she lives. Mary buys her stock of fish from the fishmongers in Yeji, in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She prepares and serves her customers very tasty, good quality fish. Because of the quality, many customers buy from her stand. She has a strong customer base with customers traveling from the surrounding communities to buy her fish.

Mary is 54 years old. She is a married mother with eight children. Currently, two of her children are in school. She has requested a loan to increase her inventory of fish. She dreams of providing her children with a quality education. She feels this is possible through the proceeds of her business. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Adom Group

texts.en:
Margaret is forty five years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children. She sells slippers at retail. She sells by hawking. Margaret is also the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Adom’ which literally means "grace". The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and farmers. They work very hard to support their spouses in providing for their families. 

They buy their raw materials, wares or goods in Kumasi and sometimes from other nearby communities. They then sell there products at the market square in the communities they live in. Some trek to other towns to sell their products. The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They provide a guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

They are requesting a loan to procure more goods and raw materials to be able to expand their businesses and improve upon their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more goods and raw materials to be able to expand their businesses

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale business entrepreneurs in the small town of Waterloo, about twenty-two miles from Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone. Business has been growing at a very slow pace for these entrepreneurs because of low capital. With the opening of an SMT branch office in partner with Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo, these women formed a group in order to solicit a loan. With a loan, their businesses will improve, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standards of living.

They named their group, Tamaraneh, a Temne phrase meaning Let us help each other. Ramatu C. (middle) is the leader of the group.

Ramatu is now thirty-four years of age and was born in Lungi. She is married to a businessman and the two of them have two children, one in class five and the other still not of school-going age. Ramatu sells cosmetics and has been in this business for twelve years now. She will invest this loan in her cosmetic business.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Sorbeh Ii Group

texts.en:
Here are Aminata K., Mahawa M. and Bonkapri S.. They named their group Sorbeh II. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town about 22 miles from Freetown. They have come to SMT/Shine in Sierra Leone to solicit a loan in order to expand their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to add more goods into their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their living standards. 

Aminata K. (middle) is the leader of this group. Aminata is 40. She was born in Pujenhun in the southern province of Sierra Leone. She is married to a driver in Waterloo and they have four children. One of their children is in Senior Secondary School III (SSS III), the other in SSS II, another in Primary School V and the last is not yet of school age. Aminata sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). She has been in the business for more than 20 years.

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en:
Here are Kadiatu C., Kadiatu K. and Aminata K.. These local entrepreneurs from small-town Waterloo named their group Hope to God. This will be the first loan they are accessing from SMT/Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, both in terms of size and of quality. This will enable them to make more sales, improve profit and consequently improve their standards of living.

Kadiatu C. (right) is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is 40 and married to a farmer. The two of them have seven children. Four of their children are now adults and three are still in school. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman in Waterloo for many years now. She sells fertilizers, beans, ginger, corns, greens and so on.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: El señor Jose Carlos tiene la edad de 55 años, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, casado y con  cinco hijos de 14, 17,19, 21, 25 dos  de ellos  trabajan y los otros estudian.  Su negocio es la venta de ropa, electrodomésticos  y productos plásticos, que desde hace diesiciete años vende, el cual comenzó con ahorros y  liquidación de su trabajo anterior. Con este crédito va a comprar ropa, y electrodoméstico para ofertar a sus clientes. Sus planes es poder aumentar inventario para tener mejores utilidades y poder apoyar a sus hijos con la universidad que es muy costosa, es por eso su empeño de trabajar y vender. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo de los préstamos ya que este es su décimo crédito y se ha beneficiado para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Jose Carlos is 55 years old. He lives in the neighbourhood called Villa Reconciliación. He is married and has 5 children, of 14, 17, 19, 21, and 25 years of age. Two of them are working, and the others are studying. His business is the sale of clothing, domestic electronics, and plastic products. He has sold these things since he was 17 years old, when he began with his savings and by liquidating his previous business. With this loan, he wants to buy clothing and domestic electronics to offer to his clients. His plans are to increase his inventory in order to be of greater use and to be able to help his children with university, which is very expensive. This is why he began working in sales. Thanks to the institution for the help with the loans, this is already his tenth loan and he has benefited by investing in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and domestic electronics

loans.name: Progress Women Group

texts.en:
This is Mabinty T., Isatu S. and Yatta Nallo. They named their group the Progress Women group. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs in Waterloo are accessing from SMT/Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, these women can add more goods into their businesses, make more sales and improve on the profits they make. Consequently, they can better look after themselves and their children. 

Mabinty T. (left) is the leader of this group. Mabinty is 30 and married with three children. Her children are still in primary schools: classes one, three and four. Mabinty sells cooked rice in Waterloo and has been in the business for five years. She will use this loan to buy cooking ingredients on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Don Julio N. reside en el barrio dolores  en el Municipio de Carazo, tiene 52 años, casado y su esposa le tiene dos hijos que estudian, su meta es pode terminar de hacer su casa mas amplia ya que es muy pequeña. El se desempeña como auxiliar contable en la Alcaldía. Con este préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto y poder tener privacidad. Da las gracias Afodenic por los beneficios.
texts.en:
Don Julio N. lives in the Dolores neighborhood in the city of Carazo. He is 52 years old, married, and has two children who are students. His goal is to finish adding more living space to his tiny house. He works as an assistant accountant at City Hall. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials to build an additional room for more privacy. He thanks AFODENIC for providing these benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish a room

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es: El señor Silvio Antonio M., reside en el Km. 40 carretera a pochomil 3 Km. abajo ½ c al sur, tiene 37 años de edad, su esposa le tiene tres hijos que estudian, su objetivo es pode ayudar a sus hijos que estudien. Don Silvio se desempeña como director de servicios municipales,  con este préstamo desea hacer un intermedio para los cuartos y poder tener privacidad. Su planes a futuro es ampliar su vivienda para poder gozar junto a su familia de los logros alcanzados. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los créditos ya que es la única manera de poder hacer mejoras.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvio Antonio M. lives at km 40 Pochomil Road – 3 km down and ½ c to the south. He is 37 years old. His wife has three children who are students, and he want to help them continue with their studies. Don Silvio works as a director of municipal services. His loan will be used to build a hallway between the rooms of his house to provide privacy. His future plans include making expansions to his home for his family to enjoy. He thanks the institution for supporting him with this loan because this is the only way for him to make these improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish a hallway

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ana Maria tiene la edad de 45 años, reside en el Municipio de Villa el carmen Carretera viaja a León, casada, y tiene  cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos trabajan y dos estudian, la señora Ana Maria se desempeña como Vice alcaldesa de Villa el Carmen. También tiene un negocio una pulpería y venta de ropa Con este crédito quiera compra materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines para reforzar un tramo que lo administra su hijo en el mercado del municipio, ya que esta en mal estado. Sus planes es poder seguir invirtiendo en ropa, zapatos y otros productos que pueda vender y crecer en inventario como en buenas utilidades.
texts.en:
Doña Ana Maria is 45 years old, and lives in the Villa el Carmen municipality. She is married, and has 4 grown children, two of whom study, and two work. Ana Maria works as the vice mayor of Villa el Carmen. She also has a general store and sells clothing. She is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials, such as zinc, and materials to re-enforce part of the municipal market. Her plans are to continue investing in clothing, shoes, and other products that she can sell and grow her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Manuel Angel

texts.es: Don Manuel tiene la edad de 43 años, reside en una colonia Minuha en el municipio Villa del Carmen, casado, su esposa es ama de casa y le tiene dos hijos, uno trabaja el otro estudia, el señor Manuel se desempeña como audito interno, sus planes para sus hijos es apoyarlo para que culminen sus estudios. Con este préstamo que esta solicitando es para infraestructura en la construcción de un porche para gozar junto con su familia las mejoras. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de poder estar en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Don Manuel is 43 years old, and lives in the Minuha colony of Villa del Carmen municipality. He is married, and has 2 children. One of his children works, while the other studies. Manuel works as an internal auditor. His plans are to support his children so they can complete their studies. With this loan, Manuel will build a porch to enjoy with his family. He gives thanks to Afodenic for the opportunity to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
When Oscar first arrived in Miami he found work as a housekeeper, working for wealthy residents of an apartment building in a good part of town. Oscar’s friendly personality won over the residents of the building, and he began to get referrals.

One year ago, with experience in the business and a good outlook for his future, Oscar decided to stop working for the company and to start his own cleaning service. He now does maintenance and upkeep for seven commercial buildings and apartments, spending two hours a day at each location.  

At some locations, Oscar has the opportunity to increase his profits by offering car-washing as a service. He is requesting a loan from ACCION USA to purchase the equipment he needs to get started. He needs a water tank, a pump and hose, some bulk cleaning supplies, as well as a used van to transport the material.

Oscar is enthusiastic and optimistic about the expansion of his cleaning business. Because of the success of his current business, he is confident that his car-washing service will be successful as well.

loans.use: To buy car-wash supplies and a used van

loans.name: 12 De Febrero Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal “Alto Lima” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “12 de febrero”, con 12 integrantes, están juntas casi 3 años liderizadas por su presidenta Maria Elena H.. Todas tienen negocios pequeños, algunos dedicados al sector de servicio como el transporte y ellas necesitan el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, otras cuentan con negocios dedicados al área de producción  como la costura de chamarras, polleras (falda) sombreros y necesitan el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como la tela, forro, hilos y cinta y la gran mayoría se dedica  a  negocios de comercialización, como la venta de ropa, comida, tienda y otros y requieren el préstamo para la compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
The "12 de febrero" Communal Association is part of the Alto Lima Focal Center and has twelve members. They have been together almost three years and are led by their president Maria Elena H.. They all have small businesses. Some of these women work in the transportation service industry and need a loan for vehicle maintenance. Other women work in the production industry for goods such as jacket seams, skirts, and hats, and they need the loan to buy the raw materials like cloth, lining, thread, and ribbons. Most of the women run businesses selling clothing, food and other things, and they need the loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Cristina Bejarano, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Caminando Con Dignidad Group

texts.es:
“Caminando con dignidad” es un grupo de señoras  que asisten puntualmente a su reunión, liderizadas por su presidenta Rosmery M., ella cuenta que se agruparon por la necesidad de contar con un capital y poder generar sus propios recursos sin depender del esposo. Todas tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de calzados, cosméticos, carne, muebles, servicio de reparación y otros y  aseguran necesitar el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y de esta forma contar con productos variados que atraigan a los clientes.

A todas les gusta la capacitación sobre todo en temas de negocios, como la atención al cliente, ya que piensan que la buena forma de atender a los clientes les permite mantener a sus actuales clientes y conseguir otros.
texts.en:
Caminando con Dignidad (Walking with Dignity) is a group of women who punctually attend their meetings, led by their President, Rosmery M.. She relates that they came together so they could obtain capital and be able to generate their own resources without depending on their spouses. They all have different businesses, such as selling footwear, cosmetics, meat, furniture, repair services or other things. They definitely need this loan in order to buy merchandise so that they can have products which will attract customers. Most of all they all enjoy the training on business topics, such as attending to the customers since they think that providing good service allows them to keep their current customers and obtain others.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeña hija de 4 años en casa alquilada. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en el mercado central de su ciudad, tiene un puesto de ventas donde diariamente, por las mañanas, atiende a sus clientes. Karina ofrecer ropa para niños, gorros y otros artículos de acuerdo a la temporada y ocasión del año. Durante este tiempo de trabajo ha notado que sus ventas han aumentado, ya que su puesto está ubicado en una zona céntrica que le permite captar mayores clientes y que le sea más rentable. Para más adelante, Karina quiere ampliar su puesto de ventas e incrementar su mercadería. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy satisfecha con la labor que ha realizado en el ciclo anterior y ahora renueva su compromiso de seguir trabajando por el bienestar de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de más mercadería en prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Karina is 34 years old, and lives with her husband and 4 year old daughter in a rented home. For the past 5 years she has been selling dresses in the city's central market. She has a stand where she sells her products every morning. Karina sells children's clothing, hats, and other goods depending on the season. Over the course of time, Karina has noticed that her sales have increased, as her sales stand is centrally-located, which allows her to get more clients. In the future, Karina wants to expand her stand and increase her inventory. This is the 2nd time she is receiving a loan from MFP. She is very happy with the work she completed during the previous loan cycle, and looks forward to working for the good of her communal bank. The loan money will be used to purchase more dresses to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La joven Lidia Sequeira tiene la edad de 28 años, reside en la comarca los cedros  municipio de Villa del Carmen, soltera, vive con sus padres, trabaja como administradora tributaria en la alcaldía. Sus planes es mejorar su nivel de vida. Para obtener otros ingresos ella vende ropa, inicio con ahorros y vendiendo solo por encargo, con este crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar ropa, zapatos variados para niño y adulto lo cual espera captar nuevos clientes, a si como obtener mejores ganancias. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo de los créditos.
texts.en:
Young Lidia B. is 28 years old and lives in Comarca Los Cedros in the Villa del Carmen municipality. She is single and lives with her parents. She works in administration at the mayor's office. Her plans are to improve her quality of life. To generate other sources of income, Lidia sells clothing. She began with savings and only did commissioned-sales. With this loan, Lidia will buy clothes and shoes for children and adults, which she hopes will bring in more clients and more revenue. She thanks Afodenic for their loan support.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is from Tambo Real, a rural community located in the Zurite district of Anta, approximately an hour and a half from the city of Cusco. She is forty-eight years old and married with five children.

Cirila makes dairy products at home from the milk that her cows produce. Every weekend she sells cheeses at the Huancaro market in Cusco for 2 to 3 soles (approximately 75 cents to $1). Right now the space she has to keep her cows is too small. She plans to use the loan to build an enclosed area in front of her house to comfortably hold them (the picture shows the land that will be developed). 

Cirila is a member of the Real Solidarity Bank, made up of fourteen members who are in their second loan cycle with Arariwa. They are collectively committed to repaying the loan on time, and are also collaborating in a group savings account that serves as emergency funds for their members should anyone default.

loans.use: To build enclosed animal shelter for cows

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y la menor de sus hijas en su casa propia. Desde hace 17 años tiene una tienda de comestibles, donde brinda la atención a los clientes junto a su hija. Anteriormente arrendaba locales para su negocio, pero hace 2 años se instaló definitivamente en su casa y sus clientes se mantienen estables por la buena atención que brinda, lo cual le satisface porque obtiene las ganancias esperadas. Para más adelante, Marlene desea implementar su tienda con otros productos no comestibles, como útiles de escritorio, productos de limpieza, etc. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una cliente muy responsable que cumple puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de mercadería y al mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su tienda.
texts.en:
Marlene is 39 years old, and lives with her husband and their youngest daughter in their own home. For the past 17 years, Marlene has had a food store where she and her daughter attend to clients. In the past Marlene rented space for her business, however 2 years ago she moved her business to her home. She keeps a stable client base thanks to her good customer service, which allows her to count on a stable income. For the future, Marlene plans to put more nonperishable merchandise in her store, such as office supplies, cleaning products, etc. This is the 6th time she is taking out a loan with MFP, and is a responsible client who always pays her installments on time. The loan funds will be used to purchase merchandise and improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es: Don Juan O. tiene 27 años de edad, es casado de oficios Sastre,  “Confección de Playeras” cuenta con un taller de 3 maquinas, habita junto  a su esposa e hijos, él y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar Playeras en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Pacoc Siguán Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Don Juan O. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and children. He is a tailor by profession and owns a three-machine shop called "Confección de Playeras". He and his wife work in the same office with their two employees. “Playeras” has been in business for 6 years and operates from his home situated in Paraje Pacoc Siguán Cantón Poxlajuj in the Totonicapán district of Guatemala.

Now that customer demand has increased, he does not have sufficient capital to grow his business. He has applied for a loan from Asociación ASDIR with the intention of purchasing raw materials, which will result in increased sales. He also hopes that his family will be successful and experience better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: El joven  Luis Antonio tiene la edad de 20 años, soltero, vive con sus padres y reside en la comarca san Antonio del colegio 700 mts al norte ubicado en la carretera vieja a León, se desempeña en caja en la alcaldía municipal de villa del carmen. Actualmente esta estudiando y lleva tercer año en ingeniería en sistema para poder obtener a futuro mejor puesto y  mejor salario. Con el préstamo que esta haciendo es para mejorar su vivienda lo cual va a comprar materiales de construcción para comenzar hacer las mejoras de su casa y poder gozar con sus padres de una casa digna. Sus planes es poder construir un cuarto en la parte de atrás de donde su mama y poder estar independiente. Da las gracias a la institución por los logros alcanzados.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio is a 20 year old single man. He lives with his parents in the San Antonio school district located 700 meters north of the Old León Road. He serves on the municipal board for the town of Villa del Carmen. He is also in his third year of school, studying system engineering so that he can secure a job with better pay. With this loan, he will buy construction materials for home improvements so that his parents can live in a house they deserve. He plans to build a room for his mother at the back of the house to provide her with more independence. He thanks the institution for helping him succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for home improvements

loans.name: Oscar Rafael

texts.es: El señor Oscar S. tiene 27 años de edad, es Casado de oficios tejedor, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 telares, habita junto a sus esposa,  él y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un empleado para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Tzansiguan, Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar S. is 27 years old and married. He is a weaver by profession and makes “traditional women’s skirts”. Together with his wife, they operate a 2 loom workshop and have one employee. For six years they have been making skirts out of their home in the Tzansiguan neighborhood in the village of Vásquez, Totonicapán district, Guatemala. Now that customer demand has increased, they do not have sufficient finances to grow their business. For this reason, Sr. Oscar has requested a loan from Asociación ASDIR to buy raw materials needed to increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: La señora Silvia C. tiene la edad de 42 años, reside Naydayosi no-2 carretera vieja a león, desde muy joven comenzó a laborar para apoyar a su esposo el se desempeña en la construcción, su trabajo es de responsable de recursos humanos, con este crédito que esta solicitando es para hacer mejoras a su vivienda va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer una pared de concreto con esto espera poder tener una vivienda digna. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo que se le esta brindando ya que solo mediante préstamo se puede lograr vivir un poco mejor ya que todo esta caro.
texts.en:
Sra. Silvia C. is 42 years old. She resides at No. 2 Naydayosi Old León Road. From a young age, she began working to support her husband, who is a construction worker. She works in human resources.

Sra. Silvia is applying for a loan to make improvements to her home. She will purchase materials to build a concrete wall in hopes that it will make her house more livable. She thanks the institution for offering its support by providing this loan. She hopes her family will be able to live a little bit better since everything is expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a concrete wall

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 49 años, vive con sus hijos en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir de acuerdo a las condiciones climáticas de su zona, como ahora es verano vende gorras y sombreros de tela, así como ropa interior y cuando es invierno venderá casacas y chalinas. De esta manera está pendiente de las necesidades de su clientela y debido a que sus proveedores de mercadería son de confianza adquiere las novedades en diseños. Este negocio le brinda las ganancias que Noemí esperaba y le permite sostener la educación de sus hijos, por lo que se da la libertad de planificar su futuro visualizando una boutique donde comercialice prendas de vestir para toda ocasión. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy entusiasta del trabajo que va a realizar como nueva integrante de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser muy responsable. El dinero que viene solicitando será utilizado en la compra de mercadería en gorros y sombreros.
texts.en:
Noemí is 49 years old and lives with her children in a rented house. For the past 2 years, she has sold clothing according to the weather conditions in her area. Since it is summer at the moment, she sells caps, cloth hats and underwear. When it is winter, she sells jackets and scarves. She is responsive to the needs of her customers and confident that her suppliers can help her acquire the latest designs.

The profits from her business help Noemí to maintain her children's education. Her work gives her freedom to plan, and in the future, she sees herself owning a boutique that sells clothing for all occasions. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very enthusiastic about working as a new member of her communal bank and has promised to be responsible. The money she requested will be used to purchase merchandise, such as caps and hats.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Diamantes Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Diamante” están representadas por L. señora Delia y Conformado por  12 miembros los cuales empiezan su tercer ciclo en los cuales han demostrado ganas D. trabajar honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Todas las socias poseen sus propios negocios como L. venta D. abarrotes, productos lacteos, cosméticos por catálogos, comida en snacks ubicados en el parque urbano y electrodomésticos en el mercado local. L. competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas D. trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para L. adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias y mejoramiento D. su calidad D. vida. Por cursar su tercer ciclo juntas las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que L. fundación Agrocapital les otorgando un apoyo económico mientras el grupo demuestre unidad y solidaridad entre ellos.
texts.en:
The Diamante Group, represented by Delia, is comprised of 12 members who are starting their third loan cycle, having demonstrated their desire to work, their honesty and responsibility in making their payments. The members all have their own businesses—general stores, dairy product sales, cosmetics by catalog, a snack bar located in the park, or home appliance sales at the local market. Competition is high, but the group members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and their desire to work. The loan will be used to purchase the materials, supplies, and tools that will help them increase profits because their families depend on them. They want to improve their quality of life. Because this is their third loan cycle, the members all have experience with solidarity groups because Fundación Agrocapital has given them financial support, as long as the group demonstrates unity.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Guaracal Group

texts.es: Las  socias “Guaracal” esta representada por la señora Lina Constancia y conformada por 12 miembros que se conocen entre si y que van cursando juntos ya su cuarto ciclo demostrando puntualidad, honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Todas las socias realizan actividades comerciales D. venta D. productos como comida, ropa, refrescos, cosméticos, frutas, servicio D. transporte y  técnicos. Como en todo rubro D. comercio existe la competencia en sus diversas actividades pero lo que hace la diferencia es las ganas D. salir adelante para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento e para la ampliación D. sus negocios así como para la adquisición D. materiales e insumos que ayuden a mejorar la calida D. sus productos para hacerlos mas competitivos en el mercado y poder generar mayores ingresos que les den la posibilidad D. mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Guaracal Group, represented by Ms. Lina Constancia, is comprised of 12 members who are all acquainted. They are currently in their fourth loan cycle, having demonstrated their punctuality, honesty, and responsibility in making their payments. Some members sell food, clothing, beverages, cosmetics, or fruit, while other members proviD. transportation or technical services. As in all business spheres, there exists certain competition, but the main difference is their desire to get ahead and support their families. The loan will be used to expand their businesses, as well as to obtain materials and supplies that will help them improve the quality of their products. This will make them more competivite, which will in turn generate more income, giving them the chance to improve their family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nairar Sarantañani Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal “Alto Lima” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Nairar Sarantañani” que significa “Iremos adelante”, cuenta con 13 integrantes que  se caracterizan por comunicarse en su mayoría con el idioma “aymara” (idioma nativo), explican que tienen negocios pequeños y necesitan el préstamo para aumentar su capital D. trabajo, algunas venden maní, fierros, abarrote, tienda D. barrio y la mayoría venD. ropa (Ejemplo: chamarras, matillas, pantalones y otros)  en diferentes ferias D. la ciudad D. El Alto. Su presidenta es Maria Paz y menciona que les gusta reunirse para compartir e intercambiar ideas D. como mejorar sus negocios, además se sienten muy orgullosas porque muchas D. ellas han levantado sus negocios solas, por la necesidad D. darles alimento, vestimenta y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Nairar Sarantañani Association, whose name means We Will Go Forward, is found in the Alto Lima Center. It is maD. up of 13 members who speak mainly Aymara, a native langauge. They have small businesses and need the loan to increase their working capital. Some of them sell peanuts, tools, and groceries and the majority sell clothing (for example: jackets, head scarves, and other items) at different markets in the city of El Alto. The group's president is Maria Paz and she mentions that the group likes to get together to share ideas about how to improve their businesses and that they feel proud because many have started their businesses on their own due to the need to proviD. food, clothing and education to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Gerardo Santiago

texts.es: Don Gerardo R. cuenta con 25 años de edad, es Casado de oficios en servicios, “Asesor de Créditos para vivienda” habita junto a su esposa y su hijo,  lleva 1 año laborando en la Asociación  su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,   por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de sufragar los gastos, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su hijo, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo R. is a 25-year-old married man who works as a mortgage loan officer. He has been working with the association for a year. He lives with his wife and son in the Xetinimit hamlet of the Nimasac village, department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. He now turns to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan, intending to defray medical costs and hoping to be able to help his son get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gastos medicos

loans.name: Las Tulipanes Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Tulipanes” están representadas por la señora Maria Rosario y Conformado por  12 miembros los cuales empiezan su tercer ciclo en los cuales han demostrado ganas D. trabajar honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Todas las socias poseen sus propios negocios como la venta D. cosméticos por catálogos, comida, servicio D. peluquería, joyas, pan y abarrotes en tiendas D. barrios. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas D. trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias y mejoramiento D. su calidad D. vida. Por cursar su tercer ciclo juntas las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que la fundación Agrocapital asegura otorgando un apoyo económico mientras el grupo demuestre unidad y solidaridad entre ellos.
texts.en:
The Las Tulipanes (The Tulips) Communal Bank is represented by Señora Maria Rosario and consists of twelve members who are beginning their third loan cycle during which they have demonstrated a desire for honest work and have been responsible in making their payments. All of the members have their own businesses, such as cosmetics catalog sales, selling meals, hairdressing, selling jewelry or bread, or selling groceries from neighborhood stores. Their competence in the field of business is high but the group members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and their desire to work. The purpose of the loan is for the acquisition of materials, consumables and tools which will help them to generate greater earnings since that is what provides the means of supporting their families and improving their quality of life. As this is their third loan cycle together, the members have experience in solidarity groups so that Fundación Agrocapital is able to grant economic support, while the group is demonstrating unity and solidarity among themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Karla María

texts.es: Doña Karla L.  cuenta con 30 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Comerciante, “Venta de alimentos” habita junto a su esposo y a sus 3 hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 6 años en el Servicio su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Barranco Seco, Cantón Juchanep del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas por día, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Karla L. is 30 and married. She sells food. She lives with her husband and their three children. She and her husband work at the same trade. She has been serving her community; which is in the Paraje Barranco Seco, Juchanep canton, Totonicapán department, Guatemala; for six years. Currently, customer demand has increased. But, her economic conditions are insufficient to increase her capital. That is why she has come to the Asociación ASDIR to ask for a loan. She intends to buy more merchandise and be able to increase her daily sales. She also hopes to be able to help her children get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital(Food Sales)

loans.name: Jerusalen Group

texts.es: El grupo “Jerusalén”  esta representado por la señora Elia y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales van cursando su cuarto ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en sus pagos. Dentro del grupo existe un parentesco entre la señora Yolanda y Evelin que son primas pero con ingresos totalmente independientes una D. la otra. En general las socias se dedican a diferentes tipos D. negocios como la venta D. comida, cosméticos por catalogo, abarrotes y a la costura D. prensas D. vestir.  . El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso que servirá para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación y una mayor calidad D. vida
texts.en:
The Jerusalén group has 13 members, and Elia represents the group. The group is in its fourth loan cycle. They demonstrate responsibility and honesty in their payments. A relationship within the group exists between Yolanda and Evelin. They are cousins, but their incomes are totally independent of each others. The members are involved in different types of businesses like selling food, selling cosmetics by catalog, selling groceries, and making clothes. The loan is for the acquisition of materials, supplies, and tools that will help generate greater income. This will give their children a better education and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Daniel Eliseo

texts.es: El Joven Daniel C. Tiene 27 años D. edad, es Soltero D. oficios en Servicios, “Transportes”, habita junto  a sus Papas,  lleva 3 años en el servicio en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Alvarado del Cantón Juchanep, del departamento D. Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda D. su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención D. comprar los repuestos y D. esa manera poder aumentar sus ingresos, y tener mejores condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Daniel Chic, 27, is single, and he provides transportation services. He lives with his parents. He has been providing services to his community; which is in the Paraje Alvarado, Juchanep canton, Totonicapán department, Guatemala; for three years. Customer demand has currently increased, but his economic conditions are insufficient to be able to increase his capital. That is why he has come to the Asociación ASDIR to ask for a loan. He intends to buy replacement parts in order to increase his income and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for his transportation service

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “La Esperanza “ están representados por el señor Ricardo y conformado por 12 personas que en su mayoría se dedican a la venta de diferentes productos como comida al paso, cosméticos por catálogos, ropa interior y al servicio de pintura domiciliaria, a la educación y a la confección de prendas de vestir.  . La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias y mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. En lo que respecta a experiencia en grupos solidarios la mayoría de los miembros del grupo obtuvieron financiamientos con anterioridad en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen los requisitos principales que son honestidad, responsabilidad y sobre todo ganas de trabajar.
texts.en:
Mr. Ricardo represents the members of the group “The Hope.” The group is made up of 12 people, who mostly sell different products, like street food, cosmetics through catalogues, underwear, household painting services, education, and the production of clothing. The competition in this commercial setting is high, but the members of the group know how to go forward thanks to their experience and their desire to work. The loans will be used to buy materials, supplies, and tools that help to generate a larger income, since the livelihoods of their families and the improvements in their quality of life depend on these activities. With respect to the members’ experiences in solidary groups, they have received loans before from organization similar to Fundación Agrocapital, so they are familiar with the principal requirements, which are honesty, responsibility, and, above all, a desire to work.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for businesses

loans.name: Floridalma Rosa

texts.es: La Señora Floridalma B. cuenta con 47 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de Calzado”, habita junto  a su Esposo y hijos , ella lleva 15 años en la Artesanía en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas,  y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Floridalma B. is 47 years old, is married, and produces handicrafts; she produces footwear. She lives with her husband and children. She has spent 15 years producing handicrafts in her home, which is located in Caserío Xetinimit in the town of Nimasac, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. At present, her clients’ demand is growing, but her economic conditions are not sufficient for her to be able to increase her capital. For this reason, she came to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan, which she intends on using to buy more raw materials. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business (producing footwear)

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es: La Señorita Julia C.  cuenta con 28 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de Calzado”, habita junto  a sus Papas , ella lleva 6 años en la Artesanía en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas,  y tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Miss Julia C. is 28 years old, is single, and does handicrafts work; she produces footwear. She lives with her parents. She has spent 6 years making handicrafts in her home, which is located in the Casereío Xetinimit in the town of Nimasac, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. At present, her clients’ demand is growing, but her economic conditions are not sufficient for her to be able to increase her capital. For this reason, she came to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. She intends to use the loan to buy more raw materials. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business (producing footwear)

loans.name: La Exaltación Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “La Exaltación”  se encuentran representados por la señora Katterine y conformada por 13 miembros que van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad, responsabilidad y ganas de salir adelante para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En su mayoría las socias se dedican a la venta de comida pero también y en menor cantidad a la venta de dulces, ropa y al servicio de carpintería y soldadura. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias.
texts.en:
The members of the group “La Exaltación” (The Exaltation) are represented by Ms. Katterine. The group, in its second cycle, is comprised of 13 members who demonstrate punctuality, responsibility, and and a desire to move forward to give their families a better quality of life. The majority of the members sell food, but others sell sweets or clothes or offer services like carpentry or welding. Competition in the area is high but the group members know how to cope thanks to their experience and willingness to work. The loan will go towards the purchase of materials, supplies, and tools that will help increase profits which their families depend on.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials

loans.name: Enma Consuelo

texts.es: La Señora Enma Rodríquez  cuenta con 54 años de edad, es Casada de oficios en el Servicios,  “Venta de Alimentos”, habita junto  a su Esposo, ella lleva 6 años en el Servicio  su residencia que se encuentra ubicado en el 2da Calle, 2-22 Zona 7, San Cristóbal Municipio de Totonicapán y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas,  y tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Mrs. Enma Rodríquez is 54 years old, married, and lives with her husband in San Cristóbal in the municipality of Totonicapán, in the state of Totonicapán, Guatemala. She works selling food which she has done for the last six years.

The demand of her customers have grown, but she is not in the economic position to increase her capital, so she turned to the ASDIR Association to apply for a loan, with the intention of buying more raw materials in order to increase her sales and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing Raw Materiels

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Rosas“ están representados por la señora Mary Luz y conformado por 13 personas que en su mayoría se dedican al ámbito comercial como cosméticos por catálogos, comida, cerveza, ropa y al servicI. D. soldadura y fisioterapia. El grupo va cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, puntualidad y ganas D. salir adelante a pesar D. la competencia ya que sus ingresos son el pilar fundamental para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del nuevo financiamiento es para la ampliación D. sus negocios así como para adquisición D. mercadería, material se insumos que mejoren la calidad D. sus productos para ser mas competitivos en el mercado generando una mayor ganancia que les permitirá brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The group “Las Rosas” [“The Roses”] is lead by Mary Luz and consists of 13 people who by their majority have commercial businesses, such as, the sale of cosmetics through catalogs, food, beer, clothing, soldering services, and physical therapy. The group is in its third loan cycle and has demonstrated responsibility, punctuality, and a drive to get ahead despite competition; their income is the fundamental pillar that sustains their families. The new loan will be used to expand their business by acquiring merchandise, materials, and supplies that will improve the quality of their products so that they can become more competitive in the market and generate higher incomes that will allow them to give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital (to acquire merchandise, materials, and supplies).

loans.name: Noel Kemf Group

texts.es: El grupo “Noel Kemf” esta representado por la señora Saida y conformada por 13 miembros que residen en el mismo bario Noel Kemf final radial 10 donD. todas se conocen desD. hace muchos años. La mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedica a actividades comerciales como la venta D. productos como comida, hielo, cosméticos por catálogos, ropa y al servicio en talleres mecánicos. La competencia en el ámbito comercial y D. servicios es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas D. trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias y mejoramiento D. su calidad D. vida. En lo que respecta a experiencia en grupos solidarios la mayoría D. los miembros del grupo obtuvieron financiamientos con anterioridad en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen los requisitos principales que son honestidad, responsabilidad y sobre todo ganas D. trabajar.
texts.en:
The group “Noel Kemf” is led by Saida and consists of 13 members that resiD. in the same neighborhood called Noel Kemf; they all have known each other for many years. The majority of the group members have businesses in the sale of food products, ice, cosmetics through catalogs, clothing, and mechanic garages.
