Competition in the commercial and services sector is high, but the group members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and drive to work. The loan will be used to acquire materials, supplies, and tools that will help the group generate higher incomes; their families depend on this income and it will afford them a better quality of life. In respect to their experience in solidarity groups, the majority of the group members have previously obtained loans in entities similar to the Agrocapital Foundation, and they are familiar with the main requisites of these loans, which are honesty, responsibility, and above all a will to work.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital (to acquire materials, supplies, and tools).

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es: El grupo “Lucero” esta representado por la señora Cecilia y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales van cursando juntas su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y cumplimiento con sus pagos. La mayoría de las socias se dedican a actividades comerciales como ser la venta de cosméticos, ropa, comida, pan y masitas en general. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias y mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. Dentro del grupo existen socios nuevos pero que conocen la modalidad de créditos solidarios y son gente responsable, honesta y con ganas de trabajar.
texts.en:
The group “Lucero” is led by Cecilia and consists of 12 members who are now in their second loan cycle together; they have demonstrated responsibility and have fulfilled their payments. The majority of the members run businesses in the sale of cosmetics, clothing, food, bread, and general pastries. Competition in the commercial sector is high but the group members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and drive to work. The loan will be used to acquire materials, supplies, and tools that will help the group generate higher incomes; their families depend on this income and it will afford them a better quality of life. The group has some new members but they are familiar with the loan system and solidarity groups and they are responsible, honest, and hard working people.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital (to acquire materials, supplies, and tools).

loans.name: Las Activas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Activas” están representadas por la señora Claudia y conformada por 12 miembros residentes del barrio 1ª de mayo que van cursando juntos su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas de trabajar para salir adelante. Una mayoría de los miembros del grupo se dedican a actividades comerciales como comida, pan, ropa, refrescos y al servicio de amenización de fiestas. La competencia en el ámbito comercial y de servicios es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias y mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. Por cursar su segundo ciclo juntas las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que la fundación Agrocapital coadyuva otorgando un apoyo económico mientras el grupo demuestre unidad y solidaridad entre ellos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Activas” [“The Active Ones”] is led by Claudia and consists of 12 member that reside in the 1st of May neighborhood; they are on their second loan cycle together and have demonstrated responsibility, honesty, and a drive to work to get ahead in life. The majority of the group members run businesses in the sale of food, bread, clothing, drinks, and party planning services. Competition in the commercial and services sector is high but the group members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and drive to work. The loan will be used to acquire materials, supplies, and tools that will help the group generate higher incomes; their families depend on this income and it will afford them a better quality of life. Because they are in their second loan cycle together, the group members count on their experience in solidarity groups for which the Agrocapital Foundation continues given them economic support as long as the group continues showing unity and solidarity amongst themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital (to acquire materials, supplies, and tools).

loans.name: Flor De Naranjo Group

texts.es: “Flor de naranjo” es un grupo de señoras que pertenecen  al Centro Focal “Juan Pablo II”, con aproximadamente 12 años de vida, cuentan que se agruparon por la necesidad de contar con un capital de trabajo que les permita emprender un negocio y así mejorar los ingresos de sus familias, ya que lo que los ingresos de sus esposos no alcanzaba, ahora están concientes de que existe mucha competencia y tienen que ir mejorando constantemente para mantenerse en el mercado,  así todas tienen negocios diferentes como la venta de ropa, víveres, verduras,  cosméticos, peluches,  y otras de dedican la producción de zapatos y tapiz. Todas necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería o herramientas de trabajo como una nueva horma de zapato.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Naranjo” (Orange Blossom) Association is a group of women who are part of the “Juan Pablo II” Community Center, which has been in existence for 12 years. They have been brought together because they need operating capital to continue their business activities, improve their families’ incomes, and supplement their spouses’ earnings. They know that competition exists and are constantly improving so that they can keep up with the marketplace.

The members have different businesses such as selling clothes, groceries, vegetables, cosmetics, and stuffed animal toys. Others manufacture shoes and tapestries. They all need a loan in order to buy merchandise or tools (such as shoe trees) needed for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & tools

loans.name: Petrona De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Petrona de Los Angeles Q. Torres.  Tiene la edad de 42 años el negocio de la señora consiste en una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que es una mujer muy responsable y disfruta mucho de su trabajo. Tiene un varón de 7 años su compañero de vida está fuera del país, por lo que la crianza de su hijo, solamente le corresponde a ella. El negocio de ella consiste en una pulpería que está ubicada en su casa de habitación tiene además de mantener este negocio, Petrona imparte clases en colegio muy humilde de su comunidad. En la actualidad ella ya ha realizado 2 financiamientos en fundación LEON 2000 para la pulpería. La señora Petrona aspira mantener su negocio y lograr tener más recursos para mantener con varios productos en su negocio y de esta manera ayudarse para la crianza de su hijo ya que ella es madre soltera y su pareja no la ayuda económicamente a su hijo.
texts.en:
Petrona de Los Angeles Q. Torres is 42 years old, and she runs a small grocery store. She has dedicated herself to this business for over 5 years; she is a very responsible woman and enjoys her work very much. She has a 7-year-old son, and her life partner is currently outside the country, because of this she is solely responsible for raising her son. Her small grocery store is located in her house and in addition to maintaining this business she also gives classes in a humble school in her community. Currently she has had 2 loans through the LEON 2000 Foundation, which she invested in her grocery store. Petrona hopes to maintain her business and to be able to have more resources available to her to be able to carry various products in her business; in this way she will be able to help herself in raising he son given that she is a single mother and her partner does not help financially with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Simona Dominga

texts.es: Simona Dominga O. tiene la edad de 43años, es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo y ademas elaboracion y venta. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Simona inicio este medio de vida, por su Mama ya que anteriormente ella se dedicaba a este oficio, y fue con el paso del tiempo que adquirió conocimiento, y decide mantenerlo. Simona es una muy buena mujer ha tenido varios prestamos con Fundación León 2000, por lo que han sido de gran ayuda para su vida. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es proporcionarles mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Simona Dominga O. is 43 years of age, she is a single mother. She has two children under her care. Her economic activity is the butchering, preparing and selling of pork. She has been working in this business for more than 10 years. Simona got started in this business through her mother who had been working as a butcher, along the way Simona acquired knowledge about the business and decided to keep this profession. Simona is a very good woman who has had many loans from Fundación León 2000, which have been a great help in her life. The money she requests is for working capital to buy raw material. Her dream is to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Lunitas De Juan Pablo Group

texts.es: “Lunitas de Juan Pablo”, son 9 socias que se preparan para llevar adelante su reunión, inicialmente llamando la lista para luego ponerse de acuerdo en su reglamento interno, todas participan activamente dando su opinión. Su presidenta es Ada C. quien explica que las socias son esposas, madres, amas de casa y que tienen negocios pequeños como la venta de ropa, venda CD, cosméticos, fruta, pan, otras se dedican a la confección y pintado de manteles y  tejido de chompa, ellas requieren del crédito para comprar más mercadería o materia prima como pintura en el caso de la confección de manteles.
texts.en:
The “Lunitas de Juan Pablo” Association consists of 9 members who are prepared for their meetings: they call roll, agree on the procedural rules, and then actively involve themselves by giving their opinions. The group president is Ada C., who explains that the members are wives, mothers, and homemakers. They operate small businesses such as selling clothes, compact discs, cosmetics, fruit, and bread. Others produce painted tablecloths and jackets. They need a loan in order to buy more merchandise or raw materials (such as paint used in making tablecloths).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & raw materials

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La Señora Rosa María B. C.. Tiene la edad de 31 años su actividad económica es la venta de  ropa ambulante, vende sus productos sus comarcas, por lo que todos los días, se levanta muy temprano para vender todos los días y retorna a su hogar muy cansada y agotada. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Cuando Rosa dio inicio a este negocio no tenía mucho tiempo para dedicarle a esta actividad, ya que tenía que brindarle la atención necesaria para sus hijos por la tarde. Es una madre muy responsable por lo que esta realizando este tipo de sacrificios para que sus hijos logren asistir a la universidad. El préstamo que solicita es para invertir en su negocio. Su deseo es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Maria B. C.. She is 31 years of age and her economic activity is the sale of clothes as a walking saleswoman. She sells her clothes throughout the area, she gets up early every day to sell and returns to her home very tired and exhausted. She has been working in this business for over 10 years. When Rosa began this business she did not have much time to devote to this activity, since she had the responsibility of caring for her children in the afternoon. She is a very responsible mother and because of this, she is making a sacrifice to help her children attend college. The loan she is seeking is to invest in her business. Her dream is that her children succeed in completing their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for her business

loans.name: Johanna Del Carmen

texts.es: Johanna del Carmen R. D. tiene 38 años. Es madre soltera tiene 8 años con esta actividad económica. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y calzados. Johanna tenía muchas dificultades, por lo que sus hijos necesitaban el pan de cada día, y así sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda, que está ubicada en su casa de habitación, por lo que cada día salía a ofrecer sus productos y con el paso del tiempo logro establecer su tienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra ropa y calzado. Su deseo es brindarles las facilidades económicas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Johanna del Carmen R. D. is 38 years old. She is a single mother and has been working in her business for 8 years. Her business is the sale of clothing and footwear. Johanna had many difficulties meeting her children’s basic needs and moving her family forward. She owns a store that is located in her home, she used to go out every day to sell her products but over time she has established her own store. The funding she has requested is for working capital to purchase clothing and footwear. Her desire is to provide financial facilities for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Tania De Los Angeles

texts.es: Tania de los Ángeles B. C. tiene 24 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 1 hijo y vive en la casa de su Mama. La Señora B. tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de frutas y verduras. ella inicia este negocio porque su Mama anteriormente se dedicaba a vender este tipo de prodcutos.ademas para generar mas ingresos a su familia decide vender ropa y ambos negocios son de mucha ayuda.  el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de verduras como tomates, cebollas, naranjas y papa. su deseo es tener un negocio que mantenga las necesidades basicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Tania de los Angeles B. C. is 24 years old. She is a single mother. She has 1 child and lives at home with her mother. Mrs. B. has been selling fruits and vegetables for 3 years. She started this business because her mother was previously working with the sales of such products. To generate more income for her family she decided to also start selling clothes. Both businesses are very helpful. The funding is being requested for working capital for the purchase of vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, oranges and potatoes. Her desire is to have a business that will sustain the basic needs of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for the purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Blanca Giobanela

texts.es: Blanca Giobanela Hernández López, es una joven de 22 años. Tiene 1 hijo. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio por la necesidad de mantener a su hijo, por lo que sus ingresos los obtiene por medio del difícil trabajo que realiza, Blanca camina todos los días bajo el sol, y esto le perjudica su piel y la única protección que utiliza es su chaqueta. A pesar de sus circunstancias ha logrado, superar estos obstáculos y dedicarse a su trabajo. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y ropa para niños. Su deseo es obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca Giobanela Hernández López is a young woman who is 22 years old. She has 1 son. Her business is selling clothes. She has worked in this business for over 3 years. She started this business because of the need to support her child, so her income has been obtained through hard work, Blanca walks every day in the sun, and this damages her skin and the only protection she has is a jacket. Despite her circumstances, she has managed to overcome these obstacles and continue her work. The purpose of her loan is to obtain working capital for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts and children's clothing. Her desire is to have a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To obtain working capital

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 26 años, es una madre muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en la casa de unos familiares, quienes la apoyaron dándole un lugar donde quedarse. Tiene un pequeño hijo llamado Kevin de 4 años, a quien desea dar una buena vida. El restaurante de Luzmila está ubicado en una de las calles principales de la ciudad de Juliaca, el cual es muy concurrido debido a lo sabroso de la comida y a la variedad de platos que ofrece al público, lo cual ha logrado que el restaurante “La Estrella”, que es como se llama, sea uno de los más conocidos de la ciudad. Lo que más le gusta a Luzmila es atender a sus clientes y le gusta hacerlo bien, puesto que sabe que una buena atención hará que vuelvan pronto, lleva un año y medio cocinando para sus clientes y considera que lo más difícil para es atender al mismo tiempo a todas las personas que asisten a su restaurante. Para el futuro espera mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y así poder brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Este es el sexto préstamo de Luzmila con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está segura de poder hacerlo, al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos. En su banco comunal siente que está realizando una buena labor y que le tienen mucho respeto por la puntualidad que demuestra. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados renovará sus utensilios de cocina y arreglará el ambiente de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a 26-year-old woman who is a very hardworking and loving mother. She lives with her relatives who help her out by giving her a place to stay. She has a small four-year-old son named Kevin to whom she wants to give a good life. Luzmila’s restaurant is located on one of Juliaca’s main avenues. Her restaurant does a lot of business because the food is tasty and because she serves a variety of dishes. This is why La Estrella is one of the city’s most well known restaurants. Luzmila loves taking good care of her customers because she knows that they will come back soon if they are treated well. She has been cooking for a year and a half and finds that the hardest part is taking care of everyone at the same time. She would like to improve her business’s infrastructure to provide her customer’s better service. This is Luzmila’s sixth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay her installments on time and is confident that she will be able to do so, as she has been able to in the past. She works well with her communal bank and is respected since she pays her loans back on time. She plans to update her kitchen utensils and fix up her restaurant with the 800 soles requested.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovación de sus utensilios de cocina

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 49 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 3 hijos Ruth de 15, Tony de 14 y Juan de 10 años. Ellos son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos y desea darles unos buenos estudios superiores. Al restaurante de Margarita lo que menos le faltan son clientes, puesto que está ubicado cerca al terminal de la línea de transportes urbana Nº 15. Sus principales comensales son los chóferes y cobradores, quienes luego de una larga mañana de trabajo, no dudan en degustar los deliciosos platos que ella prepara. Los precios que ofrece Margarita a sus clientes son muy accesibles y este es el principal gancho de su restaurante, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinas y ver como las personas alaban su buena sazón. Lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todos sus clientes y mantenerlos satisfechos. Margarita espera que en el futuro su restaurante se convierta en uno de los más conocidos de la ciudad de Juliaca, sabe que para alcanzar sus metas tiene que trabajar muy duro y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos, pagará todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más sillas y mesas para mejorar la atención en su restaurante.
texts.en:
Margarita, 49, is a very loving and hard working mother. She lives in her own house with her three children; Ruth is 15, Tony is 14, and Juan is 10. They are the motivation for all of her efforts. She wishes to give them a good high school education. What Margarita’s restaurant lacks the least is customers, given that it is located near the terminal to the urban transportation line N° 15. Her primary customers are the drivers and the collectors who, after a long morning of work, do not hesitate to enjoy the delicious dishes that she prepares. Margarita’s prices are very reasonable, and they are the primary attraction to her restaurant. What she likes most about her work is cooking and seeing how the people praise her good seasoning. She has been doing this for seven years. The most difficult part is waiting on customers and keeping them satisfied. In the future, Margarita hopes to make her restaurant one of the most well known in the city of Juliaca. She knows that she must work very hard to achieve her goals, and she is prepared to do so. This is her fifth loan with MFP. Just as she did with her first loans, she will make all of her payments on time. She is well liked and respected in her community bank for the responsibility that she demonstrates. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy more chairs and tables to improve customer service in her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture for her restaurant

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Ofelia ha trabajado muy duro a lo largo de su vida, vive en la casa de sus familiares junto a sus 2 queridas hijas Jamileth de 8 y Jazmín de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Su consultorio obstétrico está ubicado a 2 cuadras del mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca) y es debido a esta ubicación que sus principales clientas son las comerciantes de este mercado, quienes prefieren atenderse con ella, por la confianza y amabilidad que les transmite. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus pacientes sobre los cuidados que deben tener para evitar posibles enfermedades. Son ya 2 años los que lleva con su propio consultorio, pero tiene más de 5 años de experiencia trabajando en otros centros obstétricos y considera lo más difícil es convencer a sus clientas de que los chequeos tiene que ser constantes, para evitar futuras complicaciones. Para el futuro espera mejorar su consultorio convirtiéndolo en uno de los más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca. Este es el quinto préstamo de Ofelia con MFP, está segura de poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que es muy responsable y es justamente esta virtud lo que ha hecho que en su banco comunal sea muy respetada. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevo material obstétrico y hará arreglar la infraestructura de su consultorio.
texts.en:
Ofelia has worked very hard for her entire life. She lives in her family's house with her two beloved daughters, Jamileth (8) and Jazmin (2); they are the reason why she works as hard as she does. Ofelia has an obstetrician's practice two blocks from the Tupac Amaru Market, an important market in the city of Juliaca. Because of her location, most of her clients are the women who work as vendors at the market; they prefer to be seen by her because of the trust and friendliness she exudes. Her favorite part of her work is giving her patients advice on the precautions they should take in order to avoid possible diseases. She has had her own practice for 2 years now, but she has more than 5 years old experience working at other obstetricians' practices. She says the hardest part of her work is convincing her clients to get regular check-ups to avoid future complications. Her goal for the future is to improve her practice and turn it into one of the most important practices of its kind in the city of Juliaca. This is Ofelia's fifth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. She is certain she will be able to pay all of her loan installments on time, since she is very responsible, a quality that has earned her great respect within her village bank. With the requested loan of 2,500 soles, she will buy new obstetrical materials and improve her practice's infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for obstetrician's practice

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Raciel Baernardo

texts.es: Raciel Bernardo R. G. tiene la edad de 30 años. es un hombre muy resposable con su fmailia. su actividad economica es brindar el servicio de transporte. hace mas de 7 años que se dedica a brindar este servicio. sus inicios son porque el no encontraba trabajo. y fue por medio de su Papa que aprendio este oficio que le ayudo a salir adelante. el detino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuestos del vehiculo. su mayor sueño es obtener un carro para trabajarlo como taxi.
texts.en:
Raciel Bernardo R. G. is 30 years old. He is very responsible when it comes to his family. He has been working in transportation for more than seven years. He started this business because he couldn't find another job, so his father taught him to be a driver, a job that has helped him get ahead in life. He plans to use this loan to buy replacement vehicle parts. His greatest dream is to buy a car that he can use as a taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement vehicle parts

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 25 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en la casa de unos familiares junto a su esposo Eddie de 42 años y sus dos hijos Cristian de 8 y Bruce de 2 años, a quienes desea dar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de abarrotes que más temprano habré en el barrio Bellavista de la ciudad de Juliaca, es la de Sabina, quien a partir de las 6 de la mañana empieza con la atención a sus clientes y no para hasta llegadas las 9 o 10 de la noche. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre recibe con una sonrisa en los labios a las personas que concurren a su tienda, pues lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientas y comentar sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir a la calle a realizar otras actividades. Sabina espera que en el futuro su tienda crezca y se convierta en la principal de su barrio. Este es el quinto préstamo con MFP y está segura de poder pagar todas sus cuentas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más alegres y responsables. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que vende en su tienda.
texts.en:
Sabina is 25 years old and is a very loving, hard-working mother. She and her husband Eddie, who is 42, and her sons Cristian (8) and Bruce (2) live together in the home of some family members. She wants to provide her sons with a higher quality of life. Sabina owns the earliest-opening grocery store in the Bellavista neighborhood of Juliaca, which she has been running for the past 6 years. At 6am each day she starts attending her clients, and she doesn't stop until 9 or 10pm. She is a very cheerful vendor and always receives her regular clients with a smile on her face. Her favorite part of the job is chatting with her female customers about goings-on in the neighborhood. Her least favorite part of the job is being stuck inside her store all day, unable to leave to go outside or do other things. Sabina hopes that her store will grow in the future and become the main store in the neighborhood. This is her fifth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is sure that she will be able to pay all of her loan installments on time. She is one of the most cheerful, responsible members of her village bank. With this requested loan of 1000 soles, she will purchase more products in order to increase the amount of merchandise she offers for sale at her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina tiene 43 años, es madre soltera de 2 niños: Margarita de 14 y Severo de 12 años, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar la vida que actualmente lleva. Su negocio es la compra y venta de bicicletas, los día sábados se levanta muy temprano y se dirige a la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca) a comprar bicicletas de segunda mano, las cuales lleva a su taller y con mucha destreza arregla, para después pintarlas y dejarlas como nuevas. Saturnina tiene un puesto en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), donde vende las bicicletas a precios muy accesibles y su puesto es muy concurrido porque sus arreglos son tan buenos que las bicicletas quedan como nuevas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y mejor si al final del día se queda sin mercadería, lleva 5 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es encontrar los repuestos necesarios. Para un futuro cercano espera ver crecer a su negocio y que le genere mejores ingresos económicos, con los cuales pueda costear los estudios superiores de sus hijos. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a sus compañeras de banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por el orden que le pone al grupo. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más bicicletas, pintura y repuestos, con los cuales espera incrementar la cantidad de bicicletas que arregla y luego vende.
texts.en:
Saturnina is 43 years old, and is the single mother of two children: Margarita who is 14 and Severo who is 12. She lives in her own home and her greatest wish is to improve her daily life. She buys and sells bicycles. On Saturdays she gets up very early and goes to the Explanada Laguna Temporal (the site of the fairs in the city of Juliaca) to buy second-hand bicycles, which she brings to her workshop where she skillfully repairs and paints them, making them as good as new.

Saturnina has a stall in the San Jose market (an important market in Juliaca), where she sells her bicycles at reasonable prices. Her stall is busy because her repairs are so good that the bikes are like new. What she like most about her job is selling, and the best is when she has no merchandise left at the end of the day.

She has been in this business for 5 years, and the most difficult aspect is finding the necessary parts. In the near future, she hopes to see her business grow and generate more income, which she can use to pay for higher education for her children.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she is ready to make all her repayments on time, because she does not wish to cause any problems for her fellow community bank members. She is a respected bank member because of the order that she gives to the group. With the 800 PEN she requests she will buy more bicycles, paint, and parts, which she will use to increase the number of bicycles that she repairs and sells.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Santos Agustin

texts.es:
Santos Agustín A. A. tiene la edad de 26 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y asiste a la escuela. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de disco. Hace mas de 9 años 
Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y estudia. La actividad económica de Santos ofrece los servicios de disco móvil. Comenzó realizando pequeñas fiestas locales en su comarca, y con el paso del tiempo fue obteniendo los equipos necesarios para su negocio, mas tarde realiza un contrato con el dueño de un restaurante para entretener las fiestas bailables. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que este trabajo requiere que sus aparatos sean mucho más modernos por lo que serán invertidos en su negocio. El deseo de Santos es de seguir adelente con su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos Agustín A. A. is 26 years old, married with one child. He is attending school. He works as a mobile disc jockey. He started out doing small local parties in his region, and as time went on he bought the necessary equipment for his business. Later, he signed a contract with a restaurant owner to entertain at dance parties. This is why he is requesting this loan for capital to invest in his business, since he needs much more modern gear. Santos wishes to move forward with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Evenor

texts.es: Evenor C. C. tiene la edad de 55 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de alquiler de teléfonos y recargas telefónicas. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Por lo que fue muy difícil y no tenía el dinero suficiente, para establecer su negocio en un local en particular, pero debido a las circunstancias tuvo que establecer esta actividad económica.  El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de recargas y mas teléfonos. Su deseo es proporciónale a sus hijos la comodidad necesaria.
texts.en:
Evenor C. C. is 55 years old and is married. He has two children at home. His economic activity is renting phones and selling phone cards. He has been doing this for five years, to help his children get ahead. It was difficult to establish his business in a particular location because he didn't have enough money, but he had to start this business because because of his circumstances.

This loan will be used as capital to buy more phone cards and phones. His wish is to provide his children with the necessities of life.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Luis Alfonso se encontraba en el momento de la fotografia trabajando y se tomo la decision de tomar la fotografia a la señora ya que ella es quien realiza la venta por catalogo.
El señor Luis Alfonso vive con su esposa la señora Deicy Carrizales y con tres pequeñitas que son todo su querer. El señor Luis trabaja en una empresa de la ciudad de mudanza de mobiliarios; su esposa contribuye con el apoyo de los ingresos para la familia, ya que se dedica a realizar ventas por catalogo de joyería fina.
El motivo por el cual el solicitante esta tramitando este crédito es para apoyar a su esposa en la inversión de más mercancía para sus ventas de joyería, así ella obtendrá un  precio mas barato por mayoreo, y sus ingresos crecerán.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Alfonso was working at the time the photograph was taken so it was decided to photograph his wife since it is she who does the catalog sales. Mr. Luis Alfonso lives with his wife, Mrs. Deicy Carrizales, and three little girls that he loves deeply. Luis works in the city in a furniture moving business. His wife contributes helping with the family income by working in catalog sales of fine jewelry. The reason he is requesting this loan is to help his wife invest in more merchandise for her jewelery sales so she will obtain a lower price buying at wholesale and her income will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest inthe purchase of merchandise for catalog sales.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora María D. Jesús vive con sus hijos y su esposo el señor Gerardo, son una familia muy unida y que se apoyan mutuamente.
El es taxista desD. hace 1 año y la señora María D. Jesús tiene un negocio D. abarrotes D. nombre “Abarrotes El Borre” establecido desD. hace 4 años, negocio que ha dado muy buenos ingresos ya que gracias a la dedicación y el esfuerzo ‘por salir adelante los empuja a luchar, y por tal motivo ellos están solicitando este crédito para la compra D. mas mercancía a proveedores.
texts.en:
María D. Jesús lives with her children and her husband, Gerardo. They are a very united family, and they support each other. He has been a taxi driver for one year. María D. Jesús has a grocery business called “Abarrotes El Borre”, which she started four years ago. The business has given her very good income thanks to her dedication and effort. They push her to fight to get ahead. That is why she is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise from suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Francisco Raul

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Raúl vive en compañía de su esposa la señora María de los Ángeles y un pequeñín hijo de edad escolar, la señora María de los Ángeles es empleada de una maquiladora con una antigüedad de 12 años como supervisora de línea, con una gran constancia siempre en lo que se propone. 
Don Francisco Raúl es chofer de un camioncito de transporte escolar desde hace 3 años. La gente lo conoce y confían en el ya que ha demostrado una gran responsabilidad hacia sus hijos.
La  solicitud de este crédito ya que su proyecto es liquidar la compra de este transporte, ya que meses anteriores lo compro porque el transporte que tenia ya era muy viejo y necesitaba un automóvil mas reciente.
texts.en:
Francisco Raúl lives with his wife, María de los Ángeles, and his small, school aged son. María de los Ángeles has worked for a factory for 12 years as a line supervisor. She always has great perseverance in what she does. Francisco Raúl has been a small school bus driver for three years. People know him and have confidence in him because he has demonstrated great responsibility with their children. He is asking for this loan to pay off this vehicle. He bought it months ago because the vehicle he had was very old, and he needed a more recent automobile.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay off his vehicle

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio vive solamente con su esposa la señora Francisca Amador, son una pareja muy unida y establecida. 
El señor se dedica a la elaboración y venta de barbacoa, todos los días sábados y domingos sobre pedido, negocio que tiene desde hace 16 años; también se encarga de la repartición  de una panadería en las diferentes tiendas de venta desde hace 8 años. 
Don José es una persona emprendedora y con una gran visión de salir adelante, ya que no solamente tiene estos ingresos sino que cuenta con ingresos extras mediante la venta por temporada de bolis, paletas de hielo etc. 
Y el motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito es para la inversión en diferentes productos para su venta de temporada.
texts.en:
Sr. José Antonio and his wife, Sra. Francisca Amador, live by themselves. They are a united and well-established couple.

Don José sells barbecue every Saturday and Sunday by request. He has been in this line of business for 16 years. He is also in charge of distribution for a bakery that services different retail shops, a position he has held for 8 years.

Don José is a hard worker and has ambitious plans to get ahead. Not only does he want to maintain his current income, he wants to earn some extra money through a seasonal business selling Bolis (a Mexican brand of ice cream treats), crates of ice, and other frozen items. He is requesting a loan so that he can sell these seasonal products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a new business selling frozen treats

loans.name: Flor

texts.en: Flor B. is from the village of Brgy. Yumbing Camiguin. She is 25 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Flor owns and operates a specialized retail business, primarily selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Flor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Flor is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.  About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Marysol

texts.en:
Marysol B. owns and operates a specialized retail business selling cellphone load in her community. She is 33 years old, married and has two small children. They are from the village of Brgy. Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin. Marysol has been in this business for over ten years. She earns approximately 3,360 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marysol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marysol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marysol is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her house.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a cellphone load business

loans.name: Mrs. Rin Sao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people living in Khav village in Takeo province make up this village bank, and they will use this loan for various purpose. Mrs. Rin S. is the 29-year-old village bank president. She is a basket maker, saving money for her family. Her husband, Mr. Chea Knet, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Although they work hard, they still need more money to provide a better house for their family. Thus, Mrs. Rin S. decided to ask for a loan to buy zinc and timber to repair the house. This couple has three children who are attending the local school.

Four members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy zinc and timber to repair a house

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is from the village of Brgy. Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 42 years old. Anita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling green bananas, vegetables and fruit including beverages, in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Anita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia G. is 62 and she lives with her husband, Jose G., who is 70,  and their youngest child, who is a high school student. Their other 5 children now have their own families and their own lives to manage. Aside from having one child to send to school and focus on, Eufemia is also helping one of her sons in her business. Through a loan she received from ASHI last year, she bought a motorcycle and a sidecar for a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar attached)- for-hire business. 

Tricycles are one of the major means of transportation for people living in villages all over the municipality. Tricycles can have a capacity of eight passengers and generate income in daily basis. This has been Eufemia's major source of income and her son's as well. The tricycle is rented by her son daily while Eufemia has her own income from being an a school canteen attendant. 

Eufemia's husband is a farmer; he also helps her despite his old age. However, most often he doesn't have income because farming is seasonal. Eufemia's loan from ASHI is one of the biggest factors that keeps her business going and sustains the needs of her child in school. Without her tricycle-for-hire business Eufemia she would feel like she lost one of her legs. Therefore, she applied for a loan from ASHI intended for her business to operate. She needs to pay her tricycle's yearly tax, and renewal of the tricycle and driver licenses. 

With success in this kind of business, Eufemia envisions having another tricycle with her next loan, in order to increase her income and to help other unemployed members of her family.

loans.use: payment for the vehicle monthly tax, maintenance, and renewal of vehicle and driver licenses.

loans.name: Ma. Salvacion

texts.en:
Ma. Salvacion A. is 32 and is married to Eduardo A., who is 36. They have 2 children.  Ma. Salvacion sells food while her husband worked as an electrician in a privately-owned electronic shop, which repairs televisions and other electronic devices. Television repair was his major task. Though both Ma. Salvacion and her husband were earning, their income could not meet the increasing financial needs of their family. Therefore, Ma. Salvacion and her husband decided to request a loan from ASHI in order to start up their own business.

In Ma. Salvacion's house, a mini-electronic repair shop was set up and is managed by her husband, while she sells barbeque and entertains customers that come in. Eventually, her business grew and they were able to acquire many customers from all over the municipality. Ma. Salvacion requests a larger loan to sustain the increasing and growing demand of their business. Someday she hopes to have her own shop that can employ other people to work with her husband. She also dreams of sending her two children to college and that they have their own careers in the future.

loans.use: materials needed for television repair

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia V. is 50 years old and is married to Francisco V. Jr. The couple were blessed with four children. Their youngest child is still studying in high school,  but the eldest only finished elementary school while the second and third attended some high school. Letecia considered this a failure for herself but according to her she had no options then. She and her husband were just laborers and had a very small income. They didn't even have capital to start up a business. 

In 2007, Letecia heard about ASHI. Her dream of having a stable life with stable house and stable future of her children was rekindled, despite her chidlren's educational attainment. When she received her first and succeeding loans from ASHI, shestarted her own business of buying and selling vegetables. It has been two years that she has had this kind of business. Buying and selling vegetables has been a great help to Letecia and her family.  However, the demand of her family grows as years goes by, so  she aspires to have more business that can add  to her present income so she will have bigger profits and savings. 

Letecia thought of raising pigs (hog-fattening) in her backyard to be sold after four months. With this kind of business, she can still manage her previous business, because either her children or husband can feed the pigs at home when she's away selling her vegetables. Letecia's loan is intended for this. Someday, as her income increases, she wants her hog fattening business to grow. She plans to sell her pigs during market day in the town's public market.

loans.use: purchases needed for a hog-fattening business, such as 2 piglets, feed, immunizations, and also to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is requesting a loan from Kiva of PHP7, 000, which she will use as additional working capital for her general store, located in the public market of Tumauini, Isabela. She has operated her business for 20 years. She patiently maintains her business in order to provide the daily necessities of her family and to give them a better life. She wants her business to grow more so she is asking for the financial assistance of Kiva lenders. 

Amalia has two children, they already finished their two-year course in college. She is married to Leon, who is a tricycle operator in their village. They help each other to give their family a good life. At the moment, the couple is saving funds for the repair of their house, since their children already graduated from college and are looking for jobs. Amalia hopes that the loan will be provided so they will have a better chance of achieving their goals.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Dionita

texts.en:
“To see is to believe,” is Dionita’s favorite quotation in life. She is not the type of woman who is easily convinced until she has seen something proven. Dionita is already 42 years old and she is married to a tricycle driver named Teodoro S.. They have four children--two are still studying while the other two are already working as apprentices near their hometown. Dionita still dreams that her two eldest children will pursue their education in college. She is proud that her children also sacrifice to help reach their goals.

Dionita has always wanted to help her children but because she belongs to an indigent family their living conditions sometimes make this harder. She is glad that her husband is earning an income from driving a boundary basis motorcycle in their village. For 15 years, the business has served as their source of daily income. Dionita wants to help her husband meet their financial needs, especially for the maintenance of the motorcycle he uses in transporting passengers. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP from Kiva. She hopes that Kiva will help them with their business to increase their income.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance
