texts.en:
Florentina B. is managing a vending business. She has a small stall on the sidewalk in front of her house where she sells cooked snacks and some grilled chicken parts. She also sells bread, juices, candies and other goods. She hopes to improve her business to be able to provide herself and some of her relatives with enough financial support to meet their immediate daily needs. Since her capital is not enough to maintain her business and to build on it, Florentina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP as additional working capital.

Florentina resides in her cousin’s vacant house located in Sta. Barbara Old Centro Ilagan, Isabela. She is already 36 years old and has no children yet because she separated from her husband a long time ago. She is working diligently to generate an income to support herself. She hopes that her retail business will soon expand because she also wants to help her family who have supported her in her time of need.

loans.use: To expand a retail business

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
This modest villager of 27 years, Ung S., resides in Siem Reap Province. She is currently a fish seller in the local market. She normally sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing. She is the mother of two school-aged children who both assist her in selling fish when they are free from studying. 

Since 2003, Ung S. has always hired a taxi to help pick up fish to sell at the market because she does not own a vehicle. Therefore, she would like a loan of $300 to buy a used motor. The new motor will allow her to cut the cost of hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a used motor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine, a 41-year-old businesswoman, sells cooked food during lunchtime and some refreshing snacks during snack time. As her business is located in St. Barbara Centro Ilagan, Isabela in front of Victory bus terminal near their village, most of her customers are passengers and drivers. Her husband is always there supporting and helping her in maintaining their enterprise, which is the couple’s main source of income. They are supporting their three children who are presently studying in college, high school, and elementary school respectively. Their two eldest children are both already married.

Geraldine hopes to someday have a store to earn a better income and provide better service to her customers. The couple aspires to increase their daily income, currently only PHP300, which is just enough for daily school allowances and basic needs at home. Geraldine is requesting a loan from Kiva of PHP 4,000 as additional working capital to make her business more productive in order to better provide for the needs of the children and accrue some savings in the event of an emergency.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila manages a general store in the public market of Tumauini, Isabela, only a kilometer away from their village. She just started the business last year, and is now requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos to have additional working capital.

She is glad that she is able to allocate a small stall in the public market where she sells a variety of commodities. Laila and her husband would like to save their income for their future children. They have no children yet after three years of marriage but are hoping to have some soon. She is hoping that by the time their children arrive, their standard of living will have improved.

Laila would like her business to grow and be more successful as the years pass by. For now, she is focusing on the business for its growth. She is aiming for a higher income which she will save for the education of their children. She prays that someday, God will bless them with kids to feel the essence of a family. She believes in the saying that “while there is life, there is hope.” According to her, her dreams will someday be attained because “God is good all the time.”

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Badam-Ochir

texts.en:
Badam-Ochir M. is 19-year-old and is newly married. He lives with his new wife and 1-year-old son in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He has a small business in ice cream-making. He has been running a small ice cream shop since 2008. He finished a tour with the national army and got married to his wife last year. Upon his marriage, he started his first private business--ice cream making.

From the start, his business has been doing well and the sales volume has been climbing from the beginning. This month, his business capital has increased to 850,000 Mongolian (about $590 US). He aims to increase the variety of ice cream products that he offers now. He would also like to add more flavors in his ice cream portfolio. Badam-Ochir says that he would like to expand his ice cream-making capacity as the demand for ice cream surges during this hot summer. He requests a loan to purchase additional freezer and ice cream ingredients for his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional freezer and ice cream ingredients

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia C. is from the village of Purok 9B Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Gaudencia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gaudencia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling barbecue or grilled chicken and pork meat in the local community. Gaudencia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos (about $21 US) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gaudencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gaudencia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gaudencia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok 9B, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.en:
“Try and try until you succeed” is the principle in life of Maria Rosario B.. The young mother is a resident of Sta. Barbara Ilagan, Isabela, She is a single mother and works as a manicurist/pedicurist to gain income and be able to give her children their daily needs and save funds for their future education. Her two children are not yet in school but are consuming a lot of expenses because of drinking milk every day.

Maria Rosario is humbly asking assistance from Kiva to lend some amount of capital to be used for her service business. She wanted to buy new sets of beauty products for her pedicure/manicure activity, and even start doing hairdressing somehow if given the chance to have a capital of 6,000 Philippine pesos. She always believes that the customer’s satisfaction is what makes a business successful, which is why she would like to provide them with a good and complete service. She also believes that through her hard work and by doing the right services for her customers she will benefit her family.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Loun

texts.en:
Loun L., 25, is a vendor selling a few fresh fish, vegetables, and grocery items from her store in front of her home. Almost of her customers are people who live near her house. She is married to Phoeun Sophean, age 28, who works driving a taxi to earn a living. The family has been blessed with three young children who are of school age.

Loun L. is taking out a loan expand the size of her business. In addition, she proposes to use some of this loan money to buy a piglet to begin raising. This will provide her with extra income.

loans.use: To expand the size of her business

loans.name: Luy

texts.en: Luy L. is a pig breeder, who asking for a loan to hire a repairer to paint her old wooden house. She is 37 years old and is a mother caring for three kids who are students. She is married to Vann Koeum, 46 years old, who is a local palm climber. The family are people living in the rural area of Siem Reap Province, in Cambodia.

loans.use: To hire a house repairer to paint her old wooden house

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie C. is just 23 years old and a mother of two children. She wants to save funds for the future education of her children by running her simple vending business in their village at Barangay Sta. Barbara Ventro Ilagan, Isabela. For five years of doing her business, her income has remained almost the same because there has been no improvement taking place in her vending because of lack of financial working capital. That’s why she is asking for a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 8,000.

The loan will be of big help to be able to purchase additional products for her store. Marie has been dreaming of growing her business, to have a complete inventory and her own permanent store someday. She hopes that through her business, she will be able to attain her dreams in life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Muiddin

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Муиддин парень , который кредитуется на расширение своего бизнеса.Он торгует на рынке Худжанда фруктами и овощами.Каждый свой займ он использует целенаправлено.Поэтому у него заметно увеличивается оборотный капитал.Муиддин благодарен инвесторам за понимание и финансирование.Следующий кредит он хочет потратить на закуп партии огурцов, помидоров и других фруктов.
texts.en:
Muiddin is a young man, who is getting financing to expand his business. He sells fruits and vegetables at a market in Khujand. He uses every one of his loans purposely. This is why his working capital is noticeably increasing. Muiddin is grateful to the investors for the understanding and financing. He wants to use his next loan to buys a stock of cucumbers, tomatoes and other fruits.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мархабо молодая женщина , которая продаёт детскую одежду в магазине на рынке Худжанда. За товаром она ездит сама в город Бишкек., раз в месяц. Она хочет на следующий кредит съездить за товаром и привезти школьный ассортимент товаров для девочек и мальчиков. Мархабо благодарна инвесторам за финансирование.
texts.en:
Marhabo is a young woman, who sells children’s clothing at a store at the Khujand market. She travels for the merchandise herself to the city of Bishkek once per month. She wants to use her next loan to travel for the merchandise and bring an assortment of school goods for girls and boys. Marhabo is grateful to investors for the financing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's school goods

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: The man shown in the picture above is Mr. Sim R., a married man of 45 years old. He has a big pigpen behind his house where he raises many pigs to earn a living. In this work, his wife also helps him in caring for their pigs. Besides raising pigs, the family has always been in the annual business of growing rice. The couple has been blessed with six children: four are single and two are married and live independently. Two of them are employed working in construction. Sim R. will be using the loan  to acquire a large number of pigs to raise.

loans.use: to acquire a large number of pig to raise

loans.name: Sadri

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
   Садри  Насимова имеет среднее техническое образование. С мужем в разводе, мать 4 детей. Дети живут с матерью, отец после развода не навещает детей. Поэтому ей самой приходится воспитывать и содержать семью. По специальности работать ей не пришлось, так как зароботная плата низкая. Поэтому она пошла по пути торговли, и работает на рынке.
  Садри продает детскую одежду и нижнее белье на рынке. Для того, чтобы увеличить доходность, ей нужны денежные средства. Узнав о том, что наша организация выдает кредиты, она обратилась к нам. После ознакомления с условиями наших продуктов, Садри подала заявку на получение кредита.
texts.en:
Sadri N. has a secondary technical education. She is divorced from her husband and is mother of 4 children. The children live with the mother; the father does not visit the children after the divorce. This is why Sadri has to raise the children and support the family by herself. She could not work in her field because the salary is low. This is why she went into sales and works at the market. Sadri sells children’s clothing and undergarments at the market. She needs money in order to increase profit. Having learnt that our organization gives loans, she came to us. After learning about our terms, Sadri put in a request for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover and profit

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Ахмедова Саломат женщина , которая торгует на рынке «Сомон» женской одеждой. Она кредитуется пятый год.Хочет на полученный кредит съездить в Бишкек и привезти летние блузки для женщин и платья. Саломат благодарит организацию и инвесторов за финансирование и понимание и поддержку. За период кредитования у неё увеличился товарооборот и следовательно прибыль.На снимке Саломат в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Salomat A. is a woman, who sells women’s clothing at the Somon market. She has been our client for the fifth year. She wants to use her loan to go to Bishkek and bring summer blouses and dresses for women. Salomat is grateful to our organization and investors for the financing, understanding and support. Over the period of financing, her goods turnover increased and, subsequently, profits. The photograph shows Salomat on the disbursement day.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer merchandise

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20206050017) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Y. Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a 5-member loan group offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Y. Vĩ 04 (4).

T. is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. is requesting a loan from SEDA for the first time. She is now requesting a loan of 2,912,000 VND which will be used to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Nguyễn Thị V. (20206050018) is a 30 year-old woman who is requesting a 3,360,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business.

2. Nguyễn Thị Y. (20206050019) is a 26 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. Nguyễn Thị T. (20206050020) is a 30 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4. Nguyễn Thị S. (20206050021) is a 28 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her a furniture-making business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

T. Nguyễn Thị (20206050017) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Y. Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Y. Vĩ 04 (4). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm nung trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND. T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 2.912.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị V. (20206050018) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 2. Nguyễn Thị Y. (20206050019) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Nguyễn Thị T. (20206050020) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Nguyễn Thị S. (20206050021) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Бердиева Назокат проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 36 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Назокат более 8 лет занимается животноводством, она откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот. Ее муж занимается услугой такси. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы купить скот.
texts.en:
Nazokat B. lives in the Qurgan-Tube district. She is 36 years old, married and has 4 children. Nazokat has been involved in animal husbandry for over 8 years. She feeds and sells cattle. Her husband is a taxi driver. Client is requesting a loan in order to buy livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden S. is from the village of Purok 9B Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 41 years old. Eden is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Eden works in someone else's business venture in the retail sector operating as a dealer. The main source of income for the business comes from daily peddling of beauty products by Avon and Fullerlife in the local community. Eden is just starting this business. She has also a DVD rental business.

In 2009, Eden joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Eden from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok 9B, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Zebi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Зеби женщина . которая кредитуется пятый год.Она работает учительницей в школе, но по выходным дням она выходит торговать посудой на большой рынок. Её оборотный капитал на так уж большой . Поэтому она берёт не большой кредит, для закупа сахарниц и солонок.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Zebi is a woman who has been taking out loans for five years. She works as a school teacher, but on weekends she sells housewares at a large market. She doesn't have much working capital, so she would like a small loan to buy sugar bowls and salt shakers.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase housewares

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали Мамуров проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 43 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Шерали более 20 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает бахчевые растения, а потом продает их на рынке. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения и горючее и  использовать их для посева.
texts.en:
Sherali M. lives in the Qurgan-Tube district. He is 43 years old, married and has 6 children. Sherali has been involved in agriculture for over 20 years. He primarily grows melon plants and then sells them at a market. Client is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and fuel, and use them for sowing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
B. Nguyễn Thị (20201060042) is a 37 year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. B. is the group leader of a 5-member loan group offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Trác Bút 06 (6).

B. is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, B. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. B. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5.500.000 vnd a month from these activities.

On 12/16/2008, B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.186.000 vnd from SEDA. This previous loan was used to expand shelter for the borrower's livestock. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 vnd which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. B. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Nguyễn Thị B. (20201060044) is a 34 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.600.000 vnd loan to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.

2. Mẫn Thị T. (20201060045) is a 33 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 vnd loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store.

3. Mẫn Thị P. (20201060046) is a 26 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.600.000 vnd loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.

4. Nguyễn Thị G. (20201060051) is a 26 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 vnd loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. B. Nguyễn Thị (20201060042) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. B. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Trác Bút 06 (6). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. B. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, B. kiếm được khoảng 5.500.000 vnd. Vào 16/12/2008, B. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. B. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.186.000 vnd từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mở rộng chuồng cho gia súc của người vay. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 vnd. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị B. (20201060044) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 vnd. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ. 2. Mẫn Thị T. (20201060045) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 vnd. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 3. Mẫn Thị P. (20201060046) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 vnd. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 4. Nguyễn Thị G. (20201060051) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 vnd. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed  and other supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mahmadumar

texts.ru: Уразов Махмадумар болеее 20 занимается торговлей. Он имеет собственную аптеку. Уразов женат, имеет 4 детей. Проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 43 года. Махмадумар просит кредит, чтобы закупить новые товары и увеличить товараоборот.
texts.en:
Mahmadumar U. has been involved in sales for over 20 years. He owns a pharmacy. U. is married and has 4 children. He lives in the Qurgan-Tube district. He is 43 years old. Mahmadumar is requesting a loan in order to buy new products and increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new products and increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Noelyn

texts.en:
Noelyn H. is from the village of Purok 9B Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 41 years old. Noelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Noelyn works in someone else's business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling beauty products in the local community. Noelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Noelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Noelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Purok 9B, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Abduchabor

texts.ru: Тагоев Абдучабор проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 56 лет. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Абдучабор более 25 лет занимается животноводством, ему в этом помогают дети. Абдучабор покупает крупно рогатый скот откармливает и продает. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить скота.
texts.en:
Abduchabor T. lives in the Qurgan-Tube district. He is 56 years old, married and has 7 children. Abduchabor has been involved in animal husbandry for over 25 years. His children help him with this business. Abduchabor buys cattle, feeds it and sells it. Client is requesting a loan in order to buy livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастура Асоева проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 49 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Мастура более 6 лет занимается производством, она в основном выпускает корзины, кувшины из прутей. Клиентка просит кредит, для того чтобы отремонтировать мастерскую и закупить сырье для производства.
texts.en:
Mastura A. lives in the Vahdat district. She is 49 years old, married and has 4 children. Mastura has been involved in manufacturing; she mainly weaves baskets and pitchers from twigs. Client is requesting a loan in order to remodel her studio and buy materials needed for production.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Studio remodeling and purchase of materials

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
"N. Nguyễn Thị (20201030041) is a 52 year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. N. is the group leader of a 5-member loan group offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Phố chờ 07 (7).

N. is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, N. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling school products such pencils, pens, and notebooks in the local community. N. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. is requesting a loan from SEDA for the first time. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Nguyễn Thị Lý (20201030042) is a 50 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

2. Nguyễn Thị T. Thả (20201030043) is a 19 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector.

3. Chu Thị H. (20201030044) is a 28 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector.

4. Nguyễn Thị H. (20201030045) is a 29 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector, operating a clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena B. is from the village of Argayoso, Manticao Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Jena is married and has 3 very young children. To make a living, Jena owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector: a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Шаходат Гайбуллоева торгует на рынке. Продает парфюмерию и хозяйственные товары. Растит детей, у нее 1 сын и 2 дочери. Трудно приходится Шаходат без мужа, он умер 6 лет назад. В годы своей жизни они занимались торговлей вместе, теперь в этом Шаходат помогает ее сын Акмал. Помогает маме торговать, расставляет продукцию по полкам, присматривает за магазином, когда мама отлучается.  
 Шаходат хочет получить кредит, для того чтобы использовать его в расширении ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Shahodat G. sells perfumes and household goods at the market. She is raising her children – she has 1 son and 2 daughters. It is difficult for Shahodat without a husband, who passed away 6 years ago. During their years of life, they were involved in sales together, and now Shahodat’s son, Akmal, helps her. He helps his mother sell, organize products on the shelves and look after the store, when his mother has to step away. Shahodat wants to obtain a loan in order to use it for expanding her goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding goods assortment

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.ru: Хидирова Машхура проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 35 лет. Разведена, имеет 2 детей. Машхура более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке. Машхура просит кредит, чтобы закупить новый ассортимент одежды. Она хочет накопить сбережения для дальнейшей учебы детей.
texts.en:
Mashkhura H. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 35 years old, divorced and has 2 children. Mashkhura has been involved in sales for over 6 years. She has a retail store at the central market. Mashkhura is requesting a loan in order to buy a new assortment of clothing. She wants to save money to pay for her children’s education.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new clothing assortment

loans.name: Nor Ralah Group

texts.en:
Nor Ralah is the leader of the Nor Ralah group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for their business. 
Nor Ralah wants to take out a loan for his business of selling car ink. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. Shayma wants to take out a loan for her business of Gould selling.
Gaytah wants to take out a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy a new machine for her business. 
Samar Gull wants to take out a loan for her business of carpet weaving. She wants to make her business larger.

With this loan the group members can improve and enlarge their businesses, support their families, and make a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn J. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old. Noralyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. Noralyn owns and operates a specialized retail business in the local community. She sells "RTW" or ready-to-wear items. Noralyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Noralyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noralyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair their jeepney, a transport vehicle, the business of her husband. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Noralyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: the repair of their "jeepney"

loans.name: Abdull Jabar Group

texts.en: A. Jabar is the leader of A. Jabar group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to receive a loan for advancing their business. A. Jabar wants a loan for his general store, Sayada wants a loan for her carpet-weaving business, and Anesa wants a loan for her tailoring business. They requested a group loan of 30000 Afghani. They are very happy with this loan and thank all lenders, AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: To advance their businesses

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife M. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Marife is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services using their "habal-habal" or motorcycle vehicle to local community members. Marife and her husband have been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earn approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marife is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for motorcycle maintenance. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marife from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save for future emergencies and for the children's school fees.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: the motorcycle maintenance or repair

loans.name: Honimkul

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Хонимкул  Холикулов проживает в Зафарабадском районе, и как многие наши клиенты этого региона занимается откормом скота и переработкой молока.  Животноводством он занимается в домашних условиях. В переработке молока ему помогает жена Ойимбиби. Из свежего парного молока она заготавливает кефир, который очень любят ее дети. Иногда молоко и кефир у нее покупают соседи. У Хонимкула с Ойимбиби 3 дочерей.
Хонимкул дополнительно работает в дехканском хозяйстве «Ният».
Для откорма скота и покупки бычка он запрашивает сумму в размере 2000 сомони.
texts.en:
Honimkul H. lives in the Zafarabad district, and as do many of our clients in this district, he is involved in feeding livestock and processing milk. He runs the animal husbandry business out of his home. His wife, Oyimbibi, helps him with milk processing. She makes kefir from fresh milk that her children love very much. Sometimes, neighbors buy milk and kefir from her. Honimkul and Oyimbibi have 3 daughters. Honimkul also works at the Niyat dekhan farm. He is requesting a loan in the sum of 2000 somoni for livestock feeding and purchase of a bull.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding livestock and purchase of a bull

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Rosita is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon S. is a rural villager of 45 years old, who lives in Siem Reap Province. Here, she makes a living raising pigs in a pig stall located near her house on her land. She raises pigs in order to raise their offspring and for meat. Since the beginning of 2001 up to the present, she has raised pigs. She wants to help be responsible for the family’s daily food needs; her husband works in construction.

Mon S. faces difficulties with her traveling needs because she always pays a lot of money to a taxi driver when she and her family want to go anywhere. Therefore, she hopes to reduce the amount she spends on transportation by using her loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Adelanta

texts.en:
Adelanta is a day care worker in the village of Research Minante 1 Cauayan, Isabela. She is 57 years old, already a widow, and blessed with five children. Her voluntary work as a day care teacher only gives her small honorarium from their city hall, thus for her to earn extra income, she brings biscuits and packaged juices to sell at the school. That way, the parents of her students are also assured that their children eat nutritious foods during break time.

Adelanta wants her business to become productive for her children’s future because she knows that the time will come when she will be quitting her profession, thus she is hoping that Kiva will lend her a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 as additional business capital.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Chori

texts.en:
Chori is a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur. He is married and has 4 children. Chori works in the central city market selling kids' clothing together with the help of her wife (pictured). His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for 4 years.

Once a month Chori travels to the neighboring city to purchase new goods. Chori likes to work for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family. Today, Chori would like to ask for a loan of 6500 Somoni to purchase new clothing for resale. We believe Chori’s drive for success will help this entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Chori’s business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  new clothing for resale

loans.name: Torpayki Group

texts.en: Torpayki is the leader of Torpayki group. There are four members in this group. They all want to expand their businesses and progress well. Torpayki wants a loan for her son who has mobile selling card. A. Ahmad wants a loan for his shop where he sells marbles. Shakab wants a loan for his general store. Seeveta wants a loan for her tailoring business. They are requesting a group loan 40000 Afghani, and they are very thankful to Kiva lenders who can support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty J. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Betty is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Betty owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Betty has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities

In 2008, Betty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used for motor vehicle repair and a portion of it went into the store as additional capital. Betty is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her store. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Betty from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business (variety store)

loans.name: Abduzoir

texts.en:
S. Abduzoir is a farmer. He grows potatoes and other vegetables to support his family. He is 48 years old and has 5 children. He is worried about getting money to sustain his farm business. His wife and children support him in all his decisions. In the photo you can see his daughter.

Abduzoir has been tilling the land for 7 years. He is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni that he will use to buy more seeds and fertilizer. The loan will allow him to have an abundant harvest. Abduzoir and his entire family are sincerely thankful to all of you.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elvita

texts.en:
Fish vending is the main source of income for Mrs. Elvita C.. She lives at Barangay Research Minante 1 (Cauayan City) together with her husband, Camillo, and her three children. Two of their children are still studying. The older is in college and the other one is in secondary level. At the age of 44, she is really working hard to help her husband earn money for the education of their children.

Elvita also shares that her business means a lot to her not only because it helps her earn money; through it, she also meet new friends. Aside from that, her self confidence also increases through communicating with different people. To further increase her income to support the education of their children, Elvita is requesting from Kiva a loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 as additional capital.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is already 53 years old. She lives in Barangay Paddad Alicia, Isabela with her family. Despite the difficulties in life, still they are living happily and peacefully together. Her husband’s name is Cristobal B. and he is a farmer. The couple is blessed with five children of whom two are still studying while another one is working abroad as a domestic helper.

Erlinda told us that having a child working abroad is very helpful in supporting their needs, but it does not mean that she can just stay at home and wait for her child’s salary, thus she decided to engage in the vending business. She retails mongo beans and rice in their village.

Erlinda has only been in this business for two months but according to her, it really helps her lot. For that reason, she wants to expand the business by purchasing a sack of mongo and other kinds of beans and at least three sacks of rice to retail, thus she wants to take out a loan from Kiva. She hopes that with the amount of PHP 15,000 as additional capital, her business will progress.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Mr. Khut L. is 55 years old and his wife, Mrs. Noch Chom (shown in the picture), is 48. This old couple currently earns a living raising pigs as well as planting vegetables for sale. They have three school-aged children and a married child. One of their children is employed in construction. 

Khut L. is taking out his loan to buy a boat, which he will use to begin fishing around Tunle Sap River. He proposes to buy a cow to help with plowing the farmland with the remainder of the loan.

loans.use: To buy a boat, which he will use to begin fishing around Tunle Sap River

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Иброхим Усаров родился в 1961 году, проживает с женой и 3 сыновьями в Зафарабадском районе. Иброхим занимается животноводством и переработкой молока. У него огромный опыт и десятилетний стаж работы.
Иброхим впервые получив кредит в нашей организации, потратил его на откорм скота, продажа которого принесла ему хорошую прибыль. Ему понравились условия кредитования, и он повторно подал заявку на получение кредита для откорма крупнорогатого скота. 
Иброхим кроме животноводства, занимается сельским хозяйством.
texts.en:
Ibrohim U. was born in 1961. He lives with his wife and 3 sons in the Zafarabad district. Ibrohim is involved in animal husbandry and milk processing. He has extensive experience and 10 years of work. Ibrohim first obtained a loan from our organization and used it for feeding livestock, sales of which brought him a good profit. He liked the financing terms and put in a second request for a loan for feeding cattle. Besides animal husbandry, Ibrohim is also involved in agriculture.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding cattle

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Taking care of a special child is really difficult. It requires patience and willpower, but with the case of Mrs. Estela T., she is lucky to be assisted by the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD). She and her husband are blessed with eight children. Their youngest, who is 22 years old, is a special child. But it does not hinder her from engaging in fish vending.

Estela sells different kinds of fish. Aside from that, she also sells cell-phone load credits in their village. With her businesses, she is able to earn an average income of PHP 1,400 weekly that is very helpful to her family. According to her, making her business progressive will surely uplift their lives; thus she seeks a PHP12,000 loan from Kiva.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Muhammad Shafeq Group

texts.en: M. Shafeq is the leader of M. Shafeq group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take out a loan for expanding their businesses. M. Shafeq is a mechanic and wants a loan for his shop in which he repairs cars. Afeza wants a loan for her husband who has a fruits and vegetables shop. Maeruam wants a loan for her tailoring business. Abdul K. wants a loan for his truck. They are requesting a group loan of 40000 Afghani, and they are very happy about this loan process that is available in Afghanistan and around the world.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a long-time hog raiser. Maintaining the business helps provide for her family's needs. She is 58 years old and married to Diosdado, a service driver for the Department of Agriculture. They are blessed with five children who are now married; however, some of them are still living with Evelyn and Diosdado.

Because of financial problems, she has difficulty sustaining her hogs with enough feed; thus, she is requesting to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 from Kiva. She is planning to buy additional piglets to raise and sacks of pre-starter and grower feeds for the livestock. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will grant her loan.

loans.use: To buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D. C. is a rolling vendor in the village of Barangay Research Minante 1 (Cauayan City). She is a 56-year-old widow and is blessed with six children. Two of her younger children are presently studying, thus she strives to provide for their daily needs. 

With the help of her motorcycle, Fe is able more easily to move about their village to sell her different products such vegetables, fruits, meats, fish and breads. She earns around PHP500 net income weekly in the business. Since she serves as the bread winner of her family, Fe is requesting the assistance of Kiva lenders for her to borrow a loan amounting to PHP40,000, as additional working capital for her business. 

She hopes that the amount will enable her develop a vending stall in their village and eventually sell cooked foods to further increase her daily income.

loans.use: To develop a vending stall to sell cooked foods

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina A. lives in the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old, widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for her business comes from selling a variety of different products. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for her work.

In 2009, Marcelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has applied for a new loan of $125 to buy additional products to sell. This loan will be the first taken out by Marcelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Gull Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Gull Ahamad is the group leader of Gull Ahamad group. There are four members in this group. They all live in district 11 and each of them would like to take a loan for their own business. The total amount of their group loan is 50000 Afghani.

Gull Ahamad and A. Aleym want to take a loan for their business of gas-selling. They want to B. necessary materials for their business. Satarah wants to take a loan for her business of embroidery. She wants to expand and further her business. Zayba Gull wants to take a loan for her bakery business. She wants to B. firewood for her business. They are all very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to expand and enlarge their businesses

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea D. is 21 years old, single and committed to help her parents by running her own store in the village of Paddad in Alicia, Isabela. Lea has been in business for three years, and went into direct sales when she had to stop her studies because of a lack of funds. 

Over the last three years, Lea has invested her income in a sari-sari (or general) store. At present she is generating an average daily income of PHP 3,000. She is grateful that her business is doing well, and she wants to expand it. To make this possible, she has applied for a $325  loan from Kiva to buy more products to sell from her store.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Zakaui Group

texts.en: Zakaui is the group leader of Zakaui group. There are three members in this group. They all want to take out a loan to further their business and make it larger. So they are requesting a group loan of 42000 Afghani. Zakaui wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store. Zhiu Gul wants take a loan for the business of quilt-making. Mawonsa wants to take a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver, so they are very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn P. lives in the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a specialized retail shop where most income is generated by selling gasoline to the local community. Evelyn's business is still in the start-up phase, and she has joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has applied for a loan of 4000 PHP to buy additional products to sell. This loan will be her first, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated by her small company to support education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Learnie

texts.en:
For the last year, Learnie has made a living by operating a general store. She is 35 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school. Her husband makes a living buying and selling appliances. The couple hopes that their work will allow them to give their children a better life in the future. 

The couple's children are: Nichelle - 13 years old, who is in high school; Nizzalyn - 9 years old, who is in grade school; and Nick Emmanuel - who is 4 years old and still too young to go to school. The family lives at Barangay Research Minante 1 Cauayan City. 

Learnie has applied for a PHP 40,000 Kiva loan to buy more products to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in her store

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi L. was the long-time owner of a small restaurant which served a range of Nepali and Tibetan foods. After running this business for many years, Laxmi decided to start a new business selling cosmetics.

Laxmi just opened her new shop this week and is requesting a loan of $275 to invest in it. The loan will help her buy a wide range of products to sell, including facial creams, makeup, nail polish and deodorants.

Laxmi’s husband works in a printing factory. The couple have two children, a son and a daughter. Laxmi hopes that her business will succeeed so that she can help pay her family’s living expenses.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and body products to sell in her new shop

loans.name: Rhelna

texts.en:
Rhelna R., a resident of the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental, is married and has 11 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rhelna owns and operates a specialized retail business whose main income is derived from the selling of "copras" or coconut fruit. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rhelna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase more products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Rhelna’s fourth from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima O. is already 56 years old. She is married to Virgilio who is a farmer. The couple is blessed with a big family. They have nine children. Some of them are already married while others are working in Manila and abroad to assist them with some of their financial needs, especially in providing their two younger siblings who are still studying in college and high school. The family is happily living in the rural area of Barangay Paddad Alicia, Isabela. 

Maxima sells different kinds of beans and rice as her source of income. Sometimes, she also sells vegetables in their village. She is glad that she is able to generate PHP 1,000 average net income per week, which she uses for their daily basic necessities and allowances of her children who are attending school as well.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 25,000 for her to improve her business and be able to establish a vending stall in their house so she will no longer have to walk every time to sell her vending products. She believes that patience and perseverance is the key to succeed in every life’s endeavor.

loans.use: To improve her business by building a vending stall.

loans.name: 013-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
"N. Thị Ninh is a 52-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Ninh is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 013-Quảng Hưng (18.01.013). Ninh is married and has three adult-aged children. To making a living, Ninh owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Ninh has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2005, Ninh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ninh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business further. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ninh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. D. Thị Phiên is a 64-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business. 2. N. Thị Dung is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 3. H. Thị Yến is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 31 years old. She is single and the mother of two children. Currently all her children are in community school. She has been a local manufacturer of soap for two years now. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods, and coconut oil to produce her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities for lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to raise her income to support her children's education. It is her desire to provide quality education to the children and would be grateful for that support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods, and coconut oil etc. to make soap.

loans.name: Abdul Saboar Group

texts.en: A. Saboar is the group leader of A. Saboar group. There are three members in this group. They all want to expand their businesses and do well. A.
