Saboar wants to take a loan for his business: a fruit and vegetables cart. Zalilka wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store. Leela wants to take a loan for her husband who has a metal working shop. So they are requesting a group loan of 27000 Afghani. They are very grateful for AFS and Kiva lenders that can support all poor people.

loans.use: For  business progress

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Wanting to make her general store more productive, Rowena decided to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP17,000 as her additional capital. She patiently manages her store in order to generate a daily income for the education of her two children and to assist her husband in providing for their agricultural needs. 

Rowena is now 39 years old, and married to Raymundo L. who is a farmer. They have two children: Roxanne Grace - 20 years old, who is a college senior student; and Rochie Mae - 15 years old, who is currently enrolled in third year high school. Her family is living in a simple village where farming is the main activity of most residents.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 38 years old. She is blessed with six healthy children namely: Kennedy - 19 years old (college student); followed by Kenneth - 15 years old, (high school student), Kimberly - 11 years old, (elementary student); Twinkle - 8 years old, (elementary student), Nicole - 6 years old (elementary student); and Wendy - merely 3 months old. Her family lives in the rural village of Research Minante 1 Cauayan, Isabela. Wilma manages a food vending business to help her husband support their family living. 
She shares that through their hard work and perseverance, they will be able to improve their living conditions. She hopes that through Kiva loans, she will also develop her vending business like other vendors do. She is requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP15,000 as additional business capital. She will probably increase her weekly income of PHP2,500 from her food vending in their village. She also said that through her income in the business, she is able to support the education of her children, even their daily basic necessities.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela C. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Estela is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Estela owns & operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling charcoal, rice, firewood and more in the local community. Estela has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Estela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Estela is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Estela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a businesswoman in Sefwi. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials. She is 48 years old, married and lives with her husband. She has nine children who are currently in school. She is very supportive to her family through her trading business. She has been selling for the past 10 years but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make a more viable profit. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. It is her desire to rent a store in the community market. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng R. is 51 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh town where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. She is widowed and the mother of two children: one is married and lives away from the family home and the other one is single and works in the garment industry. Leng R. works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time. Recently, Leng R. faced the fact that her house cracks down during heavy rains. To solve this problem, she requested a loan to hire a repairer to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Luftiniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Лутфинисо Зокирова проживает в Зафарабадском районе. Она одна из самых активных и добросовестных клиентов нашей организации. Лутфинисо очень нравиться работать с нами, условия кредитования нашей организации ее вполне устраивают. Неоднократно получив кредит, она смогла увеличить свой товарооборот,  расширить ассортимент товара и получить прибыль. 
          Она очень благодарна КИВЕ  за поддержку микропредпринимателей, работающих в такой же сфере, как и она.
На этот раз, Лутфинисо  хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы к ассортименту своего товара, который состоит из продуктов питания, присоединить макароны разных видов.  Место реализации  ее товара рынок «Дусти». В бизнесе ей помогает муж Хусен.
У Хусена и Лутфинисо 4 детей. 3 дочерей вышли замуж, имеют своих детей, живут самостоятельно. Сыну Лутфинисо 22 года, он студент, учится на экономиста в Таджикском Государственном Университете.  
 Запрашиваемая сумма 4600 сомони. Хочется отметить, что Лутфинисо Зокирова первый раз подавала заявку на 300 сомони, и смогла успешно воспользоваться этой суммой и  суммами кредита, полученными  после этого. Сейчас, шаг за шагом увеличивая сумму кредита, она дошла до 4600 сомони. Таким образом,  кредитуясь, она смогла успешно продвинуть свой бизнес, а значит, и улучшить условия своей жизни. Поддержим ее в очередной раз!
texts.en:
Luftiniso Z. lives in the Zafarabad district. Her business is located at the Dusti market. Her husband, Husen, helps her with the business. Husen and Luftiniso have 4 children. Three of their daughters got married, have their own children and live independently. Luftiniso’s son is 22 years old. He is an economics student at the Tajik State Universtity. Luftiniso is one of the most active and conscientious clients of our organization. Luftiniso likes working with us very much, and she is satisfied with our lending terms. Having repeatedly obtained loans, she was able to increase her goods turnover, expand goods assortment and make profits. She is very grateful to Kiva for supporting micro businesses that operate in the same field as she does. This time, Luftiniso wants to obtain a loan in order to add various types of pasta to her merchandise assortment, which consists of food products.

The requested sum is 4600 somoni. We would like to note that Luftiniso Z.’s first loan was for 300 somoni, and she was able to successfully use that sum and sums of loans obtained after that. Now, having increased the loan sum step by step, she reached 4600 somoni. Thus, using financing, Luftiniso was able to successfully move her business forward and, subsequently, increase her quality of life. Let’s support her once again!

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various types of pasta

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 43 years old, married and a mother with seven children. All her children are currently in the primary and the junior high school, respectively, in the community where they live. Cecilia is very humble and committed to her work. She sells smoked cow meat in bulk at the community market where she lives. She takes stock of cow meat from the northern region of Ghana.

Sometimes she spends weeks at the northern region so that she can buy more to supply to her customers. This, she said, prevents her from frequent traveling. She requests a loan to buy more smoked meat to upgrade her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of smoked meat.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Ашурова Рано, женщина 48 лет, имеет двоих детей. Муж уже семь лет как умер. Поэтому она сама вместе с сыном занимается жизненными проблемами и семейными расходами. Рано имеет бизнес по производству шашлыка, который продаёт и изготавливает её сын. А сама Рано имеет несколько помещений, которые она сдаёт в аренду и имеет дополнительный доход с арендных выплат ей. Получив кредит Рано хочет отремонтировать столовую, которую она сдаёт в аренду одному бизнесмену. Для чего решила получить кредит. На снимке Рано в своём кабинете в день мониторинга.
texts.en:
Rano A. is a 48-year-old woman, who has two children. Her husband passed away seven years ago. This is why Rano and her son take care of life problems and family expenses. Rano has a business of making kebobs, which her son cooks and sells. And Rano also owns several spaces that she leases out and has an additional income from lease payments. Once she receives the loan, Rano wants to repair a café that leases to a businessman. This is why she decided to obtain the loan. The photo shows Rano in her office on the day of monitoring.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cafe repair

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is 50 years old, married and a mother with five children. All her children are currently in the primary and the junior high school in the community where they live. She is very humble and committed to her work. She sells smoked cow meat in bulk at the community market where she lives. She takes stock of cow meats from the northern region of Ghana.

Sometimes she spends weeks at the northern region so that she can buy more to supply to her customers. This, she said, prevents her from frequent traveling. She requests the loan to buy more smoked meat to upgrade her inventory. It is her dream to save more to take care of the children.

loans.use: To buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 27 years old and has three children with her 30-year-old husband Alex. Josie's eldest child is eight years old, second is six years old and youngest is one year old. For her children, Josie dreams of having them experience a comfortable life and finish their studies until college.

When ASHI came to the municipality of Sibalom where Josie and her family live, she did not let the chance of a loan pass her by. She joined ASHI in 2008 and she availed her first loan then. She knew in her heart that her membership in ASHI was a step towards achieving her dream. Therefore, loans she received from then on were used to put up an initial business that generated her own income. This helped her husband who is a tricycle driver (motorcycle with a sidecar attached to it. Most common means of transportation of people all over town.)  

Now Josie applied for another loan intended for her vision of having a backyard poultry (raising of chicken) and hog (pig) raising business. Chickens will be raised up to 45 days and will be sold thereafter while hogs will be raised up to four months and will be sold thereafter. Josie realized having this kind of business could maximize her time while she attends to her previous business, a variety store, and to her children. While at home, she believes she can make money that will change their lives.

loans.use: To buy piglets, chicks, and feed.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina L. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Edina is separated from her spouse and has three adult children. To make a living, Edina owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Edina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Edina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Edina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. Currently all her children are schooling. She has been a local manufacturer of soaps for three years now. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities for lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to raise her income to support her children's education. It is her desire to provide quality education to the children and would be grateful for that support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 39-year-old married mother of four school-aged children. She is determined to provide for her children through hard work and commitment. To support them, she has been selling cosmetics such as spray, powder, lipstick etc., as well as blouses, through hawking. Janet takes delivery of stock from the nearby town of Kumasi and sells it in the local neighborhood to her loyal customers.

Janet says selling cosmetics is very lucrative. She therefore wants to expand her inventory in order to make a good income to sponsor her children’s education. She is sure that your loan support will bring her the desired results.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is married to Patricio D., a village farmer, and they are blessed with two children, Cristel and Chrichelle. Brenda believes that by joining the Kiva loan program, she will be able to expand her general store business in her village of Barangay, Manano, Mallig, Isabela. With the income from her store, Brenda is able to help her husband provide for their daily needs at home, especially for their children.

Brenda would like to borrow the amount of 6000 PHP from Kiva partner, ASKI, to have sufficient capital to develop her store and increase her daily income. Her two children are already in college and so Brenda and her husband need to double their efforts to cope with their children's tuition fees and some other needs in school. The couple make big sacrifices and they hope that Kiva lenders will be of great help in terms of their financial needs.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Муким, мужчина который кредитуется уже четвёртый год и займ использует для расширения своей столовой. На следующий кредит он хочет закупить мяса, продукты питания , напитки, и одну духовку. На снимке Муким в день мониторинга на месте деятельности в столовой.
texts.en:
Mukim is a man who has been our client for the fourth year already. He uses loans to expand his café. He wants use his next loan to purchase meat, food products, drinks and one oven. The photo shows Mukim on the monitoring day at his place of business in the café.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita B. is a 60-year-old widow from the village of Mahayahay, Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community, such as cacao for tablia making and lumpia shanghai (a type of spring roll). Lolita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Lolita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a shop business.

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Лола кредитор в организации с 2007года. Она работает учительницей в средней школе , только во вторую смену. А до обеда она работает в самбусочном цеху по производству самбусы. Следующий кредит она хочет использовать для увеличения производства своей продукции. Хочет закупить муки несколько мешков и одну духовку для выпечки самбус
texts.en:
Lola has been our client since 2007. She works as a teacher in a secondary school, but only the second shift. Prior to lunch, she works in a sambusa factory, making sambusas. She wants to use her next loan to increase her product production. Lola wants to buy several bags of flour and one oven for baking sambusas.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour and an oven for baking sambusas

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita F. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is forty-nine years old. Lolita is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a general store in the local community, selling a variety of different products. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over thirty-seven years and earns approximately $53 a month for these activities.

In 2005, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation through engaging in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used as working capital to purchase additional inventory. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to buy more products to sell. This loan will be her eighth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.en:
Ambrosia L. is from the village of P-24, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is fifty-nine years old and married with nine grown children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling products like cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar and so on, in the local market. Ambrosia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $250 a month from these activities.

In June 2009, Ambrosia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation through engaging in business activities. Ambrosia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and for working capital

location.town: P-24, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del No

loans.name: Rafiu

texts.en: Rafiu lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooked foods in her house, and has been in this business for twenty-five years. She is very happy with the growth of her business, especially after she started borrowing from LAPO, a Kiva field partner, three years ago. Rafiu is fifty years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Хосият Махмудова  торгует на рынке «Бадахшан».  Ассортимент ее товара это фрукты и овощи, которые каждое утро она покупает у поставщиков. В торговле ей помогает старший сын Азамат. В этом году он закончил школу и теперь готовиться поступать в Университет. Азамат мечтает стать программистом.
Второму сыну Хосият 12 лет, он учится в школе. К сожалению, дети растут без отца. Хосият развелась с мужем 5 лет назад. И с тех самых пор, она занялась микропредпринимательской деятельностью. Для закупа фруктов и овощей ей необходима сумма в размере 800 сомони. С этой целью она подала заявку на КИВА, и ждет материальной поддержки.
texts.en:
Hosiyat M. sells fruits and vegetables at the Badahshan market. She buys the products every morning from suppliers. Her oldest son, Azamat, helps her with the sales. He finished school this year and is now getting ready to go to the University. Azmat dreams about becoming a computer programmer. Hosiyat’s second son is 12 years old; he goes to school. Unfortunately, the children are growing up without a father. Hosiyat divorced her husband 5 years ago. Since then, she became involved in an entrepreneurship. She needs a sum of 800 somoni in order to buy fruits and vegetables. She put in the request to Kiva for this purpose and is waiting for financial support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun C. is twenty-five years old and has been involved in her weaving business since 1999 at her village in Takeo Province.  Her typical income is $3 a day.  The Cambodian method of weaving requires hard work and a long time to create the best products for competitive pricing at the markets. Therefore, she has to work very hard and pay close attention to this task every day.  Although weaving has been their primary income to ensure a comfortable standard of living, Hun really wants to take out a loan of $1000 to purchase a machine for her husband to charge batteries for his villagers. There is no electrical service in the village yet.

loans.use: To buy a machine to charge batteries

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia M. is forty-one years old. Her husband, Renato, is forty-two years old and a farmer. They are gifted with three children: Jeremy, Glenda, and Gerald. Jeremy is already in his college studies, while Glenda and Gerald are still at the high school level. Emilia maintains a gasoline retailing business and a hog raising business. She hopes to improve her businesses so she will be able to continue supporting the education of her three children. She is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan from Kiva to provide her livestock business with an adequate supply of feed and to sustain her gasoline retailing business. She believes that through Kiva, her family will able to overcome every hardship in life, especially if they will work hand in hand to get through it.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: 004-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
"Thuỷ Lê Thị is thirty-nine years old and lives in the town of Thanh Hoá.  She is the leader of a four-member group loan offered by the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, a partner of Save the Children, which in turn is a Kiva field partner.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 004-Quảng hưng.

Thuỷ is married and has three school-age children.  To make a living, she owns and operates a business raising cattle for sale.  Thuỷ has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately $87 a month from these activities.

In 2005, Thuỷ joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation through engaging in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND, which will be used to purchase more baby livestock. This will be her seventh loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thuỷ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. Thị Ngân is twenty-eight years old and is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

2.  H. Thị Minh is fifty-nine years old and is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

3.  Lê Thị Nghìn is fifty-nine years old is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda A. is from the village of Tu-od, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is fifty-two years old and married to Cesar A.. They have three grown children. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport service (habal-habal) to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Yolanda joined HSPFI, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. This will be Yolanda's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials needed to provide services

loans.name: Andrena

texts.en:
Andrena M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is twenty-eight years old and married with three school-age children. To make a living, Andrena owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $45 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Andrena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Andrena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. Andrena is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used for working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For working capital and to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is the hardworking wife of Romeo A.. She does as much as she can just to help her husband to improve their poor living conditions. The couple peacefully resides in the village of Barangay Manano, Mallig, Isabaela. Felicitas loves doing household chores and managing a typical general store. She believes that doing things with passion will result in a successful outcome.

Felicitas is already 59 years old and she has not been lucky enough to be blessed with a child. Thus, she gives her main focus in managing her store to improve it and to be able to support their daily needs, rather than to just sit down and wait for nothing, she said.

Felicitas wants to borrow PHP 10,000 as additional working capital to buy the lacking merchandise that most of her customers ask for. She hopes that through the help of Kiva lenders, her store will become progressive.

loans.use: To buy the lacking merchandise that most of her customers ask for

loans.name: Sear

texts.en: Sear R., 50, has been involved in the weaving business, with a typical income of US $3 per day, since 2005, at her village in Takeo province. The Cambodian weaving method requires hard work and a long time to produce the best outputs for competitive prices at markets. R. is married and lives with her husband, who has been a local farmer since 1979.  Her 4 children are all involved in her business as weavers also. Since there is enough labor force in her family with the skill to achieve the goals of her current business, R. wants to take a loan, for the first time, of US $500 from Kiva partner, CREDIT, to purchase more raw silk to produce silk textiles. Her perspective is that she wants to have an additional business of selling groceries when she succeeds with her current business plan.

loans.use: To buy raw silk for weaving.

loans.name: Floria

texts.en:
Floria B. is 57 years old. She is already an old mother but still strives hard for the best to give her family a good future. She was gifted with two children, named Ginalyn and Roldan. They both have successfully finished their studies through their sacrifices. 

Floria manages a general store business, since she can no longer go to farm to till their farm lot. Instead, she establish a store to further gain income for their daily living and for the future of her children. She is asking for financial support from Kiva, amounting to PHP 20,000, as additional business capital to be able to improve her store and to make it more profitable.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar is 26 years old. She is single and has three children who are all in school. She trades in maize in the local market of Sefwi, a town in the western region of Ghana. She takes stock from the surrounding villages and supply to her customers. 

Her major difficulty has to with funds to support the business. She requests for a loan to enable her to buy maize in bulk to grow her business and scale up sales. With her four years experience in trade, she hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education and to give them a better future and improved career opportunities.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of maize.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda A. is from the village of Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Yolanda is married to Leovegildo A. and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business selling home products, like hypo chlorine, to the local community members. She also engages in selling rice and dried fish in their village. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma manages a hog-raising business as her source of income. She admitted that their business brings them lots of financial support, especially needed during the enrollments and exams of their three children who are: Mighto, Angela Joi and Precious Lea. Gemma, together with her supportive husband Leo Taganguin, are doing their best to give their children an education that will serve as their key towards a better future. Two of her children are still in elementary level while the eldest has already graduated from college.

Gemma is now asking Kiva to lend her PHP 12,000 as additional capital to finance the feed supply needed by her pigs. She is happy that her business remains strong though sometimes she also experiences financial crises. She said that she is just patient and hardworking and that’s why she is managing her family well, and the same with her business. She hopes that through the blessings of the Lord, her good family relationships will last a long time.

loans.use: To finance the feed supply needed by her pigs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 26 years old; she is married and the mother of one child who is schooling. She is determined to provide for her child through hard work and commitment.

To support her child, Evelyn has been selling cosmetics products like spray, powder, blushes, lipstick, etc. for four years now and sells through hawking (going door-to-door). She sells these cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients.

Evelyn buys her stock from Kumasi which is a nearby town. She says selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory. This, she believes, will enable her make enough income to sponsor her child’s education and her business progress. She is so sure that your loan support will bring her to the desired results.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom M. is 39 years old. She is a resident of Dongkor District, about 10 km from Phnom Penh Town. She has had a job sewing clothing in a garment factory and gets a specific salary of $120 per month. This income is used towards caring for her three young kids, including clothing, food, school fees, and medical care. The other source of family income comes from her husband’s work selling charcoal. Beside their current work, they have also always provided a cultivating rice business. Mom M.’s husband can only pick up a small amount of charcoal to sell because his vehicle is not wide enough, so the charcoal supply is still not enough for his customer’s requirements. To solve this bad situation, Mom M. has decided to seek a loan to purchase a trailer for her husband to connect to his existing motor to transport more charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en: Gerlie is living in the simple place of Barangay Manano Mallig, Isabela. She is blessed with three children and married to Rodolfo, who is a farmer in their village. Despite the difficulties that they are experiencing in their lives, the couple is still doing their best to be able to provide for their needs through their typical village store business. Since the business has been always a big help as their source of income, Gerlie has decided to borrow a loan from Kivato to make her store more progressive. If Kiva will give her the opportunity, she hopes to take a loan of around PHP10,000 to be utilized as additional working capital to purchase more products for selling in her store.

loans.use: To purchase more products.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: At the young age of 32, Jenny L. is already a widow. Her husband died due to hypertension. With her three children, she still lives with her parents in their village of Barangay Manano Mallig, Isabela. She is patiently maintaining a humble general store business to support the education of her children. Her dream is to make her business grow so that she is able to increase her daily income. Due to insufficient capital, Jenny is requesting the amount of PHP17,000 from Kiva. She will use the funds for her store to grow and become more profitable in order to provide her three children with a better future. She believes that giving her children their needs will also benefit her someday when she is no longer able to work for herself.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Akilabi

texts.en:
T. lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 33 years old and married with three children.

T. sells cooked foods and has been in the business for the past two years. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs. She appreciates Kiva for its financial support, adding that the loan will increase the prosperity of her family. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. believes that by joining the Kiva program, she will surely expand her business and help her husband provide their daily needs at home and the educational needs of her children.

Josephine lives happily with her family, well bonded, and above all has fear in God. Her husband, James, is a farmer and at the same time manages to drive a tricycle transport to be able to generate a daily income. They have six children: two of them are already graduated from a course in college while the four younger ones are still studying.

Josephine manages a hog-raising business and it has become their family’s alternative source of income. She hopes to provide her hog-raising business with enough supply of feed. Thus, she is requesting from Kiva a loan of PHP 10,000 to have additional working capital. She prays that her loan will be approved so that she is able to gain more profit.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 48 years old and is married with one child who is currently in school. She lives at Sefwi Bekwai in the Western Region of Ghana.

Beatrice is a petty trader and, for eight years now, has sold items like salt, ginger, spices, shear butter, etc. in taking care of the home (shear butter, or shea butter, is a popular natural face and hair cream and is also used as a cooking oil in West Africa). She works very hard to sustain her business growth and also to take care of her child who is in school. She sells at the community market where she lives.

Beatrice complains that business is doing well but that she needs the loan facility to upgrade her inventory. With the loan, she would buy salt, shear butter, ginger, etc. in bulk for retail to her customers. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy salt, ginger, spices, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul S. is from the village of Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. He is 59 years old. Raul is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Raul runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products and viands (food items) in the local community. Raul is just starting this business.

This July, Raul joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raul is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase grocery items and ingredients. This will be the first loan taken out by Raul from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and ingredients

location.town: Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta M. is one of the simple hog raisers in the village of Barangay Manano Mallig, Isabela. She has a small piggery in her backyard. She lives with her niece and grandchild. She is luckily blessed with one child named Jerry, who already has his own family. Julieta chooses to maintain a hog-raising business in order to generate income for her daily needs and to provide support for her family. 

Julieta is doing her very best in developing her hog-raising business. But she needs additional capital; that’s why she is requesting a Kiva loan of PHP 5,000 for the daily feed supply for her hogs. She is praying that her loan will be approved because it will serve as a great help to be able to attain her goals in life. She has a strong faith in God and she's always had strong determination to surpass the problems in life.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Li-An

texts.en:
Li-an D. is 33 years old and lives in Manano Mallig, Isabela. She is a single mother and a soft-drinks dealer in her village. She is also engaged in selling different goods in her typical village store.

“Living without a partner in life is not the reason to give up but it is the reason to move on and look forward,” said Li-an. She believes that doing great in her business is the only thing she can do to carry the needs and expenses of her children. Through her income from her business, she is able to give her children enough food every day and send them to school. She also hopes they finish their courses through college, she added.

She is trying her best to work hard so that she will able to achieve all her goals in life. In this regard, Li-An is requesting a PHP15,000 loan from Kiva for the improvement of her business to be able to reach her dreams.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 35 years old and is a married woman with five children. All her children are currently in school. She lives with her family at Sefwi in the Western Region of Ghana.

Margaret prepares and serves pastries like cakes, doughnuts, flour chips, etc. and sells through hawking (going door-to-door). In spite of the challenges she faces, she manages to meet her customers demands by depending on her little resources. She serves her pastries by herself to her customers in the market center. She has been in business for seven and half years now.

Margaret’s only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet the demands of her customers. She requests a loan support to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and most especially her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Babi Berna’S Group

texts.en:
Berna is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 33 years old and married with three children aged between 10 and 16 years. All her children go to school She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is living with six people. She also takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Berna resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transportation to and from shopping in Kampala city and goes for shopping twice a week. Her major monthly expense is school fees

Berna is a poultry farmer in Bakuli, one of Kampala’s suburbs and has been in this business for the last seven years. She sells to an average of twenty people a day and sells to mainly women. She works seven days a week.. Besides poultry farming, Berna sells secondhand clothes at her home and also is a property agent.

Berna has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more chicken feed. Berna is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and also completing her house which will also work as her business premises.

loans.use: To buy more feed for her chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is the mother of two children named Woody and Judy who have both finished their studies. She is a housewife and at the same time manages a village store in their house located in Barangay Manano Mallig, Isabela. She is married to a farmer named Felipe A., who is 56 years old. She is busy with her business and sometimes goes into the field to assist her husband.

They live happily and peacefully with their adopted child named Marry-Ann. She dreams of sending her adopted child to school since her real parents are deceased. She treats her like her real daughter, and she wants the best for her as a real mother does for her children. Rosalina is requesting the amount of 10,000 Philippine pesos as additional working capital to improve her store to be able to gain more income, which would be a big help to afford the daily necessities of life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 38 years old and she is a married woman with four children who are in school. She is very dedicated to her family.

Agnes is a food vendor and sells rice with gravy stew at the community where she lives. She started her operation about four years ago in order to take care of her home.

Agnes’s food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables and bags of rice to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her business growth and her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat, firewood etc.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus S. manages a small hog raising business in their village. She is 45 years old and she is presently living in the rural place of Barangay Manano Mallig, Isabela. She is a loving wife to a 45 years old Perfecto S. who also is a loving husband too. Her husband is a farmer and they used to plant rice and corn which are the major crops produced in their municipality of Mallig. They have four children and they happily live in their poor village despite of the difficulties in life.  

Her goal in life is to become successful in her business. She wanted to have raised more pigs to generate more income, however she lacks the capital to sustain the business with enough pig feed. That is why Venus is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos for the maintenance of her hog raising business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Gavharoy

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Гавхарой - молодая женщина 1972 года рождения. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке Адрасман города Кайракума. Она закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Гавхарой ездит за товаром 2 раза в неделю. Ей помогают сыновья. Гавхарой кредитуется у нас впервые. Она очень надеется, что кредит поможет ей в расширении бизнеса. Гавхарой просит кредит на закупку летней партии детской одежды.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Gavharoy is a young woman born in 1972. She is married and is a mother of three children. She sells children's clothing on the market Adrasman in the town of Kairakkum. She buys the merchandise from the wholesale market in Istaravshan. Gavharoy travels for the merchandise twice a week. Her sons help her. This is a first loan for Gavharoy. She is hoping that this loan will help her expand her business. Gavharoy is asking for a loan to buy summer batch of children's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a batch of summer children's clothing

loans.name: Rohaina

texts.en: Rohaina D. is from the village of Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 38 years old, is separated from her spouse and has one adult child. Rohaina owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling grocery items, cellphones and cellphone accessories and RTW (ready-to-wear clothes) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In July 2009, Rohaina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

location.town: Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City

loans.name: 007-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en: Yên H. Thị (12) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Yên is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 007-Quảng Hưng (18.02.007). Yên is married and has three adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock, primarily raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a months. In 2004, Yên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Yên is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 9th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Yên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. Thị Xoan (55) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 2. Lê thị Tiêu (41) is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business. 3. Lê thị Nhắn (36) is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business. 4. Vũ Thị Năm (9) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Yên H. Thị (12) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Yên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 007-Quảng hưng (18.02.007). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Yên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Yên kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND. Vào 2004, Yên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Yên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. Thị Xoan (55) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Lê thị Tiêu (41) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 3. Lê thị Nhắn (36) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 4. Vũ Thị Năm (9) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Chhen's Group

texts.en:
These are three low-income people who are jointly taking this group loan and they all set a plan to use their loan for different purposes. One of these people, Mrs. Chhen T., 46, has been selected to be a leader by the other members.

Chhen T. is a married mother blessed with four children, three of whom are single and the other one is married. Two of her kids are employed in a garment factory.

Chhen T. currently sells various vegetables in the market to earn a living, while her husband is a rice farmer. Chhen T. will use her loan to help reduce their transportation costs by buying an old motorbike for her family’s traveling needs.

The other two borrowers are:

Mr. Saly S., a rice farmer, who is asking for a loan to buy a piglet to raise.

Mrs. Chhim T. will be using her loan for capital to begin raising pigs.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Rocklin

texts.en:
Rocklin is 28 years old and she is married and the mother of one child who is in school.

Rocklin is a trader who works very hard to provide food and support for her family. She trades in sachet (plastic-bagged) mineral water and chilled cocoa drink and sells them through hawking (going door-to-door). She carries them inside a bowl and hawks them. She started this business a year ago in the community where she lives.

Rocklin buys her stock of goods from the community market to prepare the cocoa drink. She is requesting the loan to buy raw materials to strengthen her business and also to use part to take care of her child in school.

loans.use: To buy bulk sachet water and porridge ingredients and to pay school fees

loans.name: Danela

texts.en: Danela M. is from the village of Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 27 years old, is married to Julito M., and has three infant children. Danela owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, primarily selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In July 2009, Danela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family and to improve her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Purok 9, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del

loans.name: Jovia Kyomugabi Group

texts.en:
Jovia is the leader of a five-member group. She is a 40 years old and married with two children aged 12 and 20 years. Both of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she is living with four people. She also takes care of one additional family member. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Jovia resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells in Wandegeya Mulago Triangle, one of Kampala’s suburbs. She doesn’t incur any extra transportation costs because she buys from her place of work and does her shopping once a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for both home and business premises.

Jovia sells mainly on retail. She sells to an average of twenty people a day and sells to all categories of people excluding children. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last six years. Besides the beer business, she owns a telephone booth.

Jovia has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of beer. Jovia is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn S. is from the village of Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 30 years old, is married to Naser S., and has four school-aged children. Analyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In July 2009, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok 9, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del

loans.name: Seoun

texts.en:
Seoun R., 34, has been involved in her business since 2005 at her village in Takeo province. She sews, and sells clothes from local garment factories, earning a typical income of US$5 per day. She always spends most of her day in front of the garment factory. She is married and lives with her younger sister and two school-aged children.

Since she wishes to generate more income for her family’s use and expenses, R. wants to take a loan of US$700 from Kiva partner, CREDIT to purchase more clothes to expand her current business. This will be her first loan from CREDIT. Her perspective is that she wants to have an additional business of selling groceries when she succeeds with her current business plan.

R. is shown in the photo wearing a colorful shirt next to her younger sister.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Uraljon

texts.en: H. Uraljon is 23 years old, with his two small children and his wife he cares for. He is a very hardworking young man. He has land on which he grows wheat and onions and his wife sells their produce in the market. When she goes to sell their produce, Uraljon remains behind to farm. What most aggravates Uraljon about this activity is that when the opportunity to sell things arrives, sometimes he makes a lot and sometimes the market isn’t as kind to him. With the loan requested from Kiva, he would buy seeds and fertilizer for his field. Uraljon hopes that the prices of wheat will hold up, because he says that this will make his farming worth the sacrifice. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Yawoavi

texts.fr: Cette jeune femme est célibataire, pour subvenir à ses propres besoins elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des articles de mercerie, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de produits de beauté, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Sa clientèle grandit et pour mieux les satisfaire, elle veut agrandir son stock par l’achat de 10 tissus, 3 cartons de boutons et divers articles de mercerie et des produits de beauté raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de wages un crédit
texts.en:
This young woman is unmarried, and to meet her own needs, she started a business selling dressmaking items. She has also added the sale of cosmetics to her business. She supplies herself at the grand market in Lomé. Her clientele is growing and to better satisfy her customers, she would like to enlarge her stock by buying 10 sets of fabric, 3 boxes of buttons, and various other dressmaking items and cosmetics. For this reason, she is seeking a loan through Wages, one of Kiva's field partners.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel D. is from the village of Purok 9, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 26 years old, married to Nestor D., and has an infant child. Maricel owns and operates a business selling personalized accessories to the local community members and in schools. She has been engaged in her business for over seven months and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month. In July 2009, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to improve her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale

location.town: Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Currently all are schooling.

Rose sells smoked fish at the community market where she lives and started her fish sales two years ago. She buys her stock of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She has a high customer base  and her customers travel from other parts of the surrounding communities to buy her fish.

She buys her stock of fish from the fishmongers. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She dreams of giving her children a quality education through the proceeds of her business. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Cette femme est une veuve qui a à sa charge ses 04 enfants, l’activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui permet de bien subvenir aux charges de ses enfants est le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Son ancienneté de 8 ans dans ce commerce fait qu’elle en a une parfaite maîtrise de la gestion. Actuellement elle fait face à une rupture de stock et sollicite de wages un crédit pour se réapprovisionner et subvenir aux charges de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This woman is a widow who takes care of her four children. The business she runs, and which allows her to meet the needs of her children, is the sale of basic food products. Her 8 years of experience in this business has given her an excellent command of the required management skills. Currently, she is facing a stock shortage, and is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to resupply herself and meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic food products for resale

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say P., 44, is married and has six children. Her husband is motor-taxi driver who typically earns approximately US$8 per day.

P. has been involved in selling vegetable and palm fruit since 2005 at her village in Takeo province. She earns a typical income of US$8 per day. P. always spends most of her day in the market with her tiring efforts to generate more income for the family.

Since it is required to have a convenient place to sell her products, P. wants to take a loan of US$500 from Kiva partner, CREDIT to purchase a stand inside the market. This will be her first loan from CREDIT. Her perspective is that she wants to build a new house when she succeeds with her current business plan.

loans.use: To buy a stand at the market

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.en: I. Firdavs is 26 years old. He is married and is the father of two children. Firdavs is a livestock breeder. He buys and sells cattle from different market places and has been in the business for the last three years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. With the loan from Kiva, Firdavs plans to increase his herd of cattle for trade and, if possible, to open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. He plans to see his children go through higher education and be able to get good jobs, unlike himself. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule.
