It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Гулчехре 36 лет. Она замужем и мать 3-х детей. Занимается переработкой шерсти и производством шерстяной нити. Её муж пастух. Он пасет свое маленькое стадо и стадо соседа за дополнительную плату. Гульчехра закупает шерсть у других пастухов, потому, что ей не хватает шерсти из своего стада. Гулчехра хочет закупить большую партию козьей и овечьей шерсти, пока они дешевле. На зимний сезон они подорожают. За этим Гулчехра просит займ.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She processes wool and produces yarn. Her husband is a shepherd. He keeps a small herd as well as the herd of a neighbor for additional pay. Gulchehra purchases wool from other shepherds because she doesn’t have enough from her and her husband’s herd. Gulchehra wants to purchase a large quantity of goat’s and sheep’s wool, as they are cheaper. But in the winter, they gain in value. For this, Gulchehra requests a loan.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wool processing and yarn production

loans.name: Yawo Désiré

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et père d’un enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans le quartier de N’kafu qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des céréales, il s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays et arrive de cette façon à réaliser de bonnes marges bénéficiaires sur ses ventes. Voulant rehausser son stock il sollicite de wages un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de maïs, 10 sacs d’haricots et divers autres céréales.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married and has one child. He lives with his wife and child in the N'kafu area, which is an outlying area in the city of Lomé. He runs a revenue-generating business selling cereals. He supplies himself in the interior of the country and in this way, realizes a large profit margin on his sales. Wanting to increase his stock, he is asking for a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 20 bags of maize, 10 bags of beans, and various other cereals.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cloth

loans.name: Nor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Нор Хафизов имеет среднее техническое образование. Он работает заведующим хозяйством школы № 5 Зафарабадского района. Но зарплата в школах невысока, поэтому дома у него есть овцы и 2 коровы, одна из которых дает до 8 литров молока в день. 
   Жена Нора домохозяйка, она готовит еду, стирает и убирает, ухаживает за огородом. В огороде у них выращены все необходимые овощи для приготовления пищи (лук, морковь, картошка, помидоры и огурцы).
Нор кормит и поит свой домашний скот, а его жена доит корову и перерабатывает молоко. Доить корову маме помогает единственная дочь. Она планирует вырасти и заниматся животноводством, так же как и ее отец. Мечтает о большой ферме.
Кроме откорма скота, Нор на арендованной земле выращивает кукурузу и реализует его на рынке. 
Нор запрашивает кредит для откорма скота и переработки молока.
texts.en:
Nor H. has a secondary technical education. He works as a facilities supervisor at the school #5 in the Zafarabad district. However, schools do not pay very much; this is why at home Nor has sheep and 2 cows, one of which gives up to 8 liters of milk per day. Nor’s wife is a homemaker. She cooks food, does laundry, cleans and takes care of the garden. Their garden has all the essential vegetables for cooking meals (onions, carrots, potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers).

Nor gives food and water to his livestock, and his wife milks the cow and processes milk. Nor’s only daughter helps the mother milk the cow. She plans to be involved in animal husbandry when she grows up, just like her father. She dreams of having a large farm. Besides feeding livestock, Nor grows corn on leased land and sells it at the market. Nor is requesting a loan for livestock feeding and milk processing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and milk processing

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Cette jeune femme a abandonné les études pour apprendre la coiffure, elle a ouvert en 2007 son propre atelier de coiffure qu’elle a appelé « LABORA COIFFURE », elle vend aussi des produits cosmétiques. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé.  Voulant se réapprovisionner en produits cosmétiques, elle sollicicte de wages un crédit pour acheter des mèches, des perruques et divers.
C’est avec cette activité qu’elle subvient à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
This young woman left her studies to train as a hairstylist. In 2007, she opened her own beauty salon, which she named "Labora Coiffure." She also sells cosmetic products. She supplies herself at the grand market in Lomé. Wanting to resupply herself with cosmetic products, she is asking for a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy hair extensions, wigs, and other such articles. It is through this business that she is able to meet her own expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, wigs, and other items

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle S. owns and operates a business peddling fish and aquatic resources in her community. She is 36 years old, married to Danielo S., and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. Merle has been in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month.

In July 2009, Merle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Merle is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

location.town: Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
For the past eight years, Nasiba has been selling kid’s clothing in the central market of Shahrituz. Nasiba is married and the mother of seven children. She is determined to make a better living for the entire family. Nasiba is hardworking and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Nasiba has both a strong customer base and a perfect credit history with IMON International. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 3400 Somoni to purchase a new vending facility and expand her business. With the increased income, Nasiba plans to continue growing her business and to improve the financial situation of her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending facility

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Cette  femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce de puis 2000 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé, étant marié et mère de 03 enfants, elle aide son époux dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer avec ce qu’elle gagne comme revenu. Son stock de marchandises a un peu baissé, c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite de wages un crédit pour acheter 03 sacs de riz, 08 bidons d’huile de palme, 5 sacs de spaaghetti, 03 cartons de détergents « OMO » et divers.
texts.en:
This woman earns revenues from commerce in grocery items. She has been in this business since 2000 and acquires her supplies at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She is married and the mother of three. She helps her husband with day-to-day household expenses with what she earns in revenues. Her stock of merchandise has diminished a bit, and so she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy three sacks of rice, eight drums of palm oil, five bags of spaghetti, three boxes of "OMO" detergents, and various other items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is 42 years old. She is widowed and has three kids who are currently in school. She sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the popular local foods enjoyed as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and eaten with sugar, milk and bread or with what is called kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so it is ready to be served with the porridge in just about 20 minutes.

With her large customer base, Augustina wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She also wants to upgrade her lingerie sales. She hopes to generate a good income to support her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad Karym Group

texts.en:
M. Karem is the group leader of M. Karem Group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses. They have requested a group loan of 21,000 Afghani.

Shfeqa wants to take a loan for her bakery business. She wants to buy firewood for her business. M. Karem wants to take a loan for his vegetable-selling business. He wants to make his shop larger.

Also, M. Naem wants to take a loan for his business of fresh fruit selling. He wants to expand and further his business. They want to thank all leaders in the Kiva process. And thank all leaders of AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.use: buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: 07 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hoan N. Thị (95) runs a general store selling food and daily use products in her community. Hoan is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa. She is widowed and has four adult children. Hoan has been in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, Hoan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Hoan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoan plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Hoan is the leader of a five member group receiving a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 07 Nam Ngạn (17.07.07).

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Lê Thị Chờ (87) is a 63-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. 2. N. Thị Xuân (99) is a 55-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 3. Đỗ Thị Bách (97) is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. 4. N. Thị Hùng (98) is a 61-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hoan N. Thị (95) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa. Hoan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 07 Nam Ngạn (17.07.07).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán cả hai loại thức ăn & các nhu yếu phẩm trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hoan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 9 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hoan kiếm được khoảng 1.000.000 VND. Vào 2007, Hoan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hoan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Lê Thị Chờ (87) là 63 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 2. N. Thị Xuân (99) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Đỗ Thị Bách (97) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. 4. N. Thị Hùng (98) là 61 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa G. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling fresh and dried fish in her community. She is 49 years old, separated from her spouse and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. Josefa has been in this business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In July 2009, Josefa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Josefa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City

loans.name: Kofi Pierre

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a appris l’activité de la menuserie, il réside dans le quartier d’attiégou. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Il exerce ce commerce depuis 2000, il fabrique lui-même des meubles qu’il expose et vend. Actuellement il a reçu des commandes de ses clients malheureusement il ne dispose  pas assez de bois pour exécuter la commande. Pour pouvoir satisfaire ses clients il sollicite de wages un crédit pour acheter des bois et des matières indispensables à l’activité de la menuserie.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who learned about wood-working. He has been in this business since 2000. He resides in the Attiégou district. He is married and the father of one child. Currently he has orders from customers. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough wood to fill the orders. To be able to satisfy his customers, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy wood and some indispensable supplies for making cabinets and furniture.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells salt in bulk taking delivery of stock from Kumasi, which is a nearby city. She says the price of salt has increased quickly, making it difficult to buy more bags. She is 55 years old, married and the mother of four children. All of her children are in senior high and junior high schools. She is requesting this loan to buy more salt from the market of Kumasi. It is her dream to provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of salt

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.en:
D. Bahriniso is 47 years old and lives with her husband (pictured) and their four children. She is a woman who has been characterized as a hard worker from an early age. She is very dedicated to the agricultural work of raising sheep. Bahriniso sees this as an activity that will enable her to have additional income due to the high demand for these animals in the markets. The challenge is to improve the breed but to do so she needs to feed them properly.

Bahriniso has the best intentions for her children and this motivates her to continue improving as a mother and farmer. As a farmer, she yearns to expand her business so that she will be able to improve her family's living standards. In order to do so, Bahriniso is asking for a loan. This will allow her to buy animals of a better breed in order to improve their quality.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Opoku

texts.en:
Opoku has been selling soft drinks in bulk for three years now. He sells soft drinks like Coca Cola, Pepsi and others. He has suppliers from Kumasi who supply him directly without any middlemen. His only problem has to do with funds.

Opoku is 40 years old, married and the father of three children. Currently, all his children are in school. Opoku is a very hardworking young man who strives to provide for his family. He is requesting a loan to buy assorted drinks to upgrade his business. He dreams to build his own house from the business proceeds and also save some money to take care of the children in school.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks in bulk

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine D. T. makes a living mainly from providing earrings and an ear piercing service in her community. She is 43 years old, married and has five adult children. They are from the village of Purok 24, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. Josephine has been in this business for over 18 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month.

In June 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand ear piercing service

location.town: Purok 24, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao de

loans.name: Bawoumondom

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité  génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail de chaussures, sacs. Elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante pour conquérir un plus grand nombre de clients. Elle veut agrandir son stock et associer à cette activité la vente de pagnes. Elle sollicite de wages son premier crédit pour acheter 15 pièces de pagnes, 15 sacs et 15 chaussures.
Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns revenues from a retail business in shoes and bags. She operates in an itinerant manner to win over a greater number of customers. She wants to expand her inventory and to include with her business the sale of pagnes (colorful West African cloth). She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 15 bolts of pagnes, 15 bags, and 15 pairs of shoes. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags, and various items

loans.name: Sorohon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Сорохон 37 лет. Она замужем и мать 5-х детей. Занимается перепродажей шерсти и шерстяной пряжи. Её муж пастух. Он пасет свое стадо. Сорохон закупает шерсть у других пастухов и делает пряжу. Сорохон хочет закупить побольше козьей и овечьей шерсти, пока они дешевле. На зимний сезон они подорожают. За этим Сорохон просит займ.
texts.en:
Sorohon is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. She sells wool and yarn. Her husband is a shepherd and tends to his flocks. Sorohon purchases wool from other shepherds and makes yarn. Sorohon wishes to purchase some goat and sheep wool, as they are cheaper now, and their prices go up during the winter. To do so, Sorohon requests a loan.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of wool and yarn

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en:
N. Mavlyuda is a married mother of four children. For more than 15 years, Mavlyuda has sold the national man’s coat called “chapan” and skullcaps. Considering that her husband works as a teacher and earns little, the business of Mavlyuda has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past 15 years that she’s been in business. Mavlyuda has requested a loan of 13000 Somoni to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the national man’s coat called “chapan” and skullcaps

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 48 years old and a married mother of seven. Two of the children are schooling and the rest are currently working. She works very hard in taking care of the family. 

She sells bush meat from deer and other animals. She mostly takes stock from hunters and supplies to local restaurant operators. She wants the loan support to buy a bulk supply of bush meats to sustain her business growth. With this loan, she believes she can save more to support her husband in taking care of the family.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of bush meat

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur s’est lancée en 2000 dans le commerce de chaussure, il exerce son commerce dans le marché local de hedzranawoé. Il a déjà obtenu de wages un premier crédit qui lui a permis de relancer ce commerce et qu’il a bien remboursé. Actuellement la demande de ses clients est très élevée, pour pouvoir tous et bien les satisfaire il doit augmenter son stock,  il sollicite alors de wages son deuxième crédit pour acheter 50 paires de chaussures.
Il est marié et père d’un petit garçon qui fait l’école primaire. C’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille
texts.en:
In 2000, this gentlemen got started in the commerce of shoes. He operates his business at the local market of Hedzranawoé. He has already obtained from WAGES an initial loan, which he repaid, that enabled him to reinvigorate his business. The demands of his customers are many right now. To do well in satisfying them all, he must increase his inventory. He is therefore requesting a second loan from WAGES to buy 50 pairs of shoes. He is married and the father of a young boy who is in primary school. With the revenues from his commerce, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
R. Valentina is 58 years old. She is married with four children. She started her own business seven years ago because her husband at that time was unemployed. Valentina sells confectionery items like candies, cookies and pastries in the local market. The generated income allows Valentina to support her family. Valentina dreams all of her children will complete higher education.

Today she requests 3000 Somoni for purchasing confectionery items to enlarge her range of goods to sell. Valentina plans to spend her income on the well-being of her family as well as educating her children.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a being key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing confectionery items for enlarging her range of goods to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice ia a 47-year-old trader. She is married and a mother with two children. Both kids are currently in school. She is a very resourceful mother whose hard effort brings a livelihood to the family. Beatrice supports her kids through the sale of used clothing. Used clothing has a very big market share in Ghana as brand-new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, the selling of used clothing has created a market for many women. 

Beatrice has been in this business for the past nine years. She travels to a nearby city called Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She normally concentrates on bed sheets, used towels and sometimes kid’s wear. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s future and also for renting a store to trade.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena O. is from the village of Purok 1C, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 28 years old. Lorena is married to Junrey O. and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lorena owns & operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling processed food like longganisa and dried fish in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over four months and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Lorena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lorena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Afissétou

texts.fr:
Cette dame vit dans le quartier de kégué qui est un quartier périphérique très animé de la ville de lomé. Elle exerce depuis 2007 l’activité de vente de bois de chauffage dans le marché local de son quartier. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans les villages de sokodé, ainsi elle réalise plus de marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes. Elle veut acheter plus de bois de chauffage pour agrandir son stock c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de wages son premier crédit.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady lives in Kégué, a very busy outlying district of the city of Lomé. Since 2007, she has been in the business of selling firewood at the local market in her district. She acquires her supplies inland, from the villages of Sokodé, and she thus realizes a larger profit margin on her sales. She wants to buy more firewood to expand her stock. This is why she's requesting her first loan from WAGES. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is a 37-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. One has finished senior high school and the last-born is still schooling. She is a food vendor and sells banku with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her business to include the sale of cereals in bags to her customers. She has employed additional hands who assist her in her local food joint. She has been in business for nine years now and believes that the loan will boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Назокат 45 года. Она замужем и мать 3-х детей. Назокат занимается пошивом и продажей женской одежды. Уже больше 10 лет она шьет разную женскую одежду, в том числе национальные платья, юбки, сорочки, брюки и т.д. Назокат берет кредит в нашей организации с 2008 года. Она хочет закупить 10 рулонов летней ткани для своего дела. Назокат надеется, что кредит поможет ей расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Nazokat is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Nazokat sews and sells women’s clothes. For over 10 years now, she sews different women’s clothes, including national traditional dresses, skirts, shirts, trousers, etc.. Nazokat has been taking out loans from our organization since 2008. She wants to purchase 10 rolls of summery fabric. Nazokat hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of national traditional fabric

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a appris la soudure, en 1999 il a ouvert son propre atelier de soudure. Il fabrique des portes de maisons et des fourneaux qu’il expose pour attirer le regard des passants. Une partie des matériaux indispensables  à l’activité de la soudure est épuisée, il veut en acheter d’autres c’est pour cette raison qu’il demande son premier crédit à wages.
 Il est marié et père d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who learned how to weld. In 1999, he opened his own welding shop. He makes doors and gates for houses, and he makes stoves that he displays to attract those passing by. Some of his indispensable supplies are exhausted. He wants to buy some more, so he is asking WAGES for his first loan. He is married and the father of a child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for welding

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 39 years old. She is married and has three children. All her children are still in school and her husband is a trader. She lives with her husband who is very supportive of her. She is very hardworking and supportive of her husband in providing food and shelter for her household. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, biscuits etc. and cosmetics in her neighborhood. It has been her dream to make an expansion by adding other foodstuffs to her existing products. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and foodstuffs like tomatoes, smoked fish, dried fish, onions, spices, groundnuts etc. to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Naim

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Наим Сангинов по профессии плотник. Этому мастерству он научился  у своего отца, еще в свои школьные годы. Сейчас он передает этот опыт своему сыну Чамшеду. Они вместе работают в мастерской, которая находится  рядом с домом.
Но основной источник дохода их семьи, это животноводство. Наим имеет 15 летний стаж в сфере животноводства. Наим покупает коров и овец, откармливает их и осенью продает, получая от этого хороший доход. Его жена Гавхар, вместе с дочерями Шоирой и Шоистой помогают Наиму в откорме скота.
Получив кредит в первый раз, он увеличил свой скот и поднялся на ступень высше. Теперь он планирует еще раз получить кредит и использовать его для откорма скота. Ведь в конце сентября предстоит празднование священного праздника Рамазан. Многие семья приносят в жертву овец и коров и раздают мясо малоимущим семьям и сиротам. Поэтому Наим хочет откормить свой скот до осени.
texts.en:
Naim S. is a carpenter by profession. He learned his trade from his father during his school years. Now he is passing on his experience to his own son, Jamshed. Together, they work in his studio, which is next to their house. However, the main income source for their household is from animal husbandry. Naim has 15 years of experience buying cows and sheep, fattening them up and selling them in the autumn, from which he makes a good income. His wife, Gavhar, together with their daughters Shoira and Shoista help Naim with feeding the cattle. The first time he took out a loan, he bought more cattle and operated on a much larger scale. Now he plans to take out another loan and to use it to feed the cattle. As in late September, he wishes to prepare for the celebration of the holy festival of Ramadan in which many families sacrifice cattle and give the meat to poor families and orphans. For this reason, Naim wishes to feed his cattle before the autumn.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for cattle feed

loans.name: Kondi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur  est un homme marié qui habite avec sa femme et ses enfants le quartier de hedzranawoé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. l’activité génératrice de revenu qu’il exerce pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille est la vente de cartes de recharge. Ce commerce est très rentable à lomé. Il veut agrandir son stock de cartes de recharge par l’achat de 4 cartons de cartes togocel et 03 cartons de cartes moov pour cela il sollicite son premier crédit de wages
texts.en:
This gentleman is married and lives with his wife and children in Hedzranawoé, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. His revenue-generating business, for providing for his family, involves selling mobile phone recharge cards. This is a very profitable business in Lomé. He wants to expand his stock of recharge cards by buying four boxes of Togocel cards and three boxes of Moov cards. To do so, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy phone cards

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en:
Batbold T. is a hard-working, 47-year-old married father of four. His family has been living in "ger" (a ger is a nomadic housing tent) district in Uvurhangay, one of the central provinces, for the last five years. His family owns a plot of land they live on. Batbold's eldest child is a university student and his youngest two are attending a local elementary school. 

He is a welder and has a small workshop. Together with his two co-workers, he makes home items such as stove stacks, then sells them to local "ger" district residents.  Batbold's spouse, Tsetsegmaa, has been running a retail business selling wooden furniture and small household items at the local market. Tsetsegmaa goes once or twice a month to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, to purchase items she sells through her two stalls. 

Batbold requests a loan to purchase raw materials such as iron and also furniture for his and his spouse's business. He says, "I have a lot of things to get done: to get my tiny business stable, to save small amounts for my children's future university tuition, to get my children educated."

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as iron

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
Diosdado R. is from the village of Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. He is 47 years old. Diosdado is married to Eliza and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Diosdado owns & operates a retail based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing scrap metal buying in the local community. Diosdado has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Diosdado joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosdado is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Diosdado from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family and support the education of his children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Рустам мужчина, который использует кредиты для увеличения своего оборотного капитала. Его точка реализации расположена в центре города Худжанда.На полученный кредит Рустам хочет закупить мясо окарачка и баранины. У него шашлык и куриного мясо и баранины. У Рустама очень много клиентов и торговля всегда кипит.
texts.en:
Rustam is a man, who uses loans for increasing his working capital. His store is located in the Khujand city center. Rustam wants to use this loan to buy chicken and lamb. He makes chicken and lamb kebobs. Rustam has many customers, and his sales are always busy.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken and lamb

loans.name: 08 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Yên B. Thị (89) is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa.  Yên is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 08 Nam Ngạn (17.07.08).


Yên is married and does not have any children.  To make a living, Yên works in a family member's business operating a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling coal in the local community.  Yên has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Yên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Yên has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Yên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  C. Thị Hường (90) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  N. Thị Dung (91) is a 46-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.


3.  Lê Thị Tuyết (92) is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


4.  N. Thị Nhân (93) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.


5.  Lê Thị Phương (115) is a 23-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.


6.  Lý Thị Lan (138) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Yên B. Thị (89) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa.  Yên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 08 Nam Ngạn (17.07.08).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán than trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Yên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Yên kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Yên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Yên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  C. Thị Hường (90) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. Thị Dung (91) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  Lê Thị Tuyết (92) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  N. Thị Nhân (93) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


5.  Lê Thị Phương (115) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


6.  Lý Thị Lan (138) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en: N. Christine is the leader of Babyelesa group in Mukono. She is 34 years old and married with six children. Four are in school with the oldest working and the last-born is two years old. Christine has a business selling fresh foods like matooke, Irish potatoes, cassava, and sweet potatoes as well as selling greens and dried fish in Kisowera trading centre where she has had a stall for 10 years. She has a dream of opening up another stall in Mukono town where the market is a bit bigger. Christine needs a loan to be able to buy more fresh foods for sale since this brings in more income and more profits. She is a determined and hard working lady with a drive to succeed.

loans.use: To buy more fresh foods and fish for resale.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer R. is from the village of Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 29 years old. Jenifer is married to Alaine R. and has two infant children. To make a living, Jenifer owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from the sale of different varieties of viand (tasty dishes) in the local community. Jenifer is just starting this business.

In July, Jenifer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenifer is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Jenifer from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en: Safaa is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. She has been working as a beautician since 2000 to provide, in collaboration with her husband, better life conditions for her children. Today, Safaa is requesting to borrow $1,000 to expand her business in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Hanane

texts.en: Hanane is a 35-year-old married woman living with her husband and her young child. Since 2002, she has owned an accessories and clothes shop, where she works hard to serve the neighboring areas. Today, Hanane is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette D. vend des fruits et légumes au niveau  du marché de Mbour  ville située à 80km de Dakar la capitale sénégalaise.Elle est âgée de 56 ans .Le prêt lui servira d’acheter des fruits et légumes  qui seront destinés à la revente .les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permettrons de faire face aux besoins journaliers de sa famille
texts.en:
MBTH/860 Maguette D. is a retail merchant in Mbour. She is 56 years old. The loan will be used to buy foodstuff destined for making daily meals. This will enable her to cope with day-to-day needs with regard to improving her revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Wedelyn

texts.en:
Wedelyn L. is from the village of Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 30 years old. Wedelyn is married to Janero Ramboo L. and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Wedelyn operates a family member's scrap buying business in the local community. Wedelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Wedelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wedelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Wedelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en: Mirna is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been working as a tailor for the past 10 years. She has become known in the neighboring villages. After this long experience in the field, Mirna is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to buy tools to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru:
MLF MicroInvest is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF MicroInvest sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF MicroInvest together with LLC Frontiers have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization Arvand
      Arvand being assignee of MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Лола  получает очередной  кредит. Она  помогает торговать матери на рынке тканью. В конце каждой недели ее мать ездит с соседями за товаром. В настоящий момент сезон шифон-бархатов  и шелка. Ее бизнес  поддерживает также сестра.  Лола также для стажа работает и в садике, ее детям обходиться бесплатно как сотруднику детского сада.  Ей необходимо   увеличить ассортимент, пока не закончился сезон продажи тканей. И для расширения ей необходимо прикупить несколько рулонов тканей для продажи.
texts.en:
Lola is requesting her next loan. She helps her mother sell fabrics at the market. At the end of each week, her mother travels for merchandise with her neighbors. At the moment, it is the season for chiffon-velvets and silk. Her sister also helps with the business. Lola also works in a kindergarten for experience; her children can attend kindergarten for free because she works there. She needs to increase her merchandise assortment before the fabric sales season ends. And for expansion, she needs to buy a few rolls of fabric for sale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics

loans.name: Hushnuchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Хушнучон Сангинов занимается животноводческой деятельностью около 5 лет. В этом ему помогают брат и мать. Жена Хушнучона домохозяйка. Она выполняет все обязанности по дому и воспитанием  детей. Хушнучон начал откармливать скот, количество которых  состояло из 2 овец. Шаг за шагом,  на часть от полученной прибыли, он покупал еще  дополнительно овец. На сегодняшний день количество овец  в его стаде составляет 6 голов и 1 корова.
Дополнительный доход Хушнучон получает от  выращивания лука и плотнического ремесла. 
Он подал заявку на КИВА, для того чтобы КИВА совместно с нашей организацией поддержали его, так как он планирует дополнительно купить скот в свое стадо.
texts.en:
Hushnuchon S. has been involved in animal husbandry close to 5 years. His brother and mother help him with this business. Hushnuchon’s wife is a homemaker. She takes care of all home obligations and raises the children. Hushnuchon started feeding livestock, which consisted of 2 sheep. Step by step, using part of his profits, he purchased additional sheep. Today, his herd consists of 6 heads of sheep and 1 cow. Hushnuchon receives supplemental income from growing onions and carpenter services. He put in a request with Kiva in order for Kiva, together with our organization, to support him because he plans to buy additional livestock for his herd.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of additional livestock

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa is a 30-year-old engaged man living with his parents. He has owned a poultry shop since 2003 where he services the neighboring villages. He works hard to collect money in order to get married soon. That is the reason why he is requesting to borrow $1,200; he wants to be able to purchase furniture for his home.

loans.use: To purchase furniture

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is a 26-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He has been working in the agriculture sector for the past 8 years and in 2007, he decided to open his own business as a vegetable trade to start a new and more solid career. Today, Elie is requesting to borrow $700 to purchase merchandise in order to develop his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en:
A. Mehriniso is 33 years old. She is married and has a little daughter. Mehriniso sells toys for children. She rents a store for selling, which is located in one of the local markets. Mehriniso has been running her own small business for seven years. Having only a couple competitors in the market, she is doing well with her business. Mehriniso always dreamed of owning her own small store and not having to depend on anyone else. She believes that someday her dream will come true and she will open her own store. Today she is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni for purchasing new toys to increase her range of goods. Mehriniso thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate with the loan payment. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dream become reality.  
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more toys to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn S. is from the village of Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 25 years old. Roselyn is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Roselyn owns & operates a waste management service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling plastics & other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Roselyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Roselyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roselyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roselyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: Amadou S. est âgé de 52 ans c’est un enseignant dans un Collège Enseignement  Moyen  à Mbour . Il sollicite ce prêt pour  la construction  du mur de son domicile.
texts.en:
Amadou S. is 52 years old. He is a teacher at the Collège Enseignement Moyen Amadou Wade de Mbour, better known as CEM3. He is requesting this loan for supplementing the construction of his home, which had a wall in disrepair.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building construction

loans.name: Bakhtiniso

texts.en:
Bakhtiniso is a hard-working entrepreneur from Shahrituz, Tajikistan. Together with her husband, she has two children. She runs a business where she sells men’s shirts and clothing. Bakhtiniso started her business seven years ago and has run it with both extreme care and seriousness. Her daughters help Bakhtiniso with her business. It is an important source of income for her family of five considering that her husband does not earn enough money. 

Bakhtiniso has requested a loan of 3000 Somoni so that she can purchase more clothing. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to grow her business further and help feed her family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for expanding the business

loans.name: Achwak

texts.en: Achwak is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. She owns a mini market to help her paralyzed husband with the household income. Today, Achwak is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy merchandise for the market to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is a 23-year-old young man living with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as an accountant since 2007 after his graduation. To develop his work and be able to satisfy the demands of his work, Elie is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase a laptop that will facilitate his job.

loans.use: To purchase a laptop

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie C. is from the village of Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 20 years old. Ana Marie is married to Alvin. To make a living, Ana Marie owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling grilled pork and chicken (barbeque vending) in the local community. Ana Marie is just starting this business.

In July 2009, Ana Marie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana Marie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ana Marie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Ольга - 1956 года рождения. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Ольга со своим мужем имеют столовую на рынке Сомониён города Худжанда. У них очень много клиентов, потому, что к ним заходят и продавцы и покупатели рынка Сомониён. У них очень большой товарооборот. Поэтому ежедневно они закупают сырье и готовят разные блюда. Ольга просит займ для закупки  долго хранящих продуктов.
texts.en:
