Olga was born in 1956. She is married and is a mother of 2 children. Olga and her husband own a café at the Somoniyon market in the city of Khujand. They have many customers because both Somoniyon market sellers and buyers patronize their café. Their product turnover is high. This is why they buy products every day and cook various dishes. Olga is requesting this loan in order to purchase products with long shelf life.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of long-shelf-life products for cafe

loans.name: Zenab Group

texts.en:
Zenab is the group leader of Zenab group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to progress their businesses and make them larger. So they have requested a group loan of 42000 Afghani.

Zenab wants to take a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver. Khatra wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving. Norui wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. So they are very thankful to AFS and Kiva lenders who can support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 28 years old. She is married with three children. Currently, all three children are in school. She is a trader who trades in used clothes. Used clothes are patronized by many people as their daily wear and because of that, Beatrice has many customers. However, with little capital, she can barely sell to make a profit. She wants the loan, therefore, to buy more bales of a variety of used clothes to meet the desires of her customer and increase the income for her family. She is a member of the community group called “Adwene Pa” (Translated as Good conscience) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Bénédicte

texts.fr: A. Bénédicte est née le 16 Mars 1983 à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin.  Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant.  Bénédicte habite à Cotonou avec sa famille.  Son activité commercial est la vente des fruits saisonniers et des condiments.  C'est pour la première fois qu'elle désire de contracter un prêt d'Alidé. Elle voudrait se procurer un prêt pour acheter en quantité très suffisante des avocats, des condiments, des cartons de biscuits. Ce crédit lui permettra de mieux renforcer son activité en vue d'augmenter son chiffre d’affaires.
texts.en:
A. Bénédicte was born on March 16, 1983 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married and the mother of one child. Bénédicte lives in Cotonou with her family. Her commercial business involves selling seasonal fruit and condiments. For the first time, she would like to take on a loan from Alidé. She would like to acquire a loan to buy sufficient quantities of avocados, condiments, and boxes of cookies. This loan will enable her to bolster her business more, with the aim of increasing her turnover.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of avocados, cookies in boxes, and condiments

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Ибодулло Курбонов проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Ибодулло более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. В данный момент клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить дойную корову и продавать молоко, т.к. есть спрос на него.
texts.en:
Ibodullo K. lives in the Yavan district. He is 46 years old, married and has 3 children. Ibodullo has been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years. He feeds and sells livestock. Currently, client is requesting a loan in order to buy a dairy cow and then sell milk because it is in demand.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Oimniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Оимнисо – пожилая женщина 59 лет. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Раньше работала учителем в школе, но сейчас зарплата учителей не хватает на жизнь и Оимнисо начала заниматься продажей детской одежды на рынке Якшанбебозор города Худжанда. Ее муж работает разнорабочим, в свободное время помогает жене в ее бизнесе. Они старается много работать и зарабатывать побольше денег, чтобы прокормить семью. Оимнисо закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Она сама ездит выбирать товар. Оимнисо хотела, бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого она предпочла взять займ для закупки летнего товара.
texts.en:
Oimniso is an elderly 59-year-old woman. She is married and is a mother of 4 children. She has a higher pedagogical education. Previously, she worked as a teacher at a school, but because teachers’ salary was no longer enough for life, Oimniso began selling children’s clothing at the Yakshanbebozor market in the city of Khujand. Her husband works as a handyman and helps his wife with the business in his spare time. They try to work a lot and earn more money in order to support the family. Oimniso buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. She goes to pick her merchandise by herself. Oimniso wants to expand her merchandise assortment because good assortment attracts more customers. She decided to request a loan to purchase summer merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer merchandise

loans.name: Afia

texts.fr:
B. Afia est née le 08 Janvier 1960 à BOPA dans le département du Mono. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants qui sont actuellement aux Etats-Unis. Afia vend principalement des boissions, comme les jus de citron et bissup, jus très sucré qui vient de Bénin. Elle mène son activité à son domicile.  

Bénéficiaire dynamique et crédible, Afia est à son troisième crédit d’Alidé.  Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit pour s'approvisionner plus de lait en poudre, des citrons, du sucre, des boîtes de canettes.  Elle a le souci de bien rembourser le montant emprunté.
texts.en:
B. Afia was born on January 8, 1960 in BOPA in Mono county. He is married and the mother of two children who are currently in the United States. Afia sells mainly beverages, such as lemon juice and bissap juice, which is a very sweet drink from Benin. She operates her business in her home. An energetic and credible beneficiary, Afia is on her third loan with Alidé. She is requesting a new loan to stock up on powdered milk, lemons, sugar, and cans. She has the care to repay properly the amount borrowed.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cans, lemons, sugar, powdered milk

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en: Aaron is 26 years old and an unmarried young man. He has been selling Aloe Vera products such as food supplements, facial cleanser, body lotions, hair creams etc. for the past three years. He obtains his supply of Aloe Vera products from wholesalers and retails them to his customers on a credit basis. He wants to use his loan to buy Aloe Vera products in bulk to cater to the demands of his customers. He wants to use the proceeds from his operation to build a small shop to start selling assorted cosmetics. Aaron is a member of the group called “Adehye mma” (Meaning Royals). Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy Aloe Vera products in bulk.

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Махфират - женщина средних лет 1959 года рождения. Замужем и мать двоих детей. Занимается продажей женской обуви на рынках Джума и Якшанбе города Худжанда. Она закупает товар частично из города Истаравшан и из города Бишкека. Она привозит обувь средней цены, потому, что большое количество клиентов покупают недорогую и недешевую обувь. Махфират просит займ для закупки очередной партии летней обуви и частично школьной обуви, потому, что школьный сезон начинается.
texts.en:
Mahfirat is a middle-aged woman, born in 1959. She is married and is a mother of two children. She is involved in sales of women’s shoes at the Djuma and Yakshanbe markets in the city of Khujand. She brings her merchandise partially from the city of Istaravshan and from the city of Bishkek. She brings average-priced shoes because the majority of her customers purchase inexpensive but not cheap shoes. Mahfirat is requesting this loan to buy a stock of summer shoes and some school shoes because school season is starting.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer and school shoes

loans.name: Kadriddin

texts.ru: Чабборов Кадриддин проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 33 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Кадриддин более 7 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. У него есть постоянные клиенты. Но он иногда продает скот на рынке. Кредит просит для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Kadriddin C. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. Kadriddin has been involved in animal husbandry for over 7 years. He feeds and sells livestock. He has loyal customers, but he sometimes sells livestock at a market. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Charles' Group

texts.en:
Charles S. S. is a hard working and devoted 53-year-old man. He is married with 12 children aged from 29 to 10 years, of which 2 are still in school, and he also cares for 7 dependants, including grandchildren.

Charles has had a business selling waragi, a local brew, since 1984. His idea of getting loans was to help improve the quality of his waragi. The main challenges affecting his business are the debtors that take a long time to pay, the poor quality raw inputs in instances where he cannot afford to purchase the good ones, as well as a lack of charcoal because of the rainy season.

After having access to the loans, Charles is now able to make quality waragi, in addition to improving his customer care. He has a hope of ensuring that all his children attend school. He needs a loan to help purchase more raw materials like bananas, yeast, and firewood for making waragi. He is a member of the Bakyala Kwekulakulanya group in Lugazi.

loans.use: Buying raw materials for making waragi, a local brew.

loans.name: Gafur

texts.ru: Шукуров Гафур проживает в городе Яван. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Возраст 38 лет. Гафур более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Этот вид бизнеса является основным источником дохода, на который он содержит семью. Поэтому кредит, просит для покупки скота, т.к. увеличится и его прибыль.
texts.en:
Gafur S. lives in the city of Yavan. He is married and has 3 children. He is 38 years old. Gafur has been involved in animal husbandry for over 8 years. He feeds and sells livestock. This business is his sole source of income, which supports his family. This is why he is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock since his profits will increase too.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Gufron

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Гуфрону - 33 года. Женат и отец 2-х детей. Занимается продажей женской обуви в торговом центре "Бадри Мунир" города Худжанда. Гуфрону помогает его жена. Они ездят за товаром в город Истаравшан, жена выбирает товар на свой вкус, потому что мужчины плохо разбираются в женской моде. Гуфрон просит займ для закупки летней партии женской обуви.
texts.en:
Gufron is 33 years old, married and is father of 2 children. He sells women’s shoes at the Badri Munir shopping center in the city of Khujand. Gufron’s wife helps him with the business. They go to the city of Istaravshan for their merchandise. The wife chooses the merchandise to her taste because men do not know much about women’s fashions. Gufron is requesting a loan to purchase a stock of women’s summer shoes.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer shoes

loans.name: Khadim

texts.fr: Khadim D. est âgé de 29 ans .Il est maître coranique  et chanteur dans le quartier de Médine dans la ville de Mbour. Il sollicite un prêt pour l’acquisition de matériel de sonorisation pour les chants religieux qu’il anime. Ce matériel  mis en location  génère  des revenus qui lui permettront d'entretenir sa famille
texts.en:
Khadim D. is 29 years old. He is a Koranic teacher in the Médine district of the city of Mbour. He is requesting a loan for acquiring sound equipment for the religious singing he leads. This equipment will be rented out and is going to generate funds as revenues for him.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Electronic sound equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Муборак женщина 56 лет. Замужем и имеет 5-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с мужем. Муборак откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, муж Муборак продает их на скотном рынке. Муборак кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Она успешно закончила два предыдущих займов, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Муборак планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Муборак очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Muborak is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and has 5 children. Together with her husband, she is involved in feeding and selling livestock. Muborak feeds the livestock at home, and once the livestock is ready, Muborak’s husband sells it at the livestock market. Muborak has been our client for 1 year. She successfully repaid two previous loans and now wants to obtain the next one. Muborak plans to increase the quantity of her livestock and, thus, increase her family profit. Muborak likes our financing terms very much, and she is glad that such organizations that support the public exist.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing accessories in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more chicks.

loans.name: Sokhna Top

texts.fr: Sokhna Top D. est âgée de 26 ans, elle est restauratrice au niveau du gare routier de Mbour. Elle vend du petit déjeuner et du déjeuneraux chauffeurs et aux voyageurs . Ce prêt lui servira d’accroitre sa capacité  pour satisfaire la forte demande des client surtout en cette période de vacance.  les revenus qui lui permettraient de faire face à d’autres besoins familiaux
texts.en:
Sokhna Top D., age 26, is a restauranteur at the bus station of Mbour. She sells breakfast and lunch meals to drivers and travelers who are en route. This loan will be used to increase her capacity and revenues, enabling her to cope with other family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food catering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      
Дилбар женщина 56 лет. Замужем и имеет 5-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с сыновьями и мужем. Дилбар откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, сыновья Дилбар продает их на скотном рынке. Дилбар кредитуется в нашей организации 2 года. Она успешно закончила все предыдущие займы, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Дилбар планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Дилбар благодарит нашу организацию и Киву за поддержку обществу.
texts.en:
Dilbar is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and has 5 children. Together with her sons and husband, she is involved in feeding and selling livestock. Dilbar feeds the livestock at home, and once the livestock is ready, Dilbar’s sons sell it at the livestock market. Dilbar has been our client for 2 years. She successfully repaid all of her previous loans and now wants to obtain another one. Dilbar plans to increase the quantity of her livestock and, thus, increase her family profit. Dilbar thanks our organization and Kiva for supporting the society.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Гулбахор женщина 1961 года рождения. Вдова и имеет 4-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с сыновьями. Гулбахор откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, сыновья Гулбахор продают их на скотном рынке. Гулбахор кредитуется в нашей организации более 1 года. Она успешно закончила предыдущие займы, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Гулбахор планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Гулбахор очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Gulbahor is a woman who was born in 1961. She is a widow and has four children. She feeds and sells cattle together with her sons. Gulbahor feeds cattle at home and when it's ready for sale her sons sell it on the cattle market. Gulbahor has been taking out loans at our organization for more than a year. She has successfully completed her previous loans and now wants to take out a new loan. Gulbahor plans to increase the amount of cattle and by that increase the profit for her family. Gulbahor very much likes the terms of our loans and is happy that organization like these exist and support the communities.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional stocks of medicine in bulk.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es: El Grupo “San Antonio” se encuentra representado por la señora Julia y conformada por 12 miembros  que cursan ya su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. En general los socios se dedican a actividades de índole comercial como la venta de comida, cosméticos, lubricantes, ropa y al servicio de limpieza. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias. Las socias cuentan con experiencia crediticia ya que algunas ya trabajaron en nuestra institución y van cursando su segundo ciclo y los miembros nuevos conocen la modalidad del crédito solidario.
texts.en:
The “San Antonio” group is represented by Julia and it is composed of 12 members who are in their second loan cycle. They have demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in their payments. In general, the members work in types of business such as selling food, cosmetics, lubricants, clothing, and cleaning services. There is a lot of competition, but the members of the group know how to get ahead because of their experience and their desire to work. The loan will be used to purchase materials, ingredients, and tools that will help them to generate greater income, since their families depend on that income. The members have experience with credit because some of them have already worked with our institution and they are in their second loan cycle and the new members are familiar with the group loan model.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Felista's Group

texts.en: Felista N. is a 54-year-old mother of 4 children aged from 30 to 16 years and she cares for 5 dependants. Felista has a grocery store that has been in existence for 16 years, with challenges including seasonal changes and bad debtors. In her store, she sells eats and refreshments like sodas and cold drinks. She has been able to educate her children single-handedly with the help of loans after her husband died when they were still young, and she is so grateful for being able to do so. Felista needs a loan to help buy more stock for her grocery store. She is a member of the Bakyala Kwekulakulanya group in Lugazi.

loans.use: Buying more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en: M. Juliet is forty-six years old and married with four children aged 10 through 18, plus she cares for two orphans. Juliet operates a bar in Nyakabirizi Township. With the nature of her job, she works until late in the night with  customers who sometimes need controlling, so she has experience in human handling techniques. She is able to make a good profit from her business. Juliet has a dream of owning her own club and educating all her children through Makerere University. She needs a loan to help complete paying school fees for her children, and she also needs to increase her working capital. She is the leader of Knowledge group 1 in Bushenyi.

loans.use: To restock her bar.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: aminata C. est un societaire qui emprunte regulierement a la caisse de bayelaye a guediawaye.elle en est a son neuvieme credit .son activite principale est la vente de produits cosmetiques mais elle s'affaire aussi dans la petite restauration(vente depetit dejeuner et de sandwichs).elle capitalise une experience de plus de cinq ans.elle sollicite un credit de quatre cent cinquante mille(450 000)frs en vue d'elargir sesdeux activites et de satisfaire la demande croissante de ses clients
texts.en:
Aminata C. is a member who borrows regularly from the Bayelaye bank in Guediawaye. She is on her 9th loan. Her main business involves selling cosmetics, but she also does business in food catering (selling breakfast meals and sandwiches). She capitalizes on over five years of experience. She is requesting a loan of 450,000 francs with the aim of expanding her two businesses and satisfying the growing demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es: El grupo “Amanecer” esta representado por la señora Julieta y conformado por 12 miembros que en general se dedican la venta D. ropa, artesanía, edredones, comida, transporte publico D. pasajeros y a servicios funerarios. Pese a la competencia las señoras tratan D. mantenerse en sus negocios para poder seguir percibiendo su ingreso diarios que es el sustento D. sus familias y el pilar fundamental D. sus hogares. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso que servirá para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación y una mayor calidad D. vida. A pesar D. ser un grupo nuevo los socios ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a financiamientos D. entidades similares a la Fundación Agrocapital quien les brinda un apoyo económico para sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Amanecer” group is represented by Julieta and is composed of 12 members who, in general, work selling clothing, crafts, blankets, food, public transportation and funeral services. Despite the competition, the women try to stay in business so they can continue to earn their daily incomes, which sustain their families and are the fundamental pillars of their homes. The loan will be used to purchase materials, ingredients, and tools that will help them to generate greater income, which will serve to proviD. their children with better education and a better quality of life. Though the group is new, the members already have experience in group loans because of financing from institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital, which provides them economic help so they can proviD. for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku N. is in the business of selling fish at the market and has requested a loan to stock more fish to sell.  Kaku is 31 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 6 children who attend school.  With the extra profits generated through her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a net and a boat for fishing. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy and stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional supplies in bulk for her shop.

loans.name: Cissy's Group

texts.en:
M. Cissy, 45, is the leader of Knowledge group 2 in Bushenyi. She is a business lady who, for twelve years, has had a business selling beans in Nyakabirizi. Her business was mostly affected by limited capital until she joined her lending group.

Cissy has a store in the Township and her dream is to have the biggest of its kind in the area since at the moment, she is only able to make profits of 70,000/= per month. Cissy is a widow with three children aged 20, 17 and 15 years at the university and the last 2 in secondary school. She also cares for her only stepchild.

Cissy needs a loan to help purchase more beans for resale; and in most cases, her loans also help with clearing her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans for resale

loans.name: Salud Group

texts.es: Las socias D. banco comunal "Salud" se encuentran representadas por la señora Ana Barbara y conformada por 12 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican a la venta D. roa interior, comida, zapatos, empanadas, cosméticos y muebles en general.  Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda pero el deseo D. querer superarse es más granD. ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. Este crédito esta destinado para el aumento D. sus mercaderías en diferentes áreas a que se dedican dichas socias y para la ampliación y el arreglo D. sus fuentes D. trabajo. Alguno D. los miembros D. grupo tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que conocen  los requisitos D. la institución como la responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. trabajar.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "Salud" (Health) are represented by Ana Barbara. The twelve members sell products like underwear, food, shoes, empanadas, cosmetics, and general items. As in all commercial areas, there is a lot of competition for supply and demand, but these women all have a strong desire to better themselves, because their families depend on them.

This loan will be used to increase merchandise for the members' different businesses, and for the expansion and repair of their work sources. Some of the members of this group have experience with solidarity groups, so they understand the requirements of the organization, like responsibility, integrity, and the desire to work.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional bulk supplies of women’s clothes for her store.

loans.name: Las Activas Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Las Activas" representadas por la señora Lucia  y conformadas por 12 miembros dentro D. las cuales existe un parentesco entre la señora Jacqueline y Roxana, Ambas con ingresos totalmente independientes una D. la otra. En general las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como cosméticos, comida, zapatos, abarrotes, otros D. los miembros se dedican a la elaboración D. prendas D. vestir y al servicio D. transporte público. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas D. trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. Las socias cuentan con experiencia crediticia ya que algunas ya trabajaron en nuestra institución y van cursando su segundo ciclo y los miembros nuevos conocen la modalidad del crédito solidario.
texts.en:
The members of the cooperative bank “Las Activas” are represented by Mrs. Lucia and up to twelve other members. (Jacqueline and Roxana are related although their income is completely independent of one another.) In general, the members sell products such as cosmetics, food, shoes and groceries. Other members make clothes or proviD. public transportation. The member’s experience in the commercial realm is high. They know how to move forward thanks to their experience and work ethic. The purpose of the loan is for the acquisition of materials, goods and tools that help them generate the largest income. The money will help them to support their families. The members have credit experience as some work in our institution and are in the second cycle of their studies. The new members know about the modality of individual loans.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional clothes in bulk

loans.name: Slc Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of The SLC (Sierra Leone Church) Primary School, Makeni. The SLC Primary School, Makeni was built by the Anglican Mission in 1914 and is the oldest school in Makeni City. Currently, the school has a total of nineteen staff and 976 pupils. 

Since its inception, the school has helped produced many dignitaries, scholars and professional workers, both within and without Sierra Leone. The school has in its alumni: teachers, doctors, lawyers, engineers, ministers, a president and so on. Still, the school continues to make a mark in the academic circles. Last academic year, they achieved 100% passes at the National Primary School Examination (NPSE). They have also established a link with a primary school in England, Margret Primary School in an inter-primary school exchange program.

With this loan, some of these teachers will start small businesses and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children's education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects.  

Yaya M. (right) is the head master at the school. He is age forty-one and was born in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married with five children, one is already grown-up, two are in primary school, one in secondary school and the other in college. Mr. M. has been a teacher for twenty eight years now. He will invest this loan into his businesses. Mr. M. sells local produces like palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, beans, ground-nut etc. in order to supplement his monthly salary. He has been selling local produces for twelve years. Out of the profit he makes from this business, Mr. M. has been able to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Idrissa A.'s Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are all teachers at a secondary school in Makeni. The school was built in 1989 by a Muslim leader, with a body of religious and businesswomen to help educate the children of Makeni city and the surrounding villages. This school (a junior secondary school) has a total of 38 staff and 500 pupils. It is one of the most advanced secondary schools in Makeni city. Over the years, the school has produced teachers, doctors, lawyers, accountants, ministers and so on.

Teachers are one of the poorest paid workers in Sierra Leone. Because of this, many of them find alternative means of making a living. Some engage in business or agriculture while others organize extra classes for pupils. These teachers are therefore seeking a loan in order to embark on meaningful projects. They will gradually repay the loan out of their monthly salaries.

Idrissa A. M. is a senior teacher at the school. He is 50 years old and was born in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. Mr. M. has been a teacher for over 29 years now. He is married with four children, all of whom are at university. He will use this loan to pay the second semester college fees for two of his children in N’Jala University College.

loans.use: To pay his children's college fees

loans.name: Thomas S.'s Group

texts.en:
The members of this loan group, secondary school teachers in Makeni City, are requesting a loan in order to supplement their monthly salaries. With the help of a loan, they will be able to invest in business, pay their children’s school fees, or buy something needed. Their school bursar will deduct each teacher’s repayment amount from their monthly salaries and repay SMT/Kiva on their behalf.

Thomas S. C. (first on the right in the photo) is the leader of this group. Thirty-five years old and married with one child who is in class one, Thomas was born in Makali in the Tonkolili district, north of Sierra Leone. He has been a teacher for three years now.

This will be the fourth loan he has received from SMT/Kiva. With the first loan, he was able to buy a plot of land. With the second, he bought house-building materials such as corrugated iron, zinc, cement, sand, etc. With the third loan, Thomas started the construction of a house – three bedrooms, a parlor and a store. With this loan, he expects to complete the building process. Thomas is thus very happy about SMT/Kiva loans as they have enabled him do something many of his age cannot do.

loans.use: The completion of a house-building project.

loans.name: Antonita

texts.en:
Antonita S. is currently in the business of selling local brew and is requesting a loan to purchase brewing materials for distillation.  Antonita is 26 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and rent it out. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more brewing materials for distillation

loans.name: Las Koketas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Koketas” esta representado por la señora Raquel y conformada por 16 miembros los cuales una mayoría se dedican a generar ingresos en sus pequeños negocios D. venta D. productos como dulces, empanadas, comida, colchones abarrotes y al servicio D. secretariado y construcción D. vivienda. Dentro D. los rubro comercial existe un alto nivel D. competencia pero las ganas D. salir adelante hacen que nuestras socias trabajen para sacar adelante a sus familias; es por esta razón que requieren del préstamo que les ayudara en la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y por enD. la calida D. vida D. sus familias. La socias no cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios pero saben como responder a sus obligaciones ya que son gente trabajadora y honesta es por esta razón que la fundación Agrocapital les brinda y apoyo económico para darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank group "Las Koketas" is represented by Sra. Raquel and is comprised of 16 members who are mainly engaged in small retail businesses selling products such as candy, empanadas, prepared food, mattresses and groceries. Other members offer secretarial and construction services. Within the local commercial area, there is a high level of competition that motivates our members to work hard to proviD. for their families. For this reason, they have requested a loan to help them acquire materials, supplies and tools to help them improve their earnings and thereby make life better for their families. These members have no prior experience with solidarity groups, but they understand their obligations because they are hardworking and honest people. Fundación Agrocapital is there to proviD. financial support to its clients and help them improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Jazmines-Uno Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Jazmin Uno” esta representado por el señor Basilio y conformado por 16 miembros, que trabajan para poder ayudar económicamente al bienestar de sus familias por eso es que acuden a la institución buscando un apoyo económico rápido que les permita invertir en sus pequeños negocios para así obtener mayores  ganancias y brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. El grupo en general se dedican a la venta de productos como pan, comida, refrescos, frutas y colchones, entre los varones se dedican al servicio de construcción de viviendas, transporte público y a la elaboración de pan. La competencia dentro del ámbito comercial es elevado pero los socios saben como salir adelante ya que son un grupo compacto y con mucha experiencia en sus trabajos. En cuanto a la experiencia en creditos solidarios muchos de los miembros del grupo ya trabajaron con instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que cuentan con la experiencia para cumplir con sus obligaciones de forma honesta y cumplida.
texts.en:
The “Jazmin Uno” Community Bank is represented by Basilio and consists of 16 members who work hard to be able to help their family's well-being economically. It's for this reason they turn to Kiva partner Fundación Agrocapital in search of quick economic support that will allow them to invest in their small businesses and thus obtain better profits so they can provide their families with a better quality of life. In general, the group makes a living selling products like bread, food, drinks, fruits and mattresses. Among the men, they work in home construction, public transportation and bake bread. There is a lot of competition within their commercial environment, but the members know how to keep moving forward, and they form a tight group with a lot of work experience. Many of the members have received individual loans from institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital, so they have the experience to fully and honestly fulfill their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Maneja

texts.en:
Maneja S. is currently in the business of selling televisions, radios, CDs etc at her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase computers and internet facilities to sell.  Maneja is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 2 children and her children attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up an internet cafe.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase computers and internet facilities to sell

loans.name: Pedro Segundo Group

texts.es: El Grupo “Pedro Segundo” esta representado por la señora Martha y conformado por 15 miembros que se conformaron D. tres grupos diferentes formando uno nuevo. Todos ellos se dedican a diferentes actividades,  algunas socias se dedican a la venta D. abarrotes y comida en sus domicilios otras poseen sus puestos D. venta D. ropa, cosméticos y a la costura D. prendas D. vestir y al trasporte público D. pasajeros. Dentro del rubro comercial existe mucha competencia pero gracias a la experiencia D. las socias y a sus ganas D. trabajar salen adelante para generar un ingreso diario que es el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso que servirá para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación y una mayor calidad D. vida. A pesar D. ser un grupo nuevo los socios ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a financiamientos D. entidades similares a la Fundación Agrocapital quien les brinda un apoyo económico para sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Pedro Segundo” Group is represented by Martha and consists of 15 members who came together from three different groups to form a new one. All the members make a living in different activities. Some sell groceries and food out of their home, while others have posts selling clothing and cosmetics, are dressmakers or work in public transportation. Within their commercial environment there is a lot of competition, but thanks to the members' experience and their desire to keep working and make headway they have been able to earn the daily income that is the sustenance of their families. The loan they are requesting will be used to purchase materials, ingredients and tools that will help them generate more profits so they can proviD. their children with a better education and a higher quality of life. Despite being a new group, the members already have experience working with loans from institutions similar to Kiva partner Fundación Agrocapital, which is providing them with economic support so their families can make headway.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Conforte

texts.fr:
K. Conforte est née en 1938 à Avrankou, un village situé dans le département de l'Ouémé à quelques kilomètres de Porto-Novo, la capitale de la République du Bénin.  Conforte est mariée et mère de quatre enfants qui ne sont plus à sa charge.  Actuellement, elle habite à Cotonou, la ville la plus grande de Bénin. 

Conforte vend des bananes, plantains, des fruits saisonniers. Elle fait ses achats au marché Dantokpa, un grand marché à Cotonou.  Elle revend ses marchandises de façon ambulante et à domicile.  Elle est actuellement à son troisième crédit d’Alidé.  Conforte sollicite un nouveau crédit pour rehausser le niveau de son activité.  Elle voudrait acheter plus de bananes, plantains, d’autres fruits.
texts.en:
K. Conforte was born in 1938 in Avrankou, a village located in Ouémé county a few kilometers from Porto-Novo, the capital of Republic of Benin. She is married and the mother of four children, who she no longer supports. Currently she lives in Cotonou, the largest city in Benin. Conforte sells bananas, plantains, and seasonal fruit. She makes her purchases at the Dantokpa market, a large marketplace in Cotonou. She resells her merchandise door-to-door and out of her home. She is now on her third loan with Alidé. She is requesting a new loan to raise her level of business. She would like to buy more bananas, plantains, and other fruit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bananas, plantains, and other fruit

loans.name: Luz Naciente Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal “Los Andes”, se encuentra un grupo de 15 señoras dinámicas que  se hacen llamar “Luz naciente”, están juntas casi 3 años y su presidenta es Estefa G. que tiene el negocio de venta de comida y requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, fideo, papa y verduras, al igual que Estefa las demás integrantes tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de fruta, carne, cosméticos, zapatos, fundas y ponchos y también necesitan comprar mercadería y tener productos variados que ofrecer a sus clientes.

Todas las integrantes de “Luz naciente” asisten responsablemente al consultorio para hacerse la toma del PAP (Examen del Papanicolau).
texts.en:
In the Los Andes Community Center, there is a dynamic group of 15 women who call themselves “Luz Naciente” (Light of Dawn). They have been together for almost 3 years, and their president is Estefa G.. Sra. Estefa sells food and needs a loan to buy rice, noodles, potatoes and vegetables. Other members have different businesses selling fruit, meat, cosmetics, shoes, pillowcases, and ponchos. They need to buy merchandise so that they can have a variety of products to offer to their customers.

All the members of “Luz Naciente” have responsibly kept their medical appointments to receive their pap tests.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: George William's Group

texts.en: George William L. is the leader of the Kyaterekera group in Lugazi. He is 68 years old and married with 10 children aged 10 to 45 years, of which 4 are still in school. He also cares for 6 dependants. George is a farmer and deals in the sale of produce. In addition, he has been selling fish for 6 years in Sanga, Mabira Township. He is able to make a weekly profit of  about 30,000 and this is mainly due to his experience, quality supplies and good customer handling. He plans to own a market stall with a hope of making more money. He would like to build a better family house and ensure that all his children are educated. He needs a loan to increase his capital and purchase more stock for his business.

loans.use: Buying more produce and fish for resale.

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en: Kaku L. is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is an accountant. She has three children and her children go to school. Kaku is currently in the business of selling electric sockets, fluorescent tubes, bulbs, etc. and is requesting a loan to purchase generators to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to stock more generators to sell. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase generators to sell

loans.name: La Soñadora 2 Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Soñadoras” esta representado por la señora Cristina Vanessa y conformada por 15 miembros los cuales van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas  D. trabajar para salir adelante con sus pequeños negocios D. venta D. productos como refrescos, cosméticos, comida, ropa, empanadas y a actividades como la costura D. prendas D. vestir y al servicio D. entrega en moto taxis. Dentro D. los rubro comercial existe un alto nivel D. competencia pero las ganas D. salir adelante hacen que nuestras socias trabajen para sacar adelante a sus familias; es por esta razón que requieren D. un financiamiento, que les ayudara en la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y por enD. a mejorar la calida D. vida D. sus familias. Por ser su segundo ciclo la Fundación Agrocapital les brinda un apoyo económico para que sigan creciendo y fortificando más sus ingresos diarios.
texts.en:
The “Las Soñadoras" ("The Dreamers") Community Bank is represented by Cristina Vanessa and consists of 15 members who have enrolled in their second loan cycle demonstrating responsibility, honesty and a desire to work to make headway with their small business. The members sell products such as drinks, cosmetics, food, clothing, empanadas, make dresses and drive taxis. There is a high level of competition within their commercial environment, but their desire to keep moving ahead and proviD. for their families has maD. the members work hard. It's for this reason they are requesting the loan, which will help them acquire materials, ingredients and tools that will increase their profits and in turn improve their families' quality of life. With their second loan cycle from Kiva partner Fundación Agrocapital, they are provided financial support so they can continue to grow and increase their daily income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Rafael Pabon Group

texts.es: El grupo “Rafael Pabon” esta representado por la señora Lisbeth Lina y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en sus pagos. En general las socias se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios como la venta de, ropa, frezadas, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, salteñas, construcción y a la extracción de minerales. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias y mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. Dentro del grupo existen socios nuevos pero que conocen la modalidad de créditos solidarios y son gente responsable, honesta y con ganas de trabajar.
texts.en:
The “Rafael Pabon” Group is represented by Lisbeth Lina and consists of 12 members who have enrolled in their third loan cycle demonstrating responsibility and honesty with their payments. In general, the members make a living in different types of businesses, such as selling clothing, groceries and regional meals or working in construction or mining. The competition in the commercial environment is quite high, but the members know how to keep making headway thanks to their experience and desire to work. The loan they are requesting will be used to acquire materials, ingredients and tools that will help the group generate more profits, which their families' sustenance depends on, and improve their families' quality of life. There are new members to the group, but they are familiar with loan repayments and are responsible, honest and hard-working people.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Claudine

texts.fr:
S. Claudine a 30 ans. Elle est mariée à GAGUI Albert Soudeur et est mère d'un enfant qui est au première année a l’école. Elle est née à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin et elle y habite avec sa famille.  Claudine vend de nourriture y compris mais et gari, le nom Béninois de la farine de cassave.  Elle prépare des repas pour ses clients.  

Claudine a un respect scrupuleux de son échéancier de remboursement. Avec un nouveau crédit, elle désire de s’approvisionner afin de mieux faire face aux nombreuses exigences de sa fidèle clientèle.  Elle voudrait acheter plus de mais, de gari, des cartons d'ailerons.
texts.en:
Claudine S. is 30 years old. She is married to Albert Soudeur Gagui and is the mother of a child who is in grade one. She was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin and she lives with her family. Claudine sells food products including corn and gari, the Benin word for cassava flour. She prepares meals for her clients. Claudine has a conscientious respect for her loan repayment schedule. With this new loan she wishes to resupply her products so that she may better meet the high demand of her faithful clientele. She would like to purchase more corn, gari, and cases of fish.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of corn, gari and fish

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en:
Khamis M. is 28 years old and married to a builder. She has three children who are currently in school. Khamis has a business selling clothes and shoes and is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase sewing machines.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: St. Luke Group

texts.en:
Akosua, a 42-year-old married mother of four children, trades in utensils, rubber and plastic products. The leader of a trust bank group called St. Luke, she is seated first on the right in the photo. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and farmers who buy their raw materials, wares or goods from Kumasi and sometimes from nearby communities to sell at the market square in their community. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children good educations.

loans.use: To buy more stock for their businesses.

loans.name: Virgen Del Milagro Group

texts.es: Los miembros del Grupo “Virgen del Milagro” se encuentran representadas por la señora Adriana Mabel y conformada por 12 miembros que presentan dos nexos consanguíneos entre las señoras Mirian, Lidia y Maritza, Janeth Claudia que son hermanas con ingresos totalmente independientes una D. la otra. Un 70% D. los miembros del grupo esta dedicado a la venta D. comida con platos tipicos ya que se encuentran ubicados en una zona turística y el restante 30% se dedica a la elaboración D. masitas y a la confección D. prendas D. vestir.  La competencia en este rubro es bastante exigente ya que los turistas cuentan con paladares bastante exigentes pero los socios cuentan con socias experiencia en su rubro y saben como salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para la ampliación D. sus locales comerciales y la compra D. herramientas e insumos para generar mayores ingresos que les permitirá brindarles a sus familias una  mejor calidad D. vida. Las socias cuentan con un buen historial crediticio, por otro lado vienen demostrando responsabilidad en el pago D. la deuda contraída con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
The “Virgen del Milagro” Group is represented by Adriana Mabel and consists of 12 members, including two sets of sisters - Mirian and Lidia; and Maritza and Janeth Claduia - who all work totally independent of the other. About 70 percent of the group makes a living selling traditional regional meals in the tourist zone, and the other 30 percent makes a living making little pastries and in dressmaking. The competition in their commercial environment is quite high, since the tourists come with demanding palates, but the members have a lot of experience and know how to keep making headway. The loan they are requesting will be used to expand their places of business and purchase tools and ingredients so they can generate more profits, which will allow them to proviD. their families with a higher quality of life. The members have a strong credit history and also have demonstrated responsibility in repaying debt to our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Ovia's Group

texts.en:
K. Ovia, 42, is the leader of Kyegwisa Bakyara group in Ibanda. She is a married lady with five children in primary and tertiary institutions of learning and she helps pay their school fees with the help of her husband. Ovia also helps to cater for four dependents including paying their school fees.

Ovia has had a grocery and a tailoring business in Kyegwisa for thirteen years and, over the years, she is now able to make weekly profits of 26,000/=. She is able to sustain her business because of her good customer care and her well-stocked businesses. In future, she hopes to have a much bigger business as well as to educate her children further.

Ovia’s loans help in keeping up stock and having more clothing materials for her tailoring business - hence business expansion.This loan will help her with the same purpose.

loans.use: To restock her grocery store and to buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Maria España

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank 'Mujeres Perseverantes' (Persevering Women) and lives in the city of Pucallpa. She sells cooked beans out of two extra large pots at the Micaela Market, an eclectic collection of stands along the main road that connects Pucallpa to faraway Lima. Maria gets up around 3:00 am to begin cooking the beans over charcoal. By 7:00 am they are ready. Maria works every day from Monday to Saturday, taking Sunday off to attend church.

Maria began working with Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos, three years ago when she was widowed. Before her husband died, Maria had never worked. She used her first loan to start her bean-selling business. Maria plans to use this loan of 1500 PEN in part to start up another business selling cooked meats in the evening from her home. The money will go toward purchasing plates and cups to serve the food to customers, as well as toward more beans for her current business. Maria decided to start this additional business to supplement her income because bean sales have not been very good. Although Maria’s two adult sons, who are policemen in other towns, have helped Maria to pay back her loans, she does not want to count on their help indefinitely.

Maria lives with her 25-year-old daughter who works as a secretary at a local school. Maria enjoys selling, and says that without her loans from Manuela Ramos, she would not have the capital to work. She is proud to have never gotten behind in her loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase plates, cups and other goods to serve cooked meats, and also to buy beans

loans.name: Awurade Kasa Group

texts.en:
Diana is twenty eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. She is a trader. She sells crates of eggs. Diana is also the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Awurade Kasa’ which means "Speak Lord". She is seated first from right. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and then resell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group provide guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children good educations.

loans.use: To buy supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Las Autonomicas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Autonómicas” esta representado por la señora Damaris y conformada por 15 miembros los cuales van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas  D. trabajar para salir adelante con sus pequeños negocios D. venta D. productos como pan, cosméticos, comida, ropa, empanadas y otros trabajan como empleados D. empresas. Dentro D. los rubro comercial y D. servicios existe un alto nivel D. competencia pero las ganas D. salir adelante hacen que nuestras socias trabajen para sacar adelante a sus familias; es por esta razón que requieren D. un financiamiento, que les ayudara en la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y por enD. a mejorar la calida D. vida D. sus familias. Por ser su segundo ciclo la Fundación Agrocapital les brinda un apoyo económico para que sigan creciendo y fortificando más sus ingresos diarios.
texts.en:
The communal bank group “Las Autonómicas” is represented by Sra. Damaris and is comprised of 15 members who are on their second loan cycle. They have demonstrated responsibility, honesty and a willingness to work hard in order to succeed. Some of the members run small businesses selling products such as bread, cosmetics, prepared meals, clothing and empanadas. Other members are contractors hired by other businesses.

Within the local commercial and service areas, there is a high level of competition that motivates our members to work hard to proviD. for their families. For this reason, they have requested a loan to help them acquire materials, supplies and tools to help them improve their earnings and thereby make life better for their families. As they begin their second loan cycle, Fundación Agrocapital will be there to proviD. financial support to help them succeed and improve their daily earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Flores De Febrero Group

texts.es:
“F. de febrero” es un grupo de  señoras dinámicas que elaboran su reglamento interno, es decir, ponerse de acuerdo en el día y hora de la reunión, así como las multas por retrazo, falta e incumplimiento de la cuota, a la cabeza de su presidenta Lourdes G. quien las dirige bajo un ordenado orden del día. 

Lourdes cuenta que ella tiene una librería y requiere del préstamo para incrementar su  mercadería , es decir, comprar hojas, cuadernos, lápices, cartulina y otros. Las demás integrantes también tienen su propios negocios como la venta de zapatos, ropa y CD, pero una mayoría tiene el negocio de macramé, es un tipo de tejido que se hace con las manos y pueden elaborar carteras, chalinas y sombreros y necesitan el préstamo para comprar insumos como la cola de rata.
texts.en:
The “F. de febrero” (Flowers of February) Association is a dynamic group of women who draw up their own rules such as the agreed day and time for their meetings, penalties for late payments, etc. The group’s president, Lourdes G., maintains order at each meeting.

Lourdes runs a bookstore and needs a loan to increase her merchandise, such as writing tablets, notebooks, pencils, greeting cards, and other items. The remaining members also have their own businesses selling shoes, clothing, and compact discs. However, the majority have macramé businesses that produce handmade satchels, scarves, and hats. They need a loan to buy supplies such as crochet materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: La Frontera Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Frontera” esta representado por la señora Adriana, es un grupo nuevo compuesto D. 19 personas, D. las cuales 3 ya participaron en aterieres grupos dentro D. la fundación Agrocapital, las mujeres se dedican a la venta D. comida, pan, cosméticos,  perfumes y los varones se dedican a actividades como el trasporte público, construcción y al servicio mecánico. Dentro D. los rubro comercial existe un alto nivel D. competencia pero las ganas D. salir adelante hacen que nuestras socios trabajen para sacar adelante a sus familias; es por esta razón que requieren D. un financiamiento, que les ayudara en la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y por enD. a mejorar la calida D. vida D. sus familias. A pesar D. ser un grupo relativamente nuevo cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios debido a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación agrocapital quien le brinda un apoyo económico para sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank group "La Frontera" is represented by Sra. Adriana. This is a new group composed of 19 individuals, 3 of whom have previously participated with other groups within Fundación Agrocapital. The women sell food, bread, cosmetics and perfumes. The men are engaged in businesses such as public transportation, construction and mechanical repair services.

Within the local commercial area, there is a high level of competition that motivates our members to work hard to proviD. for their families. For this reason, they have requested a loan to help them acquire materials, supplies and tools to help them improve their earnings and thereby make life better for their families. Despite being a relatively new group, they are experienced with the solidarity loan concept. Financial entities, such as Fundación Agrocapital, are there to support them as they seek to improve the well-being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Bo Bra Pa Group

texts.en:
Bernice is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. Bernice is a trader. She trades in cereals – rice.

Bernice is the leader of a trust bank group called “Bo bra pa”, meaning “Live a moral life”. Bernice is seated first on the left. The group members are hard working. Most of them are traders, food vendors and or farmers. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from Kumasi and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well.

The members have been in business for a number of years and have amassed a great deal of experiences in their businesses. However, their dream of expanding their businesses has not yet been realized. They are therefore requesting the loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses. The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es: El grupo “Fortaleza” esta representado por la señora Elvira y conformado por 15 miembros dentro de los cuales existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Roxana y Teresa las cuales son hermanas con ingresos independientes una de la otra por lo que no representa un riesgo para el grupo. Los miembros del grupo van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que cuentan una vez mas con el apoyo económico de la Fundación Agrocapital el cual les servirá para ampliar sus negocios de venta de ropa, comida, cosméticos, abarrotes y en la compra de herramientas en caso de los socios que se dedican a la elaboración de pan, al servicio publico en vehículos y moto taxis. La competencia dentro del rubro comercial es alta pero la experiencia y ganas de salir delante de los miembros del grupo vencen cualquier obstáculo en especial si de ello depende el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The “Fortaleza” [“Strength”] group is led by Elvira and is composed of 15 members; two of the members, Roxana and Teresa, are sisters, however, because they earn their income independently from each other they pose no risk to the group. The group members are in their second loan cycle and have been punctual and responsible in their payments for which they now count once again with the financial support of the Agrocapital Foundation. This support will be used to expand their businesses in the sale of clothing, food, cosmetics, and groceries, and it will also be used to purchase tools for those members that dedicate themselves to bread making, public transportation, and taxi services. Competition in the commercial sector is high but the experience and drive to get ahead of the group members make it so that they will conquer any obstacle especially because their families depend on it.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital.

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.en:
Julia is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres Perseverantes” (Persevering Women) and lives in the city of Pucallpa. Julia has a stall at Pucallpa’s massive Bellavista market where she sells chicken and different fruits, depending on the season. When I visited her recently in the late morning, she had already sold most of her chickens and had some peppers, plantains and oranges for sale.

Julia has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years and used her very first loan to fix up a house on her property so she could rent it out to tenants. At that time she had a business selling fruit juices but left that for her current enterprise at the Bellavista market, which she finds less strenuous. According to Julia, her loans from Manuela Ramos have helped her to maintain enough capital to keep her business going.

Julia plans to use this loan of 1500 soles to purchase 30 hens and to fix up her stand so that she can keep them there. These hens are of a higher quality than the chickens she sells currently, so she hopes to be able to make a better profit with them.

Julia is a single mother of a five-year-old daughter. Her goal is to eventually have a business out of her home which would be easier for her daughter, who currently must rise every day before dawn to accompany her mother to the market. In this short video clip, Julia talks about the home-based business she would like to have eventually: a stationary and copy shop, which she thinks would do well due to the fact that there are many schools in her area.

loans.use: To buy 30 hens and fix up a market stall.

loans.name: Marie-Claire

texts.fr:
Marie-Claire T. est née le 08 Août 1972 à Porto-Novo, la capitale de la République du Bénin.  Elle est mariée à Midjohodo André Hounsou, chauffeur et conducteur de gros-porteurs.  Elle est mère d'une fille qui est scolarisée.  Marie-Claire et sa famille habitent à Cotonou, une grande ville du Bénin.

Marie-Claire est coiffeuse.  Elle possède un salon de coiffure dans lequel elle mène son activité.  Elle y vend aussi des tissus et des produits de beauté.  Elle voudrait solliciter un nouveau crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.  Marie-Claire souhaiterait acheter des mèches, des produits cosmétiques et pour les cheveux.  Marie-Claire a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits d’Alidé et elle a bien remboursé tous.
texts.en:
Marie-Claire T. was born on August 8th, 1972 in Porto-Novo, the capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to Midjohodo André Hounsou; he is a chauffeur and also drives large trucks. Marie-Claire is the mother of one daughter, who is attending school. They live in Cotonou, a large city in Benin.

Marie-Claire is a hair dresser. She owns a hair salon where she operates her business. She also sells cloth and beauty products. She would like to ask for a new loan to increase her working capital. Marie-Claire hopes to buy hair extensions, cosmetics and hair products. She has previously received three loans from Alidé and she fully reimbursed all of them.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, cloth, beauty and hair products.

loans.name: Walter Kon Group

texts.es: El grupo “Walter Khon” esta representado por la señora Virginia Eugenia y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en sus pagos. En general las socias se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios como la venta de pollo, ropa, zapatos, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, caramelos, frutas y al transporte público de pasajeros. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias y mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. Dentro del grupo existen socios nuevos pero que conocen la modalidad de créditos solidarios y son gente responsable, honesta y con ganas de trabajar.
texts.en:
The group “Walter Khon” is led by Virginia Eugenia and is composed of 13 members who are in the third loan cycle and have been responsible and honest in making their payments. Generally the members run different types of businesses in the sale of chicken, clothing, shoes, groceries at neighborhood stores, candies, fruits, and public transportation. The loan will be used to acquire materials, supplies, and tools that will help the group generate higher incomes; their families depend on this income and it will afford them a better quality of life. The group has some new members but they are familiar with the loan system and solidarity groups and they are responsible, honest, and hard working people.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital.

loans.name: Bolivar Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, “Los Andes” se encuentra un grupo de señoras que se hacen llamar “Bolivar”, ya que todas pertenecen al equipo de fútbol paceño que lleva el mismo nombre, se agruparon hace aproximadamente 3 años, por la necesidad de contar con capital de trabajo que les permita iniciar o mejorar sus negocios y así incrementar sus ingresos que les permita una mejor calidad de vida para ellas y sus familias.
Ahora todas tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos, venta de mantas, venta de calzados, venta de yuca y confección de chamarras y necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería.
A ellas también les gusta compartir, así que se organizan para saborear un “Apthapi” (cada una prepara comida y trae para compartirlo con el grupo).
texts.en:
In “Los Andes” one of Pro Mujer’s local centers, meets a group of women that call themselves “Bolivar” since they all belong to the La Paz football team which takes the same name.
